story:
Stuffed Pepper Taco topped with Feta Cheese


Sarasota Food Scene

As we  are all aware Sarasota is jam packed with wonderful restaurants to go to for dinner, and new places are popping up all the time. On the flip side there are very few places that put emphasis on providing lunch, and there definitely aren't enough lunch delivery options.

We estimated a long time ago that the bulk of our yearly revenue will come from lunch crowds because of our proximity to thousands of employees working in the downtown area, and even more importantly because of the seasonal shifts that happen in Florida every year.

We have already started the lunch delivery phase from our previous location with a great success, and at this point we hope to spread the word of our new spot. We want to specialize in lunch catering for all the many business meetings that are taking place every day, as well as those business professionals that want to get together in their office and... travel the world...in a few bites. 

Kebob Pocket with Fire Roasted Pepper Chutney and Tzaziki Sauce

Our Food

It could be described in one, albeit a long sentence, that goes something like this:

"You can enjoy a meal at our place every day, have a variety of things, be healthy, enjoy delicious dishes and be full, like eating real food back in the day kind of full; all along experiencing different flavor profiles of our world, oh and it's fun, the way food should be, food should be fun!"

We make everything from scratch. Everything! All our sauce, as well as all of our own condiments. We are particularly proud of our specially crafted lemonades.

Half of our menu is vegetarian and there are plenty of vegan friendly and gluten free dishes.

Getting the freshest and seasonal ingredients for our dishes is very important to us. Establishing relationships with our local farmers, and being part of their success, also very important. Giving our hard earned money to some gigantic passionless corporation...not so much!

From our experience, lunch time patrons are looking for five basic things:

1. Speed…employees on lunch breaks have a limited time, and World Bites Kafe menu is specifically designed to be able to produce restaurant quality dishes at a fast pace, by a highly trained staff.

2. Affordability…because of our low overhead and low food cost we will have very competitive prices, particularly considering the restaurant quality of our dishes.

3. Quality…World Bites Kafe dishes are not only made with freshest and authentic ingredients (from local purveyors), but also according to original recipes.

4. Diversity…with a diverse and unique menu World Bites Kafe customers will have a choice of very different dishes from different regions of the world for every day of the week.

5. Healthy Options...more than half of our menu is vegetarian friendly and we have over a dozen vegan dishes, as well as many gluten free options.

Greek Yogurt Crepe with a Berry Medley and Pecan Dust

Kafe@Night

Besides the lunch availability that we will provide for the Sarasota community, we will also have monthly internationally themed events at our location, as well as other locations, and some are going to be pretty cool and unique (check out the video). These will be night events that will allow us to expand our menu and really provide us an opportunity to showcase our passion for food, and our cultural variety.

We will feature different regions of the world or different countries that we or that our customers are fans of. Alongside the multitude of dishes we will also showcase other cultural aspects of the featured region, in the form of art, dance and music, or something that makes that particular part of the world unique. All in all, we want to have some good food, good time with our good friends, and making some new ones.

Korean Bulgogi topped with pickled Daikon & Carrots and a Spicy Sesame Sauce

World Bites Passport*

"Passport"- an official document issued by a governing body of World Bites, certifying the holder's identity and citizenship and entitling them to travel the culinary world under its protection from other restaurants and food joints.

World Bites Passport* is a membership club booklet with different levels of participation.

"Backpacker"- Each member gets their own World Bites Passport (booklet). Which gains you entry and free food at our "Kafe@Night" internationally themed food parties. Members also get special membership pricing on all our products, taste of our specials and a monthly newsletter.

"World Traveler"- At this level, not only do you enjoy all the "Backpacker" stuff, but we really make you a part of our world, and you get to eat as chefs eat. We set up scrumptious tastings every month for our World Travelers, and you are also privy to dishes that are not on the menu.


Whats next?

May: Make a lot of IndieGoGo friends and honor the perks that we promised. At the same time get all the appropriate licensing and the rest of the governmental bureaucracy out of the way. Have a pre-remodel Kafe@Night party!!!

June: Finish all the new equipment install, and remodeling the Kafe. It's gonna be so comfy that you will want to come and hang out! Have a post-remodel Kafe@Night party!!!

July: Complete the training of the staff and implement the marketing tools and traveling the world...in a few bites full steam at this point!

Chimichurri Burger smothered with Manchego Cheese

What is the money for you ask...

As you can imagine opening a restaurant (or in this case a Kafe) is anything but cheap. At this point the entire project is getting funded by yours truly and funds are getting low. All the funds are going to the following:

Remodeling - $3,200

Furniture - $1,900

Signage - $1,230

Equipment - $3,300

Inventory - $2,000

Small-wares (pans/plates/cups/etc) - $900

Advertising and marketing - $2,100

Indiegogo and other fees -$2,750

Perks costs - $2,000

Blue Poppy Seed Strudel

What is World Bites anyway?

The concept of World Bites is...peasant and street food from around the globe. Some of the best dishes ever created have been made by common people, using the simplest ingredients and a lot of love. Those dishes have been perfected over time and today we would like to honor those people and share them with you.

World Bites LLC saw its start in 2009 at Farmers Markets on the streets of downtown Sarasota…Siesta Key…Bradenton. The demand for the food was instantaneous, and what was a humble start with providing food for hundreds of people grew quickly to thousands at such venues as music concerts, food festivals and food truck rallies.

In the recent history we have expanded into lunch delivery for the local businesses and with that attracted a whole new demographic.

At this point it is apparent that the commercial kitchen we were sharing isn’t big enough, nor convenient enough for our customers to get to. Another major drawback with it, is the lack of seating, and our customers are demanding a dining area.

With that in mind we have found a location that meets all our needs. It is conveniently located on 5119 North Tamiami Trail, Sarasota 34234, and is surrounded by major colleges of the area…Ringling College and New College…as well as numerous restaurants and a vibrant business area.

The new location will be called World Bites Kafe where we will offer a wide variety of authentic international dishes, and unique world cuisine fusion dishes. We will also provide Turkish coffee, and our own homemade soft drinks including lemonade with variety of flavors. (Yes there will be a whole menu of different flavors of lemonades!!)

Ginger Fruit Salad & Honey Basil Lemonade

Our Mission

The main objective of World Bites is to interlock citizens of the world, and break down whatever barriers there may be. One of the most ubiquitous ways this can be done is through portrayal of different cuisines each region of the globe has to offer.

Our overall goals are to provide excellent customer service and consistent product that our patrons can rely on time and time again. At the same time we want to get people interested in other cultures around the world, and maybe in some cases remind them of their own.

Our Hope

We hope that everyone who takes time to read this and watches our video to support us in any way they feel they can. Be it a donation and receiving a fun pledge from us, or simply letting others know about our mission to create a "Cultural Oasis", as our fans call us. :)

This means sharing our food philosophy, keeping ourselves and our staff educated about the products we use, and enthusiastically offering that knowledge to our patrons. In this way, we hope to build a community of diners who care about their food and where it came from. And at the same time creating a healthy business, healthy community, and a healthier planet.
Thank You!!!

-Team Kafe-


Reasons for success...

In the last five years we most definitely have had our fair share of challenges. We watched our business grow and now we are ready to take the next step.

I personally have been in the food business for almost two decades now, and I held every position possible—in "the front of the house" as well as in "the back of the house". I am kind of like that Man vs Food guy, minus the huge appetite of course.
I've worked in crazy busy diners of New York, and that was before the computerized POS systems!
I also worked in fine dining restaurants where I learned some of the most valuable lessons in developing flavor profiles, and appreciating the ingredients that I use today in order to share my culinary story.

Even more essentially, in my career I opened 6 restaurants (4 private and 2 corporate). I have been a part of team in a build-out stage a number of times and there were some daunting tasks that we faced.
I also worked at places that unfortunately went out of business. I saw firsthand what mistakes were being made, and more importantly I realized what was not being done.

There are many reason why restaurant business has such a high failure rate, but if knowledge of gastronomy, hospitality business and marketing are present within the company the likelihood of success will truly skyrocket. All those components are definitely present within our crew at World Bites Kafe.

We have a team that has nearly a half of a century of collective hospitality experience, vast marketing and digital media knowledge, massive networking prowess and a classically trained chef.

Finally and most importantly we have hard core fans, who believe in our mission of bringing authentic flavors from around the world to our community. The kind of fans that have traveled and traveled to be with us at so many events that we did over the years, and who are now patiently waiting for our new location.

A special THANK YOU goes out to you, from the bottom of our hearts, and the bottom of our pots! :)

Greek Feta Pie and a Serbian Guy

story:
Short Summary

Crowdful is an interactive guide (ebook, book and web) intended for entrepreneurs and small business owners who can substantially benefit from leveraging the power of the crowd.  



As a professor of entrepreneurship and former head of the SBA in NY, NJ & PR, I am surprised by the amount of aspiring or current entrepreneurs who are either not aware of the concepts of crowdfunding or crowdsourcing, or that see them as exercises that require an investment in resources that only medium or large sized companies can afford.

In fact, small businesses and startups can benefit even more from the crowd than bigger companies.   In this interactive guide, which I started drafting for my entrepreneurship students, I expand on the benefits, tools and successes of crowd campaigns, including crowdfunding (both equity and non-equity), crowdlending, and crowdsourcing.  

As my research expands, and the length of the guide becomes more robust, I have decided to do what I preach and launch this crowdfunding campaign so that I can bring this valuable information to as many aspiring entrepreneurs as possible.   

Your contribution to this campaign will help us develop a much better guide, since we need to hire a copywriter, a copyeditor, a book layout designer and programmer to put all this information in an easy to digest format, which will also have a web-enhanced component where our readers can share success stories, ideas, suggestions and also failures from which they have learned.  

For our many friends in Puerto Rico and the US who prefer a Spanish guide, vamos a publicar simultáneamente la guía en español :-)

What We Need & What You Get

Our intent is to raise $3,500 to pay for the following services required to have a guide of superb quality.   Since my strength is in the knowledge of he entrepreneurial components, not on publishing mechanisms, we plan to hire the following supporters to take the project to completion by June of this year:

1) Copywriter ($700-1000)

2) Copyeditor ($500-1000)

3) Book designer (cover and layout) ($500)

4) Programmer, to set the web-based version of the guide ($1000)

5) Assistant translator, to help me with the Spanish version ($800)

Should the entire goal not be reached, we would concentrate on hiring on those areas that are most essential to a good output, such as the book layout and cover design and copyediting. (I could edit myself, but those who know say that is equivalent to a doctor performing surgery on a close family member, not recommended :).

The Impact

Hopefully, Crowdful will inspire many entrepreneurs to take their idea from a concept to execution, and find faster, easier or better ways to solve unmet needs of consumers everywhere.  

Risks & Challenges

There is always the risk that we will not achieve the goal and therefore will be unable to produce the high quality guide that we hope.   Nonetheless, irrespective of the amount raised, we will make sure to share with all contributors all the information gathered about crowdfunding and crowdsourcing,  so that you can benefit from these excellent tools.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute monetarily, that doesn't mean you can't help. In fact, we would really value your assistance in any of the following ways:

  • Get the word out about our campaign by using Indiegogo's share tools.
  • Connect to my website, www.silvapuras.com for updates.

Thank you so much for your attention and support!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Since opening in 2011, AZ Body Therapy has grown quite a bit over the years.  We have been voted "The Best of Glendale" for 3 consecutive years and are looking forward to many more! However, we are now at an impasse. We need to expand and "perk up" the shop if we are to continue our exponential growth! 

AZ Body Therapy has multiple licensed massage therapists who are dedicated to assisting our clients with their overall health and wellness goals.  We are passionate about our profession and would love the opportunity to share it with many more people!

The funds we raise will allow us to remodel, upgrade our equipment, as well as add more products and services to our valued customers!


What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $6,000.00 USD.  The money will be used to add soundproofing to our treatment rooms (for much quieter, more relaxing sessions), remodel the restroom as it is quite outdated, repaint, and purchase new treatment tables.  The funds will also be used to purchase better products for our retail space that will benefit our clients in between sessions.


The Impact

Your contributions will help us to further our dream of helping our community and expanding to work hand-in-hand with medical professionals such as physicians and surgeons. 

Risks & Challenges

AZ BodyTherapy was started on just a dream with no funding! We have made it 4 years now and are excited to push forward!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Your contributions would be greatly appreciated in any amount!  We understand, though, that not everyone is able to donate monetarily.  Come on down and check us out! Tell your friends and family about us! Spread the word of what Great Work we are doing for the stressed, achy, tired, weary people of Arizona!

The Impact
 Your contributions will help us to further our dream of helping our community and expanding to work hand-in-hand with medical professionals such as physicians and surgeons.  
  Risks & ChallengesAZ BodyTherapy was started on just a dream with no funding! We have made it 4 years now and are excited to push forward!    Other Ways You Can HelpYour contributions would be greatly appreciated in any amount!  We understand, though, that not everyone is able to donate monetarily.  Come on down and check us out! Tell your friends and family about us! Spread the word of what Great Work we are doing for the stressed, achy, tired, weary people of Arizona!

story:
Short Summary

We are Que's  Lounge... an upscale gathering venue in the heart of Gary, Indiana.   A beautiful and warm place where you can connect with old friends,  make new friends and build memories that will last for a lifetime. Since opening in November 2014,   Que's  Lounge remains vested in the revitalization of the city's economic growth.  Our efforts to provide a premium nightlife experience in Gary will require us to raise 15,000 to develop the city's first sophisticated outdoor space.

What We Need & What You Get

Our vision is to have a sophisticated outdoor oasis showcasing a beautiful landscaped layout while offering premium dining and cocktail services.  By night it will transform into a contemporary chic lounge and outdoor patio oasis that is safe for mature people to socialize.  Your pledge will help us offset the cost of designing and constructing a beautiful outdoor atmosphere adjacent to our existing lounge.  For your financial support we like to say THANK YOU with a little gift.  Please select from the list of rewards below according to your pledge level.  ***** ( IMAGE GALLERY )

 The Impact

Being from Northwest Indiana and witnessing the economic decline of the community,  it was important for us to return to the city to invest in and help revitalize the city's economic structure.  In our short existence, Que's Lounge has been instrumental in partnering with community service organizations and alumni associations by providing fundraising support and a free meeting area.  With strong support from the City of Gary, our expanded venue space will allow us to increase our capacity in assisting more organizations and the community.

Risks & Challenges

Built in the 1930's, our existing building required a complete rehab which presented its share of challenges.  Due to the extensive rehab project, we have nearly exhausted our building allowance.  Our new area will require an extensive demolition and construction.  A leading regional architectural construction company will help to minimize the risks and challenges that we face.

 Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help by spreading the word about our campaign.  It's easy, simply share our video and link to our fundraising page.  Please share via social media  outlets ( Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Indiegogo, emails, &  word of mouth ).  No pledge is too small but think BIG!


Thanks in advance

story:
I.  Introduction

1.  Transparency

For those who are not family or friends and don't know me, I want to assure you that your contributions will be used to support constructing My English Center in Xieng Khouag, Lao PDR. I realize that sometimes people are reluctant to give because they don't know if their contributions will reach the right people, especially given the mismanagement of funds that occur after large scale demanded. That is why I think you should know a little about me so you can contribute knowing that your money will be put to the best use. A promise to use the money to construct My English Center to who really need the most and a very transparent accounting of the money spent.

2.  Who Is the founder of My English Center

My name is Chao Yang. I am the founder of My English Center. I was born in 1984 in a remote area call “BOUA MOUK” about 30 km from Luang Prabang. I was orphaned at a very young age. My father passed away when I was 3 years old. I grew up in a poor Hmong family, the last of 5 children and the only one in the family who could go to school.

I began school in 1991. From home to school, I had to walk minimum 2-4 hours to school and return home through mountains, rivers, and valleys every day. My mother sometime had to go with me to school because there was no student by this time. She waited for me outside and sewed her clothes until the class ended at 4 pm. We had to walk back home with no light. We sometime arrived home when our neighbors had already gone to bed.

Because of the distance from home to school, my family decided to send me to school near Luang Prabang two years later. I made the journey by walking; there was no road at the time. It was a six-hour trip, and I didn’t see my family again for nine months.

I stayed with a cousin in Luang Prabagn. At around four o’clock every morning, I had to get up to prepare our breakfast. I made the fire and put a pot to steam rice on it. I opened my lesson and memorized my lessons in front of the fire because there was no lamp/lighter at this time. At first I was very unhappy and homesick, and sometimes I cried.

In 1999, I finished high school and wanted to continue to the National University of Laos, but this was financially impossible due to my mother’s death. So after high school, I worked for a while as a tour guide at a trekking company but my abilities in English language were very limited. I wanted to learn more but could not afford to continue my studies. I was very fortunate that two of the foreign visitors in a trekking party offered to pay for my studies at Lao-American College. With their continued support I recently graduated with a Bachelor in Business Management on 29 March, 2013.

This is a video clip in Hmong with English subtitle.

3.  Lao PDR.

Lao PDR is the heaviest bombed country per capita in history (http://www.magamerica.org).  It is an area that was heavily bombed by the US during the "secret" part of the Vietnam War, and there are still bomb craters on the land. It is located in Southeast Asia and has a small population, but a large number of young, innocent people living in the darkness of illiteracy. The Lao PDR has the lowest education ranking among ASEAN countries. 

4.  My English Center

Was formed in November 2013, trying to inspire English acquisition among villagers just outside of Luang Prabang city. My English Center is planning to register as a non-profit Charity Project and committed to improving opportunities for young people through English study and aims to enhance opportunities for careers in the business and tourism sectors.

Luang Prabang is the previous home of the Lao Royal King and today is a World Heritage City as well as the 2015 Top City and Wanderlust Travel Award winner.  Huge amounts of money flow into Luang  Prabang every year, but without the ability to speak English, a person’s opportunities are very limited.

5.  But we need your help!

I desperately want to help the people of my community, and with the Lao PDR joining the Asian Economic Community (AEC) next year, there is no time to waste.  Without skills in the international language (English), the children of the Lao PDR won’t be able to compete and are destined to remain poor.

But my budget is tight, and although my research has been thorough, I cannot do this on my own. I am planning to raise the first $55,000 of its $250,000 budget to start this school as soon as possible. It will be constructed on a total of 10,000 square meters in Phieng Luang village, Phou Kout District, Xieng Khouang Province (https://goo.gl/maps/R7zG6) where Laos' Plain of Jars - the next UNESCO World Heritage site. (http://travel-lao-isaan.blogspot.com/2010/01/laos-plain-of-jars-next-unesco-world.html)


Your generous contribution will aid My English Center in many ways and will go towards purchasing as below: 

  • A license: 5,000$.
  • Labor: 12,000$.
  • Materials to construct the first part of school: 25,000$.
  • Books and equipments: 11,000$

1. US$5 contribution can purchase a piece of steel. 

2. US$10 contribution can purchase 52 bricks. 

3. US$ 30 contribution can purchase 5 packs of cement.


    4. US$50 contribution can purchase 25 tiles 

    5. US$ 100 contribution can purchase 5 trucks of gravel.


6.  What We Need and What You Get! 

You will receive several gifts from us as our way of saying thanks, but we don’t want this to seem like we’re selling something.  And we know that your motivation to help is not to receive anything from us.  So it will just have to stay a surprise. Please take a few minutes to look on the right side and choose your favorite one to contribute.

1. A special T-Shirt with My English Center LOGO on it so that you can wear to show others how you helped make history. We’re going to use top quality cotton. So it’ll be comfortable to wear. Your name will be recorded and Pictures of school constructing steps are going to send to you step by E-mail.

2. A handwritten thank you card made by the children and Hmong hand made blanket  mailed to the address you provide with local stamps. Your name will be recorded and Pictures of school constructing steps are going to send to you by E-mail.



  • Your Contributions will directly benefit our needs:

We guarantee that 100% of all donations will go towards our dream of making this school a reality. Please inform us so we can acknowledge your generosity on our Facebook page and in our annual report, and measure the effectiveness of our work to support valuable projects in the future.

  • You can donate directly to us by VISA Card  to BCEL, Lao PDR > Chao Yang; 4705 3200 2016 1768 or by PayPal to lajlimtswvyimhmoob@hotmail.com

7.  Why Should My English Center be built.

The Lao PDR currently does not have any standardized education system, but I would like to change that. I would like Lao PDR to have an organized education system on par with America, Britain, Italy, Australia and Japan.

I would like to change a story of Laos from a country where people rarely speak English into a country that everyone can speak excellent English by building My English Center and extend it to the whole country.


November 2014, as part of my work to develop a business plan for the English language school, I conducted a survey with 200 residents of Phou Kout district, Xieng Khuang Province: 78 were high school students, 35 business and shop owners, 28 teachers, 13 officers, and 46 others. I learned that there are about 5,000 students in 4 public high schools but have very limited access to English classes – only 2 hours a week. I also learned that many boys’ best option is to become a novice at a temple.  Sometimes on weekend, many of students who come from different rural area will have to stay at their small own house (dormitory) at school. What they (girls) have to do before and after school or free time is to sew in order to have some money to buy their study materials. Besides that, they have to find firewood, food (fishing along rivers and get natural plants around firm field) and cook for themselves while boys are working hard digging channels to get some money.

Very few have the skills to work at restaurants, hotels, or trekking agencies and without the financial means to continue school, many just quit and work with their families. 

Therefore many give up hope of ever finishing high school or going to college to continue their education and get stuck at this point. Many students leave school with sadness when they realize that their parents cannot support them for further studies and they have to leave school without the education necessary to get a decent job.

This is a problem especially for young girls who do not have the same flexibility as boys to find a job or on-the-job training.


I personally have great difficulty seeing poor children, and especially those who have lost their parents at a very young age.  There are a lot of people who are very angry, but can say nothing to anyone.  That is just how things are. I think if you look at those older people today complaining about their parents who do not allow them to go to school. But this is not what I wanted to focus on. What I really want to focus on are the children who are living right now and work to make sure that in their future, they will not be trapped in the darkness of illiteracy.

There is currently a serious shortage of employable workers in the Lao PDR.  And people are hesitant to build factories here because if a person can’t read, then they can’t learn how to do a job.  I am committed to changing that by partnering with the government, individuals, NGOs or others.

8.  Statistic

Many poor students cannot continue to higher education levels because they lack money and if they drop-out it can be very difficult for them to find jobs. When families do not have enough money to support their children at school, they tell their children to drop out of school which is illustrated by the Ministry of Education statistics for

  • 2011-2012, showing that enrollment rates dropped from 69,934 at the Primary school level to 27,659 at the Secondary school level, and then dropped even further to only 10,573 High School students in Xieng Khouang Province.
  • 2012-2013: 42,317 at the Primary school level, 23,576 at the Secondary school level, 10,344 High School students in Xieng Khouang Province. 

Many high school graduates cannot enter college or university because of lack of funds; therefore many give up hope of ever going to college to continue their education and get stuck at this point.

II.  Call For Action

1.  School Started

In November of 2013, we started teaching a free class in a Hmong village on the outskirts of Luang Prabang, named Ban Khouathi nung (Village by the first bridge). Through a temporary arrangement, the village is allowing us to use an area as a classroom. During the first week about 10 students came to the class. They were so excited to study English. One girl carried her baby sister to the class. We started at 4:30 pm and ended when they could no longer see when it got dark.  There were no fans or electricity installed in the classroom.

We successfully raised US$2,789 by Dec 19th, 2013. Due to a recently announced government regulation, public schools are not to be used by any private parties, so we built a small classroom out of wood and bamboo.  We had electricity installed, bought a projector, 10 sets of tables and benches, and a white board.

There were 24 primary school students, 14 high school students, and 3 university teachers attending at My English Center now and they were getting much better in English after studying at MEC for about 18 months.  During this time, we invited local teachers and visitors to Luang Prabang to come and teach at the school to give the students the opportunity to be exposed to different accents.

Most of the students are from relatively poor backgrounds but through the foundation are given the same chance as other young people to develop English skills and benefit from the opportunities that will arise as Laos develops.


2. Objevtive.

MEC (My English Center) is a unique environment where boys and girls can study, develop their minds, gain confidence and play sports together. With this purpose, the Foundation provides free English study for young people in Luang Prabang and a platform to practice language and hospitality skills. In the future, we will also offer computer skills and free Internet access to support young people’s studies.

MEC hosts inspirational guest speakers and arranges field trips to local attractions, encouraging young people to contribute to and learn about their community. Another goal of MEC is to give students the opportunity to develop service skills by volunteering within the local community. Working with local and international organizations, MEC strives to increase career opportunities in hospitality, tourism, teaching and industry.

MEC also aims to support and train local teachers, improving general teaching skills within the community and running corporate English training programs for local businesses and film makers.

MEC provides instruction to high school, college/university students for international tests, such as IELT and TOEFL, so that they can apply for opportunities to continue studying and win scholarships to study abroad.

The result will be that under-privileged students will be able to continue their education and, with their ability to speak English, they will be in a much better position to get a good job. We will especially target girls as they have a more difficult time getting an education and finding decent work in our society.


3. The Impact

The question I always ask me is that what choice who we want to be in next 20 years? Do we accept the society that only a few of us can do spectacularly well or will we commit ourselves to society that everyone could extremely be literately and depend on ourselves instead of other outsides’ help? 

Since My English Center was created, there have been several travelers who visited Luang Prabang, the World Heritage city, spend their free time to teach English at my English Center as below.

1)  8 Nov, 2013 Seth Tuler a professor at Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI), Massachusetts, US considered as the first guest teacher joined My English Center by the time it was started.

2)  In February 2014, two Canadian Travelers  Tyler Mahn and Paul Hrycyk joined an English class at My English Center during their visiting Luang Prabang.

3)  13 March, 2014 Two American sisters Tracy Brown and Tiffany Brown visited my English Center.

4)  24 April 2014, two young Australian travelers spent 4 hours talking to students at My English Center. 

5)  April 2014,  Jeffugee Jahkrovsky an American teacher from Indian, US participated 2 hours English class. 

6)  27 May, 2014 Lindsay Selin a young American lady in Vermont, US and Sortiris, a Grekk businessman brought a dinner to My English Center and had meal with my students after the class.

7) 26 July, 2014 Soleyne Nanoucha Maryam Jsni Louaï Gmi Tristan Terisse Jérémy Coste Antoine Dubois; A yong groug of French architecture joined a four hours English class.

8)  31 December, 2014  Seth Tuler a professor at the Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI), Massachusetts, US joined a class for the second time.

9)  5 January, 2015 Kerrie Eaton and her Australian family visited Luang Prabang and went to teach at My English Center.

10) Fabienne Miller, an American professor at the  Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI), Massachusetts, US and her daughter are visiting Luang Prabang from 8-13 March, 2015  spent some time to teach English to students at My English Center.

This is a short video describing the true life story of Mr. Chao Yang in Hmong with English subtitle. 


3. Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by spreading this message out to other people who you know and ask them to do the same. Ask them to see the campaign at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/my-english-center--2 or find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/pages/My-English-Center/623511991023591?directed_target_id=0

  You can visit this charity project yourself during http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luang_Prabang trip. You'll even get a chance to tell the class a bit about yourself - it's great practice for them to hear people speaking English with different accents and to learn more about life where you come from.

  THANK YOU!!!

Additional Videos:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CAt5gETl1pU&feature=player_detailpage
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fBOdTgOUBZQ&amp...

 There were no fans or electricity installed in the classroom.
We
successfully raised US$2,789 by Dec 19th, 2013. Due to a recently announced
government regulation, public schools are not to be used by any private
parties, so we built a small classroom out of wood and bamboo.  We had
electricity installed, bought a projector, 10 sets of tables and benches, and a
white board.
There were 24
primary school students, 14 high school students, and 3 university teachers
attending at My English Center now and they were getting much better in English
after studying at MEC for about 18 months.  During this time, we invited
local teachers and visitors to Luang Prabang to come and teach at the school to
give the students the opportunity to be exposed to different accents.
Most of the
students are from relatively poor backgrounds but through the foundation are
given the same chance as other young people to develop English skills and
benefit from the opportunities that will arise as Laos develops.2. Objevtive.

MEC (My
English Center) is a unique environment where boys and girls can study, develop
their minds, gain confidence and play sports together. With this purpose, the
Foundation provides free English study for young people in Luang Prabang and a
platform to practice language and hospitality skills. In the future, we will
also offer computer skills and free Internet access to support young people’s
studies.
MEC hosts
inspirational guest speakers and arranges field trips to local attractions,
encouraging young people to contribute to and learn about their community.
Another goal of MEC is to give students the opportunity to develop service
skills by volunteering within the local community. Working with local and
international organizations, MEC strives to increase career opportunities in
hospitality, tourism, teaching and industry.
MEC also aims
to support and train local teachers, improving general teaching skills within
the community and running corporate English training programs for local
businesses and film makers. 
MEC provides
instruction to high school, college/university students for international
tests, such as IELT and TOEFL, so that they can apply for opportunities to
continue studying and win scholarships to study abroad. 
The result
will be that under-privileged students will be able to continue their education
and, with their ability to speak English, they will be in a much better
position to get a good job. We will especially target girls as they have a more
difficult time getting an education and finding decent work in our society.
3. The Impact
The question I
always ask me is that what choice who we want to be in next 20 years? Do we
accept the society that only a few of us can do spectacularly well or will we
commit ourselves to society that everyone could extremely be literately and
depend on ourselves instead of other outsides’ help? 
Since My
English Center was created, there have been several travelers who visited Luang
Prabang, the World Heritage city, spend their free time to teach English at my
English Center as below.
1)  8
Nov, 2013 Seth Tuler a professor at Worcester
Polytechnic Institute (WPI), Massachusetts, US considered as the first
guest teacher joined My English Center by the time it was started. 
2)  In
February 2014, two Canadian Travelers  Tyler Mahn and Paul Hrycyk joined an English
class at My English Center during their visiting Luang Prabang.
3)  13
March, 2014 Two American sisters Tracy Brown and Tiffany Brown visited my English
Center. 
4)  24
April 2014, two young Australian travelers spent 4 hours talking to students at
My English Center.  
5)  April
2014,  Jeffugee
Jahkrovsky an American teacher from Indian, US participated 2 hours English
class.  
6)  27
May, 2014 Lindsay Selin a
young American lady in Vermont, US and Sortiris, a Grekk businessman brought a
dinner to My English Center and had meal with my students after the class. 
7) 26 July, 2014 Soleyne Nanoucha Maryam Jsni Louaï Gmi Tristan Terisse Jérémy Coste Antoine Dubois; A yong
groug of French architecture joined a four hours English class. 
8)  31
December, 2014  Seth Tuler a professor at the Worcester Polytechnic Institute
(WPI), Massachusetts, US joined a class for the second time. 
9)  5
January, 2015 Kerrie Eaton and her Australian family visited Luang Prabang and went to teach
at My English Center.
10) Fabienne Miller, an
American professor at the  Worcester Polytechnic Institute
(WPI), Massachusetts, US and her daughter are visiting Luang Prabang from
8-13 March, 2015  spent some time to teach English to students at My
English Center. 
This is a
short video describing the true life story of Mr. Chao Yang in Hmong with
English subtitle. 3. Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help
by spreading this message out to other people who you know and ask them to do
the same. Ask them to see the campaign at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/my-english-center--2
or find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/pages/My-English-Center/623511991023591?directed_target_id=0

  You can visit
this charity project yourself during http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luang_Prabang
trip. You'll even get a chance to tell the class a bit about yourself - it's
great practice for them to hear people speaking English with different accents
and to learn more about life where you come from. 
 
THANK YOU!!! 
Additional Videos: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CAt5gETl1pU&feature=player_detailpage
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fBOdTgOUBZQ&amp...
campaign_city: Luang Prabang, Lao People's Democratic Republic

story:
About

I am Kandhamal from a small village called vasudevanallur in Tamil Nadu, India. My husband is farmer, we are from agricultural field. Due to absence of rain, we don't have regular income, we don't have enough income to survive. I am skilled in Crafts making, especially in making decorative cushions but we don't have enough money to start this business. If i get $7000 - $8000 US dollars, it will help to start cushion making business, as well as giving employment to women in our Village. Our family is in economically critical situation, i really appreciate any donation. Please help me.

Sorry for any grammatical errors.

Cushion Designs





What i need and what you get.

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need $7000-$8000 US dollars to start cushion making business.
  • If you donate $200, you will get one cushion shipped to you.
  • If i get less than $7000, it will still help me to survive as well as trying to start this business 

The Impact

  • There are not many decorative cushions for sale in the world. Your donation will help to start a new one.
  • Your donation will help unemployed women in our village to get employed in my business.

The Challenge

  • Making cushions is not like a normal job you see, it is a form of art and craft. Only if you have full passion and desire for this, you can do this.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can donate, please share this with your friends, it really helps me.
  • Spread out the word.


Contact info:

Address:

Kandhamal

No. 4, north car street, vasudevanallur, Tirunelveli district, Pincode-627758

Tamil Nadu, India.

Phone number: 91-8925195549

story:
Women in Business Congress.

Join our movement to empower women in technology!!!

We're a nonprofit on a mission to empower & unite all women in Technology and Innovation! Help us create a mind-blowing event on 2nd March in Barcelona, Spain and start a movement to increase the number of women in Technology.

Who we are

Women in Business Congress organizes innovative congresses for Business Women, Corporate Women, Entrepreneurs and Young Talent in Technology & Innovation. Our congresses focus on providing insights on future trends in the international business world, winning strategies and latest opportunities.

Our mission

Women in Business Congress wants to promote women in Technology & Innovation, encourage them to be successful entrepreneurs and IT-businesswomen and build awareness on the importance of women in Technology & Innovation. We are pushing all known boundaries by developing and implementing new business ideas that go beyond cultures and sectors.

With our unique Women in Business Congress we bring women in technology with an international focus to one platform, to curb the challenges being faced by business and enhance their knowledge, competencies, competitiveness and create alliances.

Our impact

Our previous two congresses brought together more than 300 women from 42 different countries. Speakers from the largest companies, CEOs and senior executives shared their insights at a one-day congress on current business challenges and growth. The congresses created the ability for these women to get inspired and create new business deals and enhance existing relationships with other professional women.

Why contribute?

If you also believe in the importance of women in technology and want to be part of our movement to create awareness on the business case for women in technology, join us now! With your support you can be part of a high impact event, and help our association to keep us moving forward and grow in the coming years. 

What are we asking from you?

We want to raise at least € 10.000 and reach out to 10.000 women across the world. With your help we can continue to organize these trailblazing events, and spread out concept around the world. By sharing our campaign, donating to the project, or support us with one of the crowdfunding packages, we can spread the word about the importance of women in technology beyond our own reach.

Where are the funds going?

The donated funds will be used to organize the congress.

€ 6,500 Speakers costs
€ 3,500 Publicity and public relations

If we raise more money than our initial goal, we use the remaining amount as starting capital to support our other initiative. An Application for business women around the world. This Application connect business women from around the world to connect with one another. The App is an online community designed to grow business and a catalyst that unlocks global opportunities and provides economic growth. 

How else can you participate?

Beyond contributing to our crowdfunding campaign, we invite you to participate in creating a Women in Business Congress community. Support us and leave a comment on our community wall on the website or click to tweet our phrases/blog and otherwise spread the word!

Risks and challenges

We have invested extensive time, funds and effort to organize previous congresses in 2013 & 2014 and to create awareness about our initiative,

Should this Indiegogo campaign be successful, we will move mountains to make sure that our second congress in 2015 is organized. 

Although the amount that we are asking for this campaign is small, we hope that you help us achieve our full budget so that we continue with our movement. And the lovely thing about any Indiegogo campaign is that working together with all of you makes this entire project special and exclusive.

Spread the Word!


After pledging your support, please help to spread the word about this project by sharing this link with your contacts.

Thank you for your support!


Spread the word!

Share the campaign on Facebook, Tweet about us, and follow us on LinkedIn!

Linkedin: Women in Business Congress

Twitter: @Womeninbusinesscongress

Facebook: Women in Business Congress

With your help, we can organize a great event, empower more than 150 women in Techonology and create awareness about our initiative.

Let’s join forces to show the world that what we are capable of and do it!

Thank you for your willingness to be part our Globallyze movement!

Questions

If you have questions or would like to help in some other way, please email info@womeninbusinesscongress.com

story:
Short Summary

We stand for true democracy. If the majority want something, then that's what our politicians should deliver. We are sick of politicians being elected and then ignoring the views of the majority in favor of political correctness.

Our goal is to establish our website as a platform for mini referendums on important issues on a local, state, and federal level. Our users will be able to create referendums for issues important to them, then people from their electorate will be able to vote.

In some ways it will be similar to 'change.org' but it will be able to deliver real, usable data to our politicians.

100% of the funds will be used for the development of the website.

Risks & Challenges

None that we can think of.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.
