story: I was 20 years old when my mother passed. It was the hardest thing to comprehend, still is. The best part about my mother stemmed from her duty to help people. No matter who you were or where you came from she would give you her last. I learned that humility through observation. I also learned my way around the kitchen, with music and laughter abound. I have worked all over the country and sung across the seas. I want to continue the legacy of my mothers giving nature of food and add my spice of music and love to it. For as long as I can remember I've wanted to own something that people would come to and always leave with a smile and that people would recommend. This cafe will be the start of a beautiful adventure.  My cafe will consist of food that will make you feel good, and music that will soothe your soul, bringing out some of the finest musicians near and far. Not to be run in a traditional manner but in a special home vibe. You can walk in and buy your meal as usual and you can also prepay for the next person meal, in doing so your receive an incentive for giving back. This cafe will operate on a pay what you can status for those down on their luck but want a good meal.  The staff will be ran by extremely talented individuals all preparing my mothers amazing recipes. With guest recipes and demonstrations to live jams and intimate conversations this cafe will be more that that "3rd place" it will be that one place you thrive to be involved in. Working closely with Food Banks and Shelters- Nadine's will provided 20 hot meals a week, and also cultivate a community garden with local elementary schools.  I have found a space in downtown to start building this dream ( to buy it is listed as $100,000). I am hoping you can help me make it there. I want to raise a small portion of that to show good faith to the sellers of the property. With your help in the beginning you are laying a foundation down that helps me finish what I’ve started.

story:
FIVE STAR COFFEE is a privately owned company that was started from scratch in 2012.  The name "FIVE STAR" was chosen because it's the international rating for best-of-the-best.  Until now, we have only offered our coffees in bags.  In February this year, we discovered a new, recyclable single cup design which allows us to create a complete FIVE STAR COFFEE FACTORY.  It's the original, HIGH CAPACITY, 100% recyclable single serve cup.  This hinged lid cup is a versatile, game changing design that we will be filling in our factory!  We will also offer it in the iFILL FORMAT which home brewers (possibly you) can fill with the coffee of your choice (see PERKS).

By selecting one (or more) of our PERKS, coffee enthusiasts will provide the funding we need to purchase automated FILLING EQUIPMENT for JCUPS and complete our factory.  We feel this factory is destined to be the future model for single serve coffees.  It allows us to take the single serve concept to a higher level in terms of coffee flavor and kindness to our planet.


THOSE who help us complete our coffee factory are highly likely to be coffee enthusiasts who appreciate the "GOOD STUFF".  OUR PERKS are comprised of world class coffees and brewing accessories.  We humbly feel these are the BEST PERKS since the discovery of coffee in Ethopia (600 AD).  They will appeal to businesses and individuals.  As for coffees, we offer a sophisticated light Peruvian, bold and smooth Indonesian and two delightful flavors (to sip not gulp).  As a special treat, we feature our exotic "in your dreams" coffee from the Kona Region of the BIG ISLAND.  Here is the preview list of PERKS (shipping included in prices):

  • World Class Coffees and JCups (Filled or iFill format)
  • Jumbo "Joe" Long Handle, Stainless Scoop
  • Infusion 200 degree single cup brewer (super compact)
  • Iconic "JUST BREW IT" Coffee Hued, Organic shirt



The simplicity and convenience of single serve brewing has created explosive growth for singe cup brewers and K-style cups.  Billions of cups are being sold along with millions of brewers.  However, discriminating coffee enthusiasts say the vast majority of these mass processed coffees fail to deliver on richness and taste. IN ADDITION, the cups aren't recyclable and are receiving considerable negative press.  We had decided to avoid single serve pods, cups and capsules for these reasons. SUDDENLY ... the breakthrough occurred ... we discovered the new JCup design and the equipment to fill them with fresh FIVE STAR COFFEES.  We realized it's time for FIVE STAR to enter the single serve market with a recyclable cup that is bolder, better and fresher!  Here are the JCUP ADVANTAGES:

  • JCup contains up to 50% more coffee but fits Keurig type brewers
  • JCup brews an 8-10 oz. mug or cup of fresh, full-bodied joe
  • JCup is filled-to-order with FIVE STAR rated regular or flavored coffees
  • JCup is made of 100% commonly recycled #5 polypropylene

WATCH THIS:  The uniquely versatile JCup has a self-sealing hinged lid.  This brings a new dimension of convenience to coffee enthusiasts who prefer to use their own coffee.  We offer unfilled iFILL FORMAT cups separately in a 32 pack.  They are easily filled and sealed just before brewing.  NOTE:  See our PERKS for iFILL choices.




The FIVE STAR COFFEE FACTORY marks the beginning of the end of mass roasted, mass filled, mass distributed and mass merchandised single serve cups. Coffee loving home brewers and businesses with single cup brewers will now have a choice of larger capacity, recyclable JCups filled with small batch roasted, fresh coffee!  This is a HUGE advancement!  The newly designed, high efficiency filling equipment for our factory will allow us to provide insanely great tasting single cup coffees.  Hold the bland hot brown liquid please!  No more piles of plastic cups that cannot be recycled!  WHAT IS NOT TO LIKE?


There are three reasons JCups provide richer taste:  (1) The full-depth filter inside the cups holds up to 15 grams of coffee versus 9-12 grams for other single cups (see diagrams below).  (2) The JCup design prevents "channeling" and insures full saturation of the ground coffee occurs. (3) The FIVE STAR COFFEE is much fresher and "Specialty Grade" which means it must have character-in-the-cup.



The FIVE STAR COFFEE FACTORY will add single cup filling equipment to our bagged coffee packaging operation.  The initial launch will be in the Atlanta metro area to businesses and home brewers but all our coffees can be ordered online and shipped same day to all parts of the USA.  JCups will be filled-to-order with specialty grade coffee.  This brings a freshness and taste dimension to single serve coffee that has been lacking.  Factories need production equipment and that is the case with our FIVE STAR FACTORY.  For the JCup production line, we want to add two semi-automatic single cup filling machines which can fill 20,000 cups per shift.  Here is the short list of items we need:

  • Two semi-automatic fill machines (2400 cph)..............$8,800.00
  • Infusion 200F brewer inventory......................................$3,900.00
  • Two commercial coffee grinders.................................... $1,850.00
  • JCup inventory..................................................................$2,000.00
  • Packaging design and supplies....................................... $1,450.00
  • Promotion / Printing / Mailing Budget...........................$5,000.00
  • Website and social media modifications.........................$1,500.00

                                                            TOTAL FUNDING NEED.....$24,250.00


To fund the scaling up of our factory, we have chosen to go with CROWDFUNDING rather than borrowing from banks, family members and friends.  It just seems right that those who have an affinity for great coffee and a healthy planet are the best sources for helping us start what what we are calling the JCUP REVOLUTION.  We desperately need YOU to select a PERK and to spread the GOOD NEWS to fellow coffee enthusiasts ... the K-style monopoly is coming to an end.  Jumbo JCups filled-to-order with fresh coffee will soon be available!  When spreading the word, think family members, neighbors, doctors, lawyers, dentists, business associates, fellow worshippers, club members, alumni pals, fraternity brothers and sisters, et al. IF you have media contacts, they might be super helpful. We need "everyone and their brother" to use Facebook, Linked-in, You-Tube, blog posts and Twitter to propel us into VIRAL MODE!!!



Providing coffee enthusiasts exclusive, tightly vetted, Specialty Grade Coffees (defined later) which provide world class taste experiences is the first step toward fulfilling our MISSION.  It is gratifying that our environmentally sensitive coffee farmers, small batch roasters, female coffee farm owners and even migratory birds benefit from the sale of our coffees.  In addition, we actively support the Boy Scouts, The Kiwanis Club, Community Welcome House and many other worthy causes in the Atlanta area.



THE FIVE STAR CONCEPT began when our Founders, Greg and Joy Alford, developed an appreciation and passion for rich tasting, aromatic coffees when they lived in Seattle.  Over the next fifteen years, they built their knowledge base by attending coffee trade shows, meeting with roasters and actually working in coffee shops.  Greg is a self-trained home barista and mixologist who, after years of practice, fulfilled his dream of making perfect cappuccinos on a daily basis.  This lead to Joy fulfilling her dream of enjoying perfect cappuccinos on a daily basis ... THEY MAKE HER HAPPY!

   

     


Greg and Joy’s coffee research adventures clearly indicated that home brewing, coffee enthusiasts were often disappointed with their trial and error selections of expensive coffees when they failed to deliver great taste.  They also learned there are hundreds of coffee roasters in America who don't know beans about roasting truly great tasting coffee.  The challenge was finding the small batch, artisans who had mastered the art of roasting beans that “taste as good as they smell”.  FIVE STAR COFFEE accepted and after eighteen months of due diligence, conquered the challenge.  The wonderful aromas created by our skillfully roasted beans are FREE!


OUR small batch, artisan roasters live the art and science of coffee roasting.  They meticulously roast beans to order in small batches of 50-150 pounds. They love what they do ... no detail is too small ... consistency is critical.  Our FIVE STAR roasters buy green beans from specialty coffee importers who cup (taste test) all bean batches before making buying commitments.  FIVE STAR beans are “cupped” at least three times before they are shipped to us.



The “Specialty Grade Coffee” designation is hard earned.  It requires "a rating of 80 points or higher with no defects and distinctive character-in-the-cup".  This OFFICIAL RATING means the beans are taste tested and graded by professional cuppers to be the best-of-the-best.  Specialty beans are “high grown” in elevations that are 2000 to 6000 feet above sea level and selected from the top 10% of all Arabica coffee beans.  Coffee farmers in the major coffee regions of South America, Central America, East Africa and Indonesia bring multi-generational skills to bear to grow, harvest and process these world class beans.  The farms that produce Specialty Grade beans earn substantially more than those who produce lower rated Premium Grade and Exchange Grade beans.





Bringing the JCUP to market presents a DAVID and GOLIATH battle ... Challenging market leaders is not for the faint-hearted even when you have superior products and a noble cause.  YOUR SUPPORT is critical to our COFFEE FACTORY.  We are competing with stock exchange listed companies such as Green Mountain and Starbucks as well as the giant mass market purveyors of hot brown liquid such as Folgers, Maxwell House, Chock Full O'Nuts, et al.  WE will fight this battle with an eco-friendly, fresher, bolder, better tasting product and a creative, efficient, integrated marketing program.  While everyone else is zigging, we will be zagging to set FIVE STAR JCUPS apart from the mass processed stuff.

WE are ready to "CRANK UP THE FACTORY"!  Everything is in place at our Fulfillment Center to add the equipment we need to do it.  All we need is your help and we can order packaging supplies, cups and filling equipment.  Our list of PERKS has world class coffees every business and individual who shares our passion will enjoy.  SELECT A PERK and JOIN OUR JCUP REVOLUTION!
MAY THE FORCE (OF FIVE STAR COFFEE) BE WITH YOU!
Greg L. Alford, Chief Coffee Officer

The FIVE STAR COFFEE FACTORY will add single cup filling
equipment to our bagged coffee packaging operation. 
The initial launch will be in the Atlanta metro area to businesses and home brewers but all our coffees can be ordered online and shipped same day to all parts of the USA.  JCups will be filled-to-order with specialty grade coffee.  This brings a freshness
and taste dimension to single serve coffee that has been lacking.  Factories need production equipment and that is the case with our FIVE STAR FACTORY.  For the JCup production line, we want to add two semi-automatic single cup filling machines which can fill 20,000 cups per shift.  Here is the short list of items we need:

Two semi-automatic fill machines (2400 cph)..............$8,800.00
Infusion 200F brewer inventory......................................$3,900.00
Two commercial coffee grinders.................................... $1,850.00
JCup inventory..................................................................$2,000.00
Packaging design and supplies....................................... $1,450.00
Promotion / Printing / Mailing Budget...........................$5,000.00
Website and social media modifications.........................$1,500.00


                                                            TOTAL FUNDING NEED.....$24,250.00





To fund the scaling up of our factory, we have chosen to go with CROWDFUNDING rather than borrowing from banks, family members and friends.  It just seems right that those who have an affinity for great coffee and a healthy planet are the best sources for helping us start what what we are calling the JCUP REVOLUTION.  We desperately need YOU to select a PERK and to spread the GOOD NEWS to fellow coffee enthusiasts ... the K-style monopoly is coming to an end.  Jumbo JCups filled-to-order with fresh coffee will soon be available!  When spreading the word, think family members, neighbors, doctors, lawyers, dentists, business associates, fellow worshippers, club members, alumni pals, fraternity brothers and sisters, et al. IF you have media contacts, they might be super helpful. We need "everyone and their brother" to use Facebook, Linked-in, You-Tube, blog posts and Twitter to propel us into VIRAL MODE!!!







Providing coffee enthusiasts exclusive, tightly vetted, Specialty Grade Coffees (defined later) which provide world class taste experiences is the first step toward fulfilling our MISSION.  It is gratifying that our environmentally sensitive coffee farmers, small batch roasters, female coffee farm owners and even migratory birds benefit from the sale of our coffees.  In addition, we actively support the Boy Scouts, The Kiwanis Club, Community Welcome House and many other worthy causes in the Atlanta area.










THE
FIVE STAR CONCEPT began when our Founders, Greg and Joy Alford,
developed an appreciation and passion for rich tasting, aromatic coffees when they lived in Seattle.  Over the next fifteen years, they built their knowledge base by attending coffee trade shows, meeting with roasters and actually working in
coffee shops.  Greg is a
self-trained home barista and mixologist who, after years of practice, fulfilled his dream
of making perfect cappuccinos on a daily basis.  This lead to Joy fulfilling her dream of enjoying perfect cappuccinos on a daily basis ... THEY MAKE HER HAPPY!



   


   






     

Greg and Joy’s coffee research adventures clearly indicated that home brewing, coffee enthusiasts were often disappointed with their trial and error selections of expensive coffees when they failed to deliver great taste.  They also learned there are hundreds of coffee roasters in America who don't know beans about roasting truly great tasting coffee.  The challenge was finding the small batch, artisans who had mastered the art of roasting beans that “taste as good as they smell”.  FIVE STAR COFFEE accepted and after eighteen months of due diligence, conquered the challenge.  The wonderful aromas created by our skillfully roasted beans are FREE!



OUR small batch, artisan roasters live the art and science of coffee roasting.  They meticulously roast beans to order in small batches of 50-150 pounds. They love what they do ... no detail is too small ... consistency is critical.  Our FIVE STAR roasters buy green beans from specialty coffee importers who cup (taste test) all bean batches before making buying commitments.  FIVE STAR beans are “cupped” at least three times before they are shipped to us.






The “Specialty Grade Coffee” designation is hard earned.  It requires "a rating of 80 points or higher with no defects and distinctive character-in-the-cup".  This OFFICIAL RATING means
the beans are taste tested and graded by professional cuppers to be the best-of-the-best.  Specialty beans are
“high grown” in elevations that are 2000 to 6000 feet above sea level and selected from the
top 10% of all Arabica coffee beans.  Coffee farmers in the major coffee regions
of South America, Central America, East Africa and Indonesia bring multi-generational skills to bear to grow, harvest and process these world class beans.  The farms that produce Specialty Grade beans earn substantially more than those who produce lower rated Premium Grade and Exchange Grade beans.













Bringing the JCUP to market presents a DAVID and GOLIATH battle ... Challenging market leaders is not for the faint-hearted even when you have superior products and a noble cause.  YOUR SUPPORT is critical to our COFFEE FACTORY.  We are competing with stock exchange listed companies such as Green Mountain and Starbucks as well as the giant mass market purveyors of hot brown liquid such as Folgers, Maxwell House, Chock Full O'Nuts, et al.  WE will fight this battle with an eco-friendly, fresher, bolder, better tasting product and a creative, efficient, integrated marketing program.  While everyone else is zigging, we will be zagging to set FIVE STAR JCUPS apart from the mass processed stuff.





WE are ready to "CRANK UP THE FACTORY"!  Everything is in place at our Fulfillment Center to add the equipment we need to do it.  All we need is your help and we can order packaging supplies, cups and filling equipment.  Our list of PERKS has world class coffees every business and individual who shares our passion will enjoy.  SELECT A PERK and JOIN OUR JCUP REVOLUTION!

MAY THE FORCE (OF FIVE STAR COFFEE) BE WITH YOU!
Greg L. Alford, Chief Coffee Officer

story:
The Miss Canada Globe Pageant 2015 costs $3000. This goes towards:

Training, Rehearsal Space, Sashes and Crowns (both Regional and National), Talent coaches, Hotel Accommodations (National Pageant Week), Audio and Visual Requirements, Theatre, Transportation (during National Pageant Week), Administrative Fees, Meals (during National Pageant Week), Production Costs, Cash Prizes for the winners, Hair & Makeup

Here is the link to their website for more information: http://www.misscanada.tv/

If you want more information that is not on the website I will gladly send it to you! So don't hesitate to ask!

I only need $1000 to cover the costs, so any amount that you donate would mean the world to me!

Why Should You Donate?

My goal is to promote what true beauty really means on a National level. I want people to hear my story in hopes that they will join me on my journey. I want to be a voice for women and to let them know that they are beautiful and being beautiful starts with finding beauty in yourself.

*** This is long, but I think it's definitely worth reading!"

MY STORY:

In my video, I spoke about my struggles with depression. This is the main reason why I applied to compete in this National Pageant. There are many other people who struggle with depression, like I did, and many more who will go through it in the future. I thought, if I could just reach one person with my story and help them, this is all worth it. I decided to not let my fear stop me from fighting for my goals. I decided to not be afraid of judgement because if I can be happy with myself and if I can help someone else to find happiness within themselves, then judgement is nothing.

I have always been a people pleaser. I would say yes to every favour that people asked me for if I thought it would help them. I got heavily involved in high school, in things like student council; and I was accepted as a member of the Minister's Student Advisory Council for the Ministry of Education for Ontario (MSAC), where I represented students from my area at the provincial level to help make school more inclusive and engaging for my fellow students; I started my own SpeakUp Committee to get others involved who were never given the chance to get involved; I joined a committee through United Way, called the Youth Engagement Partnership, to help youth in my community get involved and to encourage Boards and Committees in my community to reach out to youth for their ideas and involvement; and much more.

It took me too long to figure out that I was not giving enough to myself. I thought, if I focus any attention on myself, that was being selfish. I wore myself out so fast and beat myself up so much for not being good enough. It got to a point where I constantly felt like a disappointment. So any time anyone ever complimented me, I sincerely thanked them, however I felt like I did not deserve it.

I developed this angry voice in my head, telling me how stupid I was, how pathetic I was, how undeserving I was and so on. This voice tore me down until there was barely any fight left in me. I knew I needed help because when this voice said demeaning things to me, I eventually stopped arguing with it. I started to agree with everything it told me. There was a point where I completely hated myself, but I passed that point. I no longer cared about myself. But luckily, I cared about the ones who love me and I couldn't hurt them so I didn't want to hurt me. I decided to reach out to someone I trusted but someone who had a distant relationship to me. A teacher.

Fast forward: I was able to overcome my depression. It took over 5 years, but I did it because I never gave up on myself and I tried my hardest. I am still struggling with mental health issues and seeing a psychologist as well as a psychiatrist. I have my bad days just like you, but I have learned how to deal with them and learn from them. It's a process and it will take time, but I am progressing and getting stronger every day.

I want other girls and women to know that they are beautiful and that they are enough. I don't want anyone to go through what I went through and so I will stand before a huge crowd and judges and look them in the face with confidence and say "I am beautiful" and whether they see it or not does not matter to me. What matters is that I feel it and I believe it and it's real. I believe in myself and when I walk off that stage and at the end of the day I will feel so happy and proud of myself. I will be able to say to myself "look at how far I have come! I did it! I showed myself how beautiful I am!" and that's enough for me.

I hope that this helps other women and girls. I hope that I encourage and inspire them to look in the mirror and smile and say "I am beautiful. I am strong. I am enough." I hope this helps other women find happiness within themselves. And ladies, we don't have to do this alone. I ask you to join me on my journey so that we can help each other,  inspire each other and encourage each other.

After the Pageant I want to continue my journey in helping other women and girls find opportunities to do something like this for themselves. I hope to hold my own Beauty Pageant in my community the following summer where everyone is given the chance to show off their beauty.

Miss Canada Globe is only the first step in my journey. I need you to make it happen. Please donate to my campaign now and you will see what I have to give to our Country!

story:
Short Summary

On a recent mission trip to India, a team of us went a visited an Orphanage in the state of Orissa.  PastorJemesh and his family house 35 orphans and semi-orphans in a small two bedroom house.  We need funds to help them purchase land in a safer place, closer to the railway and build a home that will house all of the children. 

What We Need 

We need at least $5000 to purchase the land and get started on the new home for the orphans.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do… but how much love we put in that action.
Mother Teresa

A massive earthquake struck Nepal. It was a powerful 7.9 magnitude earthquake that killed 8 000+ people  and injured at least 25 000, also destroyed many homes, roads and historical monuments etc. Nepal has declared a  state of emergency.

My heart breaks to think what everyone is going through at this moment losing their loved ones, their homes, their city 
These are very difficult times for Nepal. Also Nepal is one of the least developed countries in the world with a very high poverty rate, They need all the help they can get to overcome this terrible disaster. 

We are NGO's, we are helping people by providing modular housing and trailers. After a devastating earthquake the hardest and slowest to recover are the affected area's infrastructure and housing conditions. It will take years for Nepal to recover from the devastating earthquakes. Our goal is to raise $ 500 000, which would be enough to provide 50 houses. Yes, that's correct, 50 houses for the many Nepalese families in need.

Our houses are emergency settlement units under ISO 9001 international standards and with superior engineering and quality control system. As Production is modular or trailer, it is done in short time and provides easy transportation as an advantage. Our modular emergency residential units offer ideal solutions for accommodating people who suffered from consequences of unwelcome natural disasters such earthquakes, floods and fires.

Any contributor who pledges $ 10 000 will be granted the opportunity to have his or his family's name and home country presented on a housing trailer designated to the Nepalese people in need.


Please Donate whatever you can and if you can't even a prayer is very much appreciated.


Please Share!



We have just  finished our latest project of a similar type. We have created a refugee camp for the many Syrian people affected by the terrible war ravaging their home country, who are looking for a better life in Europe. This refugee camp is located in Bulgaria, Europe and is designed to accommodate the many illegal refugees coming from Turkey on their way to Europe.


Perks

story:
Windy City Times Marks 30 Years

  • Founded in 1985 by a small group of individuals passionate about news and the LGBTQ community, Windy City Times is about to celebrate 30 years as the Voice of the LGBTQ Community in the Chicago area.
  • For all of those 30 years, Windy City Times has been FREE in print, and once the Internet was widely available 20 years ago, WCT also was free online.
  • This $30 for 30 Years campaign will help us realize our passion for continued editorial excellence. We want to utilize more writers, including youth experiencing homelessness, to cover our diverse community.
  • IMPORTANT: We will be adding NEW perks throughout this campaign, so check back weekly as perks come online.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $30,000 as part of this editorial campaign:

  • This money will help us cover our editorial costs of producing Windy City Times as a free weekly newspaper each week, and free online daily.
  • We have some fantastic perks, including house concerts, movie screenings, theatre outings, dinners, comedy and more!
  • We also have a 30th anniversary party set for Sunday, Sept. 27, 2-5 p.m. at Sidetrack bar. Donate $50 or more and you get in free!

The Impact

  • Windy City Times is an award-winning newspaper, one of just 11 weekly LGBTQ newspapers left in the U.S.
  • LGBTQ media continue to cover the community better than any other media can, because we do it every day, 365 days a year.
  • We amplify our community's voices—please help us spread the word.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We know you get asked to help your friends, family and community in many different ways, If you can't contribute today, please help spread the word about this campaign to those you know who may be able to contribute.
  • While this is a $30 for 30 Years campaign, any donation will help!

story:
While we've done many things, lived many places, and had many loves in our lives the constant through it all has been a love of video games.

We've come a long way, and a lot has changed since I was a boy playing Ms. Pacman, Donkey Kong, Frogger, Dig Dug and other iconic arcade titles on the New Jersey boardwalk.


                                            YES! This is totally me in the pictures.

Decades of enjoying these easy to pick up, but difficult to master games captured my imagination, while creating undeniable impressions that were the catalyst for myself, my friends, and millions of others like us to be artists, writers, musicians, programmers, cosplayers, gamers, and entrepreneurs. 

In St. Louis, there are a few private collectors and some local businesses with a couple random games, but no single, large public collection of games available for the public to enjoy everyday.

We want to change that by creating a place to congregate, socialize, have a drink, and participate in what is for many thousands, if not millions, a shared lifelong hobby. St. Louis has some great Pinball Bars that we love, but no video arcade bars.

Help us Open St. Louis' First and Only Arcade Bar

St. Louis, Missouri is literally surrounded by cities with arcade bars. For example.....

Chicago has five...

                                 

                                                    Kansas City has two......

                                 

                                                  Des Moines has one........

                                

                                        Springfield, Missouri even has one! 

                                 

                                                     St. Louis has none! 

                                                   

We live in a growing and developing city that's getting better everyday. We not only want to be a part of this growth, we want to help fuel it by bringing another unique business to the area.

Realizing dreams like this doesn't happen overnight. It takes planning, research, and dedication. For the past several years, we've been developing, writing, and refining our business plan to realize our goal. Here's what we've been spending our time doing...


Our Concept

We want to bring the Arcade Bar experience to St. Louis. We know that the concept of arcade games in a bar isn't anything new, they go together like high cholesterol and heart disease. 

It's a pairing that's been done since the early 1980s. We have little control over that fact. However, what we can control is the experience we provide our customers. Fundamentally, this begins with our brand.


Our Brand

The natural inclination for an Arcade Bar "brand" is to go for something pixelated, cold, complex, and niche. However, the objective of our branding was to keep it simple, friendly, playful, social, approachable, and organic - all the qualities we want our bar to embody. 

Chicago based Sofya Karash and Daniel McManus at Narrative Branding and Design nailed it. 

                                         

Their research, sketches, concept art (featured above), and incredible talent helped form the visual backbone of our brand, our logo, as well as many of awesome perks we're offering to backers, such as our T-Shirt, at the $30 backer level, and the $10 Vinyl Sticker. We hope that you like what we've developed.


The Environment

When you walk in the bar, we want you to feel like you're running into an old friend that you spent a lot of good times with, but haven't seen in a while. A playful sense of excitement that you get when you're a little kid and you know you're about to experience something enjoyable. 

To help accomplish this goal, we've been working with our friends work in architecture to help us create a place that is welcoming, efficient, and functional.


A S.M.A.R.T. Experience

Delivering the experience that will make the business successful means we're keeping the everything simple, measurable, achievable, realistic, and transparent, or S.M.A.R.T.

No food, and no kitchen. We're bartenders that are passionate about video arcade games, local draft beers, and great cocktails. 

We're friendly, seasoned bar staff creating a distinct environment and welcoming experience that everyone, regardless of who you are or how passionate you are about video games. 

"But," you say.....

"I'm not really a hardcore gamer."
We understand, most people aren't. Many of our closest friends and family members love the arcade bar experience, but don't necessarily have hours to invest in setting high scores or being at the top of a leader board. They have full-time jobs, families, girlfriends, boyfriends, dogs, and Strange Donuts to buy. 

Here are some features we're planning for this crowd:

  • TVs playing sports; movies; & classic WWE(F), or a combination of the lot.

  • Our "Barchievement" Loyalty Program (more on that, in a minute...).

  • A recreational gaming league.

"Hey! But I am a hardcore gamer! What about me???"
Easy cowboy! We didn't forget about you. For the more hardcore or veteran audience, we are planning the following features that you will enjoy: 

  • Regular Prize Tournaments

  • Persistent On-Line and In-Store Leader Board Positions

  • A Competitive Gaming League.

  • Opportunities for Setting Records. 

  • Streaming your Gameplay via Twitch.

We anticipate many people want this depth of experience right from the start, or as they become better at the games. We're more than happy to make this a reality.

"Buddy! I'm hungry, but you don't have any food!"
Breaker ten-four loud and clear, we're on the side, pardner! Feel free to order in or bring anything you want to eat. No smokey bears are gonna put the brakes on ya.

"How much them vidya games gonna cost us???"
Oh. We didn't mention? Everything we own is going to be a on free-play. Everyone loves that! 


Barchievements

We all know that there are a lot of loyalty programs out there that only encourage you to just "buy more of what we're selling". 

While our "Barchievment" program does encourage purchases for certain Barchievements, we think of it as a "meta game" for the bar that will enable you to earn different custom iron-on patches designed by local artist, Alex Fortune.

                                          *One Sample of Planned Holiday Barchievements*

Completing these different, fun challenges related to things like holidays, the bar experience, arcade games, and our local community can also earn you merchandise such as hats, hoodies, and pint glasses.

If you decide to contribute at the $20 level you will be enrolled in the program at a discount, and earn the Indiegogo exclusive backer stamp, and a 1-time only patch that can never be earned again


Giving Back to Our Community

"Quarters for Quarters"

While being profitable is a perfectly fine goal (Hell, we want to and need to be profitable!), it's also important to be part of the community and support causes that are dear to our customers, team members, neighbors, and partners. 

To accomplish this goal, various games throughout each financial quarter will be designated as "Charity Games". This means for one financial quarter these games will cost twenty-five cents to play.

When the quarter ends, we will add this money up, and ask our customers will vote via social media on which not-for-profit organization will receive the funds accumulated in this manner. 

Other options that we're considering using this program for is to help other Indiegogo campaigns fund their dreams. What better way to give back to the community that helped us when we needed a boost. 

Speaking of which......


What We Need

Our passion for this project has enabled us to climb the mountain, but we need your help to reach the summit. 

While we have an ambitious target of $36,000.00 it is an achievable and realistic goal given the scope of the project. The total opening costs actually come to +$65,000 which is mostly inventory, games, equipment, lease, and other expenses associated with opening a bar.  


The start-up costs for this venture are being financed partially through my own personal and retirement savings; partially by this campaign; and up to 2 private investors. 

One investor has already committed to ~$30,000 which will accompany whatever we are able to raise, via this campaign, as well as additional contingency funds as may be required. 

We are purchasing a majority of the assets, however, there will also be some equipment that will be rented; leased; and loaned. There are consultants that will need to be hired, some will be volunteers; some maintained for a time on contract; and some more permanently. We will also need cash to finance operations. 

This is the break down of what the money will be used for:

  • Indiegogo fees - $1,750.00

  • Pay Pal Fees - $1,050.00

  • Fulfilling Perks - $2,000.00

  • Opening Inventory - $6,000.00

  • Glassware - $400.00

  • Barware - $31.00

  • Furniture,  Fixtures, & Decor - $3,000.00

  • Arcade Games - $20,000.00

  • Rent - $2,000.00

This totals to just over $36,000.00 ($36,231.00).


What You Get - Perks & Rewards

We did our best to design our perks to cater to locals backers, as well as for those of you who are out of town, and just want some sweet loot, or recognition.  

Once funding is complete, we will be contacting you for your mailing address, or you can simply pick everything up Arcade Bar, if that's an easier option for you. 








*Choose 1 ladies or 1 unisex shirt*

 *Choose 1 ladies or 1 unisex shirt*

*Choose 1 ladies or 1 unisex shirt*

*Choose 1 ladies or 1 unisex shirt*

*Choose 1 ladies or 1 unisex shirt*

Image Courtesy of: http://www.thebasementarcade.com/

We are also sectioning off a large piece of the wall space in the bar to put the Name, Screen Name, or Company Name for every contributor to be featured.

If you are unclear about any of the perks, or you have any questions about them, please reach out and we'll add them to the Frequently Asked Questions section of our website.


The Impact

We have been working on this project night and day for the past 3 years, and the simple truth is, without you, we can't make it a reality. 

Your generosity, literally (very literally), determines whether or not we realize our dream of opening up Arcade Bar and owning our own business, or returning to focus on a more traditional career path. 

While we've passionately poured hundreds, if not thousands, of hours worth of sweat equity into the business, passion and sweat equity aren't accepted as payment for walk in coolers, kegs of beer, or arcade games.

Please back us, and if you can, generously! 

Only your generosity can enable us to realize Arcade Bar. Help make our dream come true, and help make the universe a happier place. 


The Risks

Like anything in life, (for instance, posting a picture of yourself as a child, in a Speedo) there are risks. We understand this, and are confident in our planning. 
By identifying and weighing the major risks to the business, and discussing the affect(s) they would have, as well as ways to minimize & mitigate them, we feel confident in our planning. 
If things really start to go tits up, we also have a network of friends that own restaurants and bars that we can ask for guidance.

 If you have a question about a risk that you're concerned about, please reach out, and we will address it in our Frequently Asked Questions on our website, ASAP.


Major Targets and Achievement Dates

There are lots of targets for this project, and we'll try our best to stick to the targeted achievement dates we have set. We will communicate to backers our successes, as well as when, and if, setbacks occur.


Progress Reporting and Transparency

Businesses operating as a result of crowd source funding have an obligation to produce regular reports to its backers.  We will be providing progress on rewards, and details with respect to project milestones, and spend. Additionally, campaigns should be expected to communicate road blocks and failures when they occur.

Progress reports will be provided on a weekly or more basis. The reports will include details of activities against our set milestones, staff hired, targets achieved, rewards shipped, and spend. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We get it. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are a few very low involvement ways you can help a fellow human, and give us a hand.

  • Make some noise about this campaign. 

  • Tell a friend.

  • Send it to a media contact, podcast, or blogger that you're cool with. 

  • Tweet our campaign to a celebrity that you think would give us a shout out.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

  • Send us an encouraging email or message. We'll post every one on our website.

FAQ

How can I help make this bar happen?
We've passionately poured hundreds, if not thousands, of hours worth of sweat equity into the business, passion but sweat equity does not pay for walk in coolers,kegs of beer, or arcade games, so please back us, and if you can, generously.

Why did you choose flexible funding?
We choose flexible funding so that the money could be deposited into the Arcade Bar business bank account. This is not an option for fixed funding. We did not want to be personally liable for the taxes we would have to pay on money raised.

Is Arcade Bar St. Louis even a Business? 

Yes! We are an L.L.C. registered with the State of Missouri.

Will the money that I give to back this project go to a personal bank account?
No. All money will go to a business bank account for the bar.

Why are you doing this? 
Why not? It's our dream. In a universe where (as far as we know) we only get one go round, there's no fucking reason not to try and achieve every dream that we have. Moreover, if we don't do it, someone else will.

Where are you going to be located?
We're planning to open up in St. Louis city. We don't want to announce a location and have to retract our announcement because of problems with obtaining a liquor license or because of unknown issues with a property. Once we're certain we're able to open in a space, we'll make an announcement. Until then, send us your suggestions.

What if you don't reach your goal?
We may not reach our goal, but when we move onto the next thing, we can do so knowing that we did everything possible to make this bar a reality.

Who is your investor and why isn't he listed anywhere?
The 1 investor in this bar is a  personal friend that we have known since High School. He requested to be a silent investor/partner in the project, and as such, we're respecting his wishes to remain anonymous.

You know this is a risk, right?
Yup. Like anything in life, there are risks. We understand this, and are confident in our planning. We've identified and weighed the major risks to the business and discussed the affect(s) they would have, as well as ways to minimize & mitigate them. 

If I support this project, how do I know you're not just going to run off with my money?
Simply put, you don't. However, by taking your money and not delivering on our promises  we would be alienating not only you, but our friends, family, and the goodwill of everyone that has helped get us to this point.  We'd also be throwing away literally thousands of dollars that we have already invested in bringing this project to fruition. Would that be worth it? No. We don't think so.

Can I be the first "Quarters for Quarters" recipient?
We can't guarantee, but we welcome you apply.

Can I put my game in your bar?
Sure! Let's figure out how we can make sure we develop a "win/win" opportunity.

How are you going to make money?
No food. No kitchen. Just by doing what we're passionate about: video arcade games, booze, and friendly, seasoned bar staff creating a distinct environment and welcoming experience that everyone, regardless of who you are or how familiar with video games you are, can enjoy.


About Us (me!)

Timothy Scherer - Owner/Manager/Founder/Gamer/Boy in Speedo

If a bar could have parents Tim Scherer is Arcade Bar's mother and father. This is his baby that he has raised and encouraged when all others said it was a stupid and would never succeed.

He has worked in Marketing and Public Relations for more than 10 years, including stints working in Organic Foods; Aerospace; Not-For-Profit; and Cable Television. He has a Masters in Business Administration from the University of Sheffield, and over 5 years experience bartending.

Tim loves video games, and started when he was 2 years old standing on a chair in a smokey arcade on the New Jersey Boardwalk. He currently enjoys PC, console, and classic gaming. 

His favorite game of all time is Final Fantasy 3 for the Super Nintendo.

He no longer dresses in a single color (all red)..............or wears a speedo.
story_txt:
While
we've done many things, lived many places, and had many loves in our
lives the constant through it all has been a love of video games.
We've
come a long way, and a lot has changed since I was a boy playing Ms.
Pacman, Donkey Kong, Frogger, Dig Dug and other iconic arcade titles
on the New Jersey boardwalk.                                            YES! This is totally me in the pictures.
Decades of enjoying these easy to pick up, but difficult to master games captured my imagination, while creating undeniable impressions
that were the catalyst for myself, my friends, and millions
of others like us to be artists, writers, musicians, programmers,
cosplayers, gamers, and entrepreneurs. 
In St. Louis, there are a few private collectors and some local businesses with a couple random games, but no single, large public collection of games available for the public to enjoy everyday.We want to change that by creating a place to congregate, socialize,
have a drink, and participate in what is for many thousands, if not
millions, a shared lifelong hobby. St. Louis has some great Pinball
Bars that we love, but no video arcade bars.

Help
us Open St. Louis' First and Only Arcade Bar

St.
Louis, Missouri is literally surrounded by cities with arcade
bars. For example.....
Chicago
has five...


                                 
                                                    Kansas City has two......
                                 
                                                  Des Moines has one........

                                
                                        Springfield, Missouri even has one! 

                                 

                                                     St.
Louis has none! 

                                                   


We
live in a growing and developing city that's getting better everyday.
We not only want to be a part of this growth, we want to help fuel it
by bringing another unique business to the area.
Realizing dreams like this doesn't happen overnight. It takes planning, research, and dedication. For the past several years, we've
been developing, writing, and refining our business plan to realize our goal. Here's what we've been spending our time doing...






Our
Concept

We
want to bring the Arcade Bar experience to St. Louis. We know
that the concept of arcade
games in a bar isn't anything new, they go together like high cholesterol and heart disease. 
It's a pairing that's been done since the early
1980s. We have little control over that fact. However, what we
can control is the experience we provide our customers.
Fundamentally, this begins with our brand.


Our
Brand

The natural inclination for an Arcade Bar "brand" is to go for something pixelated, cold, complex, and niche. However, the objective of our branding was to keep it simple, friendly, playful,
social, approachable, and organic - all the qualities we want our bar to embody. 
Chicago
based Sofya
Karash and Daniel
McManus at Narrative
Branding and Design nailed
it. 

                                         
Their
research, sketches, concept art (featured above), and incredible talent helped form the visual backbone of our brand, our logo, as well as many of
awesome perks we're offering to backers, such as our T-Shirt, at the
$30 backer level, and the $10 Vinyl Sticker. We hope that you like
what we've developed.

The Environment


When
you walk in the bar, we want you to feel like you're running into an
old friend that you spent a lot of good times with, but haven't seen
in a while. A playful sense of excitement that you get when you're
a little kid and you know you're about to experience something
enjoyable. 

To
help accomplish this goal, we've been working with our friends work in architecture to help us create a place that is welcoming, efficient, and functional.


A
S.M.A.R.T. Experience

Delivering
the experience that will make the business successful means we're
keeping the
everything simple, measurable, achievable, realistic, and
transparent, or S.M.A.R.T.No food, and no kitchen. We're bartenders that are passionate about video arcade games,
local draft beers, and great cocktails. 
We're friendly, seasoned bar
staff creating a distinct environment and welcoming experience that
everyone, regardless of who you are or how passionate you are about video games. 

"But,"
you say.....

"I'm
not really a hardcore gamer."We
understand, most people aren't. Many of our closest friends and
family members love the arcade bar experience, but don't necessarily
have hours to invest in setting high scores or being at the top of a
leader board. They have full-time jobs, families, girlfriends,
boyfriends, dogs, and Strange
Donuts to
buy. 
Here are some features we're planning for this
crowd:



	TVs
	playing sports; movies; & classic WWE(F), or a combination of the
	lot.



	Our "Barchievement" Loyalty Program (more on that, in a minute...).



	A
	recreational gaming league.





"Hey!
But I am a hardcore gamer! What about me???"Easy cowboy!
We didn't forget about you. For the more hardcore or veteran audience, we are
planning the following features that you will enjoy: 



	Regular
	Prize Tournaments



	Persistent On-Line and In-Store Leader Board Positions



	A
	Competitive Gaming League.



	Opportunities
	for Setting Records. 



	Streaming
	your Gameplay via Twitch.



We
anticipate many people want this depth of experience right from the
start, or as they become better at the games. We're more than happy
to make this a reality.
"Buddy! I'm hungry, but you don't have any food!"Breaker ten-four loud and clear, we're on the side, pardner! Feel free to order in or bring anything you want to eat. No smokey bears are gonna put the brakes on ya.


"How
much them vidya games gonna cost us???"Oh.
We didn't mention? Everything we own is going to be a on
free-play. Everyone loves that! 


Barchievements
We all know that there are a lot of loyalty programs out there that only encourage you to just "buy more of what we're selling". 
While our "Barchievment" program does encourage purchases for certain Barchievements, we think of it as a "meta game" for the bar that will enable you to earn different custom iron-on patches designed by local artist, Alex Fortune.

story:
About us and our idea...

Hi Folks! 

Although organic products have the lowest hazard rating in terms of health and environmental safety, the importance of consuming them is still a foreign idea in South America. I think I can help to spread a healthier life style in the region by facilitating the access to organic products, starting with Chile. To do so, I am attempting to raise money to begin an organic product business.


                                                           


Where are my manners? First, let me introduce myself. My name is Santiago, I am a human rights lawyer who is starting over after living in Australia with my family for the last five years. We moved abroad thanks to a scholarship that allowed my wife Cristina to undertake her studies at Melbourne Uni. While in Australia, I had the opportunity to work with a company called Five:am Organics and to have access to a range of organic products. I really got inspired by the quality and variety of the organic products available in Australia, and I can say from my personal experience that those products made my life and my kids’ lives healthier (as you can see in the picture, we are a big happy family!).


Returning to Chile in the beginning of 2015, my wife and I decided we had to share with others this amazing new life style and follow our passion for sustainable and organic products. We decided the best way to do so was to introduce some of our personal favourite organic sustainable brands into the Chilean market. There is a lack of options in terms of organic products in Chile, which gives us the opportunity to create a leading brand in the market. Hence, we have created our own brand called Ola Orgánica (Organic Wave) http://www.olaorganica.com/ 


We chose this name not only because I´m a surfer at heart, but also because we believe that this amazing organic wave has to ‘be caught’ by all and not be limited to developed countries. 

Why we need more funds...

To start our business, we are counting on some savings and family money, but it is not enough! We tried to apply for a bank loan to make up the difference. But as we are just back in Chile, the Chilean bank declined the loan on the basis that since there is no track of our activities for the last five years we don´t have the ‘right profile’ to get it. Friends encouraged and advised us to give fundraising a go, in order to avoid the bank manager (at least in this beginning!) and get the community involved with the project… so here we are!

What we'll be spending the money on...

With the money we raise we will get accounting and tax advice, as well as commercial service. We will also pay for some business registers, specifically public health service certificates, because the first products we will be importing are for children under 6 years old.  

Being transparent...

Despite our experience with business not being vast, we guarantee all of you who is willing to support us that we are truly motivated and we think we can make some difference. Our goal is simply to change the world by inspiring people with more conscious products and lifestyle choices.  As said, there is much less awareness in South American countries about the importance of consuming products that have the lowest hazard rating in terms of health and environmental safety, and as a result there are fewer products available to people who want to make better choices. This is a vicious circle that has to end at some point. For this reason we want to make the best natural, organic and sustainable products available to as many people as possible in this part of the earth. 

Thank you for dropping by and taking the time to know a bit about our business!

If you can donate to our campaign, we will be immensely grateful! 

If you can’t, consider spreading the word to all your friends and family who think organic and sustainable products are important for both our present and our future! It will be of great help :)

We invite you to surf with us this amazing organic wave (Ola Orgánica)!

Thanks for your support!

To all, we send out good vibes!
story_txt:
About us and our idea... 
Hi Folks! 

Although organic products have the lowest hazard rating in terms of health and environmental safety, the importance of consuming them is still a foreign idea in South America. I think I can help to spread a healthier life style in the region by facilitating the access to organic products, starting with Chile. To do so, I am attempting to raise money to begin an organic product business.




                                                           


Where are my manners? First, let me introduce myself. My name is Santiago, I am a human rights lawyer who is starting over after living in Australia with my family for the last five years. We moved abroad thanks to a scholarship that allowed my wife Cristina to undertake her studies at Melbourne Uni. While in Australia, I had the opportunity to work with a company called Five:am Organics and to have access to a range of organic products. I really got inspired by the quality and variety of the organic products available in Australia, and I can say from my personal experience that those products made my life and my kids’ lives healthier (as you can see in the picture, we are a big happy family!).




Returning to Chile in the beginning of 2015, my wife and I decided we had to share with others this amazing new life style and follow our passion for sustainable and organic products. We decided the best way to do so was to introduce some of our personal favourite organic sustainable brands into the Chilean market. There is a lack of options in terms of organic products in Chile, which gives us the opportunity to create a leading brand in the market. Hence, we have created our own brand called Ola Orgánica (Organic Wave) http://www.olaorganica.com/ 







We chose this name not only because I´m a surfer at heart, but also because we believe that this amazing organic wave has to ‘be caught’ by all and not be limited to developed countries. 

Why we need more funds...
 To start our business, we are counting on some savings and family money, but it is not enough! We tried to apply for a bank loan to make up the difference. But as we are just back in Chile, the Chilean bank declined the loan on the basis that since there is no track of our activities for the last five years we don´t have the ‘right profile’ to get it. Friends encouraged and advised us to give fundraising a go, in order to avoid the bank manager (at least in this beginning!) and get the community involved with the project… so here we are!
 What we'll be spending the money on...
With the money we raise we will get accounting and tax advice, as well as commercial service. We will also pay for some business registers, specifically public health service certificates, because the first products we will be importing are for children under 6 years old.  
 Being transparent...
Despite our experience with business not being vast, we guarantee all of you who is willing to support us that we are truly motivated and we think we can make some difference. Our goal is simply to change the world by inspiring people with more conscious products and lifestyle choices.  As said, there is much less awareness in South American countries about the importance of consuming products that have the lowest hazard rating in terms of health and environmental safety, and as a result there are fewer products available to people who want to make better choices. This is a vicious circle that has to end at some point. For this reason we want to make the best natural, organic and sustainable products available to as many people as possible in this part of the earth. 

Thank you for dropping by and taking the time to know a bit about our business!
If you can donate to our campaign, we will be immensely grateful! 
If you can’t, consider spreading the word to all your friends and family who think organic and sustainable products are important for both our present and our future! It will be of great help :)
We invite you to surf with us this amazing organic wave (Ola Orgánica)!
Thanks for your support!
To all, we send out good vibes!

story:
FUND OUR CAMPAIGN AND CLAIM SERVICES FROM SEVENCOLORIRIS INC. AS A REWARD RETURNED.
CLAIMED SERVICES ARE TRANSFERABLE AND NO EXPIRED DATE
CHECK OUR PERKS FOR MORE DETAILS
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


ABOUT THE ENTREPRENEUR

" To be an entrepreneur, a person needs courage. If you are a woman, you need it double".  

Vu Dieu Thuy, a Vietnamese woman, started her business when she was 27. Thuy is an independent and ambitious young lady, things make her different from other women from where she comes from.

Thuy started a company called "Sevencoloriris Inc" to provide ASSISTANCE  to business people and organizations in Vietnam - the first of this kind in the country.   http://www.vietnam-assistance.com/ 

Although born and raised in Hanoi, Vietnam, Thuy has experienced different aspects of her life and career in different places around the world. Her vision is broad and her mind is open. Thuy has proved to all of her clients and colleagues with whom she has cooperated that her professionalism and excellent assistance skills are her most outstanding strengths. 

Having worked as an assistant for years, notably as Executive Assistant to CEOs, Thuy understands what makes a good assistant and how an assistant contributes to and enhances a leader’s success. This is the core difference between her business concept of Assist Pro and other forms of professional services available in Vietnam today. Thuy believes that multidisciplinary knowledge, cross-cultural sensitivity and a supportive nature are the key elements enabling Sevencoloriris Inc. to deliver the best value to its customers.


ABOUT THE BUSINESS

Why ASSISTANCE service?

Her business is based on following philosophy:
" NO ONE CAN DO EVERYTHING
NO ONE CAN SUCCEED ALONE"
A person has a business idea but does not know where to start may need assistance to register a company, to know what kind of papers to prepare and which office/department to file the application for patents, permits or tax, etc. 
An entrepreneur who wants to find a partner/seller/buyer/funder but having language barrier may need assistance to search, identify, approach, contact and at least arrange a meeting with an appropriate person. When the meeting is set, he/she may also need someone's assistance at the meeting to facilitate communication between them.
A company may want to open an office and need assistance in office setup and/or initial recruitment.
An NGO may want assistance to run one of their international volunteer campaigns in Vietnam since it cannot do it itself due to not understanding local society and networks.
A family relocates to Hanoi and needs assistance in housing, schooling and local culture training for its members.
Everyone will need someone's else assistance at some point, especially those who first come to Vietnam where they will find everything so different from home. Sevencoloriris Inc. plays the role which helps them adapt easier and faster to the new living, working and business environment. 

Assistant Vs. Consultant
Sevencoloriris Inc. differentiates its service from consultant service although some of its minors may share some similarity.
Assistance service, is believed, is to conduct specific tasks upon requests. Those who know what they want but cannot do it alone (or all by themselves) are subject of assistance service. On the other hand, consultant service is more about theoretical advising rather practical action. Sevencoloriris Inc. does provide advice, but it is just complementary part. Its main service body relies on task implementation.
" Our mission is to be an reliable executive assistant for individuals and organizations that need our support in running their business, networking, representing themselves to partners and preparing for relocation to Vietnam" - Sevencoloriris Inc.

2014 Business Milestones

2014 has been a great year to Sevencoloriris Inc. and members. Starting from a small but young and dynamic team, we are so proud of what we have been through in the passing year which made us grow day by day.

January,

Sevencoloriris Inc. was officially registered.

February,

Latinomics, an International NGO based in Mexico and Austria, asked for assistance to bring one of its international programs to Vietnam. The tasks: Searched, identified, contacted and represented Latinomisc at meetings with local NGOs to establish partnership for Future Makers program.

April,

Sevencoloriris Inc. welcomed World Wings Aviation to Vietnam with the mission to connect with different Airlines in Vietnam for pilot recruitment. 

August

Started helping Tienli Limited from Hong Kong and help it search, communicate and facilitate with its Vietnamese partners who are interested in distributing high-ended European products such as infant foods, dairy products and others.

October
Started assisting Pfungstädter Brewery from Germany search and select exclusive importer/distributor for its high quality and large-ranged products in Vietnam.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

2015 plan - PROJECTS CALLING FOR FUNDING

In 2015, Thuy and Sevencoloriris Inc. team will started two new projects relating to Education/Training.

1. PA/EA COACHING PROGRAM

Sevencoloriris Coach|Mentor is career counseling program for PA (Personal Assistant) and EA (Executive Assistant) in Vietnam. Thuy realized that PA and EA, as jobs, require unique skill set and knowledge; to master these positions, a person needs to invest time and constant effort in both formal education and self-training at significant level. However, due to the misconception of society regarding to Assistant, the role and importance of this job have been, somehow, underestimated. Therefore, people who are working at these positions sometimes feel the lack of support or of the resources for their career development.

Noticed this demand, Sevencoloriris Inc. plans to organize micro-classes and mentoring sessions where Thuy will shed light on all the myths of “To-be-an-Assistant”; where problems are heard and resolved; and where Assistants will find their spirit and concerns are all shared by others. The program is conducted at Sevencoloriris Inc. office once a week with 5 sessions per program. Each person will be automatically enrolled to three free counselling sessions with Thuy - an experienced EA, after the class.

http://www.vietnam-assistance.com/

The impact

PA&EA Coaching program is belived will boost productivity of PAs and EAs, making them feel more confident in their own jobs and position and also make the society change the view of ASSISTANTs which have been considered insignificant roles.

--------------------------------------------------------------

2. DIPLOMADO EN VIENA 

Diplomado en Viena is one-week program in which many high-profiled officers/diplomats/intellectuals and business people from all over the world gather in Vienna, Austria to co-work, co-learn and co-share their values.  

http://www.latinomics.org/en/

The program provides opportunity to:

1.  Get a closer look at international organizations such as the UN , OPEC , OFID , OSCE and how they work; To understand the work of the Ambassadors , Diplomats and representatives to international organizations;  Take classes and interact with directors and managers of global projects in international organizations .

2.  On the other hand, attendants will take classes to learn about the most successful projects in Germany and Startups in Austria; interact with CEOs, women and men of outstanding business in Austria, Germany and Europe; visit Startups and Entrepreneurship Center to interact with founders and CEOs; and attend meetings to improve international network of professional contacts.

The impact

This is the first time Dilomado comes to Vietnam. Its mission is to bring Vietnamese intellectuals who are thirsty of understanding international politic, economic and social interaction to the well of these knowledges. Through the program's activities, we believe these youngers will understand more about the world and how they can contribute to develop where they are living to be a better place.

---------------------------------------------------------------------


HOW THE FUND WILL BE SPENT?

Thuy has started her own business from her personal saving during her hard working years. Four current projects (laid in 2014) have been consuming all of her budget. In order to run these two new projects, Thuy needs help from everybody to raise the funds. She will use raised money for two main purposes:

1. Marketing campaign: To promote the projects on media mostly newspaper and on Web. To produce print ads like poster, flier, brochures for introduction purpose. To conduct press conference. To organize seminars and related workshops.

Marketing cost breakdown:

  • PR articule run on top three online mazagize: $1500/article/1 week x 3 = $4500
  • Press conference for 50 guests: $5000 aprx.
  • Print ads: $2000 (including brochure, poster, cataglougue, flier designing and printing)
  • Specizalized small seminar and forums: 1 for each program, talkshow style with minimum 100 guests will be invited. $5000/ each event. 


2. Supporting applicants:  The majority amount will be spent on funding apllicants who want to join our program but face financial difficulty. Financial aid is decided upon need. 

  •  Participant for PA&EA coaching program can be grant up to $100/person (administration + materials fee + within city transportation).
  • Participant for Diplomado en Viena  can be granted one (01) return air ticket from Hanoi to Vienna which equals to $1500/person.

In 2015, Thuy wants to fund 50 PA&EA participants and 25 Diplomado participants.



UNIQUE PERKS 

If funds Thuy's projects, a person can have right to claim service from Sevencoloriris Inc. for him/herself OR anybody they know who may need Assistant services in Vietnam. This right has no time limit as long as Thuy's business still exists. 




Risks & Challenges

The only risk Thuy faces is that her business nature, Assistant service, is still perceived as NEW in Vietnam which may cause some hesitation in people who want to join her projects. However, Thuy's projects do not start from Zero. She has been running her company for more than a year and getting achievements. She is confident in herself that she will make people accept her new services as she did for other four projects. 
Thuy, as a woman and as an entreprenuer, is trying her best to be recognized by community in both her personal and professional independent life. For a woman like her, everything is possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the words about Thuy and her projects. She needs your help in sharing her campaign in Indiegogo and other networks like your facebook, Linkedin, Twitter and others, too.

Thank you for reading about Thuy and her business

May God bless you

Thuy and the Team

story:
Hello, we are 5th Wind Nation, Inc.

We've witnessed people trying their best to create a job, or get a job, only to be turned away, and from this, came an economic crisis for many and some of them committed crimes or other vices, in order to provide for themselves and their families. This has brought a heavy burden on our hearts and for the longest, we'd wonder, What could improve this situation?

Through our research, we've found out that there is at least one thing that we can do; that WE all can do, in order to create a better tomorrow for us and our children and the generation after them. And that is the Unity Center.  This center will help men and women not only get jobs but to create their own jobs. We will also promote cultural unity, unlike most places, where you would have to pay for these services. All of our services will be offered as free.  We will offer free classes, food, clothing and ways to bring about a better YOU. ♥

If you can help us create this Unity Center, I can guarantee, that little by little, we'll make a difference and help bring about a better tomorrow. 

With the Unity Center, we will try to bring unity within different communities, in hopes to get rid of racism and discrimination. No longer should our children hate themselves because of their beliefs, creeds, nor should they suffer mentally, physically or emotionally, just because they may be just different. 

Digital wallpaper, web credits, digital certificates, company t-shirts, posters, sticker, wristbands, live video updates, swag bags, 4 VIP webinars, VIP publicity and acknowledgement, Limited edition printed phone case with 3D-logo of our company, your name (or a friend or loved one's name) on the wall of the building and gratitude plaque, premier VIP seats during opening ceremony, custom jackets and caps with our logo and name, largest logo placement, recognition at the conference and VIP dinner! 

The Unity Center will offer several programs, such as:

  • Food Pantry and Clothing Giveaway: The clothing giveaway will be for both business and casual wear. This means giving out suits and outfits so that when you go to your job interview, you can look the best that you can be! We'll be offering job creation and assistance programs. Job assistance programs will be classes set-up to teach you how to keep your composure during a business interview, and to ensure your safe trip to and from the interviews. Job creation programs are there to help you to learn what business documents to include in order to lift your own business off the ground and to assist and help your business be the best that it could be. 

  • A walk-in freezer: So that any food in the food pantry will stay nice and fresh until you are able to take it home.


  • Laundry Room: This way, we can make sure that any clothing we give away is thoroughly cleaned. 


  • Library/PC Lab:  So that you can be able to research any and all info you want, for the support you need!

  • Store: This item is the last, but most important of them all. The reason behind the store is that so we can become self-sufficient and be able to offer the above items and services completely free of charge, whatsoever.

 The second thing we will use the money for is renovation of the building, that will meet safety requirements to ensure a nice and soothing environment for all to enjoy. 

    • A walk-in freezer: So that any food in the food pantry will stay nice and fresh until you are able to take it home. 
    •  office furnishings for the whole entire building. 
    • Research materials: (i.e. paper, books, etc.) that we will give out, so that you can create your own business, land a job and for our many class room items
    • A bus: To safely transport people to job interviews, field trips, etc.
    • The library and PC Lab: So that you can be able to research any and all info you want, for the support you need!
    • The store: This item is the last, but most important of them all. The reason behind the store is that so we can become self-sufficient and be able to offer the above items and services completely free of charge, whatsoever. 




As you sit and listen to those who commit hate crimes, self-infliction and much more, you can begin to understand how so many people act out their situations through their economic misunderstandings and lack of resources. 

As the economy goes down, discrimination and crime rises. Since, most don't understand how the economy falls, they begin to find reasons to hate or cause conflict, and when they begin to speak, most speak violently, but if you listen closely you can see that they really are crying for help. Not only that, due to miseducation and very little knowledge of other cultures, we fight amongst ourselves. That's why, we, at 5th Wind Nation feel that creating a Unity Center that provides educational and fundamental value to all walks of life, we believe this will unify and lower crime rates and depression. 


Risks & Challenges

As far as we know, there has not been another organization who has attempted to accomplish our goals on this scale, because of that some of the risks are unknown. 

There has been a few companies that have attempted to do parts of what we're doing and from that we realize what risks may come.  For one, when dealing with food pantries, sometimes the food can spoil extremely fast or be unfit for human consumption. We plan to meet this challenge by having a walk-in freezer unit.

This would allow us to properly store the food in a way so that it would not be ruined before giving it out to the public. 



If you'd like to contribute but lack the funds, there are many ways you can help:

  • By spreading the word about our fundraiser!
  • Ask us questions and get involved and we will answer anything you ask! ☺
  • Let us know any ideas and/or tips that you think may help! (We encourage people to speak their minds!)
Once the Unity Center is built, you can donate items that you think others may need that you no longer have use for.
