story:
I believe that with the proper plan and support, people are able to achieve their health goals.

So, I’ve created an algorithm that replicates how I personally create customized, periodized programs of diet and exercise for clients and surrounded it with support options.

   

                                             

   

Most people stop working out because they become bored with their workouts or they don’t see the results they want to see.  Even more people never get started because they just don’t know where to begin and the whole process is intimidating.  Whether you need help staying engaged in your workouts, accountability to show up when it’s tough, or the basic knowledge of what to do, BlackBox Trainer is the tool to get you and keep you on track.  

 A quality personal trainer can cost over $100/hr.  Most free software doesn't have the personalization, quality, or "done for you" aspect that this will.  There is just too much information out there to sort through in order to continually create workouts yourself when you would rather be working out and moving on with your day. In addition, when you create your own workouts, you're more likely to not complete them, cheat, or not do it at all. BlackBox Trainer does it all for you, with the quality of $100+/hr trainer, and at a price you can afford.    

This software creates personalized workouts for you according to your time, skill, fitness, and equipment.  It also generates nutritional suggestions for what you should be eating, how much, and when, in order to best reach your goals.  Additionally, with punishment and motivation options, you can get the accountability you need to show up to the gym even when you don’t feel like it. All this is delivered to you in a simple to use format on your computer and your mobile device.


                                              

The Plans

Workout plans: Customized to you!  Just like sitting down face to face with a trainer, you get plans that are based on your time, goal, level of fitness, activity level, skill, equipment you have available, gender, and age. These plans incorporate muscle confusion, periodization, intervals, and many more fitness concepts that I have learned and used with my clients over the years.  The plans are continually adjusting and adapting to keep you engaged and keep your body progressing towards your goal.  As we get more advanced, you will be able to adjust individual exercises to a higher or lower level of difficulty within a workout.  To start, you will be able to adjust the overall level of the workouts up and down. Additionally, you will be able to add in outside things down the road, such as: yoga, sports games, etc.

                 


Nutrition plans:  With BlackBox Trainer, you'll know what to eat (macros = protein, carbs, fat), how much, how often, and have examples of what can fill those suggestions so that you can pick things that fit your own particular tastes. Most gyms won’t even allow their trainers to give nutrition advice.  With this function you will be getting plans integrated with what you are doing in your workouts and life to properly fuel you along your way to your goal.  We will start with macronutrient and timing plans, allowing for the flexibility to choose items that are specific to your taste. As we progress, you will be able enter what items and tastes you prefer in order to have meals (with recipes) automatically planned for you.  And then the next step is to provide you with a weekly shopping list so that you can be even more efficient and effective with your plan.


                 

 


                                             


                      

Accountability: Some people like positive encouragement. Most people are motivated more though by the fear of loss rather than the hope of gain.  We’ll provide the choice of using either or both.  You will be able to get motivational emails, texts, and other forms of positive encouragement.  But, you can also elect to set yourself up with negative posts that automatically post to your Facebook or get sent to people via email if you miss a workout or an intermediate goal.  Additionally, you’ll be able to assign money to completing a workout or making a goal.  If you miss it, just as with a live trainer, you lose the cash.  Now that’s motivating!! Don’t worry, this feature is totally voluntary and you will be able to assign any dollar amount, down to one cent.  Also, 50% of that money we’ll be given to the Wounded Warrior Project, so you have some solace in not hitting your mark.

                                                         

Sharing and social: Some people like sharing their progress on their social media.  We’ll make that easy for you. Also, we will be creating a system where you can be matched with another user within the system of similar goal, gender, age, etc so that you can share stories and help motivate each other as well.  Your own workout buddy!

Results tracking:  At first, you will have to enter your results manually – just as you would keep a workout log and food journal.  As we advance, wearable devices will be able to take the place of that to automatically do it for you.  We’ll also be working on using photo technology to make food journaling easy as well.  Additionally, we’ll have the relevant charts you want to see: weight lost/gained, body fat lost/gained, measurement changes, strength/power/cardio improvements, and your own personal image library to view your body transform.  All of that on a simple dashboard for you.

(stock photo to illustrate point: not a client of mine)


                                          

                            


Other hardware: We will be working on incorporating Bluetooth scales,body fat analyzers, and other devices to make your results even easier to track.

Retail pricing vs campaign: Since some people will want just the workouts, and others will want just the nutrition, we will be offering the ability to have one or both.  The workout plans will be $7.99/mon and the nutritional plans will be $5.99/mon.  Through this campaign, you will see discounts around 40% off retail! 


                                            


Ask yourself,“How many people do I know that would workout more and eat a lot healthier if it were laid out for them? How many more would succeed if there were immediate consequences for not complying with the program?”  If you’re like me, you probably know a lot of people that fit those questions.  If you and I know that many people who could use it, imagine the good that could come from this system.  Also, diet and exercise is just the beginning.  With the amazing wearable technologies coming out, the ability to evolve BlackBox Trainer into a system that gets intertwined into all aspects of predicting, maintaining, and treating your health could extend our quality of life to unprecedented levels.

Additionally, once the product is complete and we are generating profit, I plan on donating 5% of the membership profit to the children of fallen soldiers (www.childrenoffallensoldiers.org). [To be clear, these donations will not be from the money received in this campaign.  This money is not profit; it will going straight into developing the product.]  

                                              


                                             


 

               

                        

Being a trainer with 4 different certifications, a former gym owner, an Olympic hopeful, and a veteran, I have come to learn that it’s much easier for people to achieve their goals and make life changes when there is a path laid out in front of them and there is support along the way to keep them on that path.  This is why this project (BlackBox Trainer) is so important to me.  I want the people in my life, and I am sure you want the people in your life, to be healthy, active, and around for a long time.  I am only one person though, so I can’t be constantly writing programs and diets, monitoring activity, and motivating all the people that you and I want to help.  This is why I spent over 3 years building and refining a construct that can replicate what I would personally produce for anyone of my friends, family, clients, or soldiers.  With your help in this campaign, we can finally get affordable, accessible, usable guidance to all those people in our lives that we want to spend our years with.


                                            



                         


The algorithm is built, the exercise library is large, a lot of code has already been written; however, there is more that needs to be done in order to finish the product and get it in your hands. In order to do this, I need to hire  a team of software engineers to complete the process.  The goal posted will be used to pay this team.  It is the very minimum amount needed to get the Beta version to those that sign up.  We already have a substantial amount of the code produced and this campaign will help to get us across the finish line and beyond. This is where the stretch goals come in.  With each milestone we hit, another person can be hired with the skill set needed to build that feature.  Software engineers are far from cheap and the more specialized their talents get, the more expensive it gets to hire them. 

                                              


Phased rollout of features:  For your benefit, the length of membership you pre-order through the perks won't start applying until after we transition from the Beta to 1.0 version. This means you get even longer use of the system! We want to get the system to you as soon as possible, even if that means not including all the features just yet. As we rollout features, you will be kept updated and have access to them right away.  Here is the current plan for phasing the growth of the system:

Beta: gym workouts

Beta +: manual tracking, macro nutrient guidance, accountability function, mobile responsive functionality

V.1.0: iOS and Android apps for mobile use 

V.2.0: First wearable (e.g. Atlas, fitbit, etc) integrated and native apps for iOS and Android

V.3.0: More detailed nutrition guidance with suggested weekly shopping lists with basic meal suggestions. Workouts able to integrate other fitness things you do, such as: yoga classes, group runs, sports leagues, etc.

V.4.0: Other hardware integrated (e.g. other wearables, body fat analyzer, scale, etc).

V.5.0: More Awesomeness!! see the longer list of features we plan to incorporate over the life of the system at: www.blackboxtrainer.com

What we need:

We’ve been chipping away at this slowly, but surely for a few years now.  While our CTO is very skilled and has been doing great work, he needs help.  A product like this needs a team to flesh it out completely and to continue to maintain and improve it as we become more advanced.  One man writing code after his full-time job and on the weekends in order to turn an algorithm, idea, and vision into hard code is just not fair to him or the users like yourself who could greatly benefit from this service now.  The more money we raise, the bigger and better a team we can hire to accelerate the production of the service and get it in your hands faster. 

Campaign Goals:

$42,500 – base line product including gym workouts, manual tracking, macro nutrient guidance, accountability selection, mobile responsive functionality, and apps for iOS and android  (version 1.0)

$100,000 – integration with ATLAS and fitbit for workout, activity, and sleep inputs (version 2.0)

$200,000 - more detailed nutrition guidance with suggested weekly shopping lists and basic meal suggestions (version 3.0)

$300,000 – Integration with scales, body fat analyzer, jawbone, and others (version 4.0)

$500,000+ – vote from you the contributors on what you would like to see incorporated!! (version 5.0)

Risks and challenges. The biggest risk will be not raising enough money to hire the talent needed.  If this is the case, the project will continue, it will just take significantly longer as the money will have to come from somewhere – which would probably be portions of my income.  If the funding goal is not reached, it could extend the production timeline from 6 months to over a year. This is why its crucial that you share the campaign with as many people as possible and ensure that they contribute!  We would all rather have the system operational in the next few months, instead of 15 months down the road.  So share the campaign and follow up with folks to make sure they contribute!

THANK YOU!! We can't do this without you! Take action now and help us bring to you the technology that can change your life and those of the ones you love!


                                 








Can't wait?  You can sign up for the old version (don't judge the layout, it'll be changing significantly) that does only workouts at the full retail price now at: 
www.workoutgenerator.net

Additionally, once the
product is complete and we are generating
profit, I plan on donating
5% of the membership profit
to the children of fallen soldiers (www.childrenoffallensoldiers.org). [To be clear, these
donations will not be from the money received in this campaign.  This
money is not profit; it will going straight into developing the product.]                                                                                              
               


                        
Being a trainer with 4 different certifications, a former gym
owner, an Olympic hopeful, and a veteran, I have come to learn that it’s much
easier for people to achieve their goals and make life changes when there
is a path laid out in front of them and there is support along the way to keep them on that path.  This is why this project (BlackBox Trainer) is so important to
me.  I want the people in my life, and I am sure you want the people in
your life, to be healthy, active, and around for a long time.  I am only
one person though, so I can’t be constantly writing programs and diets,
monitoring activity, and motivating all the people that you and I want to
help.  This is why I spent over 3 years building and refining a construct
that can replicate what I
would personally produce for
anyone of my friends, family, clients, or soldiers.  With your help in
this campaign, we can finally get affordable, accessible, usable guidance to
all those people in our lives that we want to spend our years with.

                                            



                         

The algorithm is built,
the exercise library is large, a lot of code has already been written; however,
there is more that needs to be done in order to finish the product and get it
in your hands. In order to do this, I need to hire  a team of software engineers to complete the process.  The
goal posted will be used to pay this team.  It is the very minimum amount
needed to get the Beta version to those that sign up.
 We already have a substantial
amount of the code produced and this campaign will help to get us across the finish line and beyond. This is
where the stretch goals come in.  With each milestone we hit, another
person can be hired with the skill set needed to build that feature. 
Software engineers are far from cheap and the more specialized their talents
get, the more expensive it gets to hire them. 
                                              

Phased rollout
of features:  For your benefit, the length of membership you
pre-order through the perks won't start applying until after we transition from
the Beta to 1.0 version. This means you get even longer use of the system! We
want to get the system to you as soon as possible, even if that means not
including all the features just yet. As we rollout features, you will be kept
updated and have access to them right away.  Here is the current plan for
phasing the growth of the system:
Beta: gym workouts
Beta +: manual tracking, macro nutrient guidance, accountability
function, mobile responsive functionality
V.1.0: iOS and Android apps for mobile use 
V.2.0: First wearable (e.g. Atlas, fitbit, etc) integrated and native apps for iOS and Android
V.3.0: More detailed nutrition guidance with suggested weekly
shopping lists with basic meal suggestions. Workouts able to integrate other
fitness things you do, such as: yoga classes, group runs, sports leagues, etc.
V.4.0: Other hardware integrated (e.g. other wearables, body fat analyzer, scale, etc). 
V.5.0: More
Awesomeness!! see the longer list of features we plan to incorporate over the
life of the system at: www.blackboxtrainer.com
What we need:
We’ve been chipping away
at this slowly, but surely for a few years now. 
While our CTO is very skilled and has been doing great work, he needs
help.  A product like this needs a team
to flesh it out completely and to continue to maintain and improve it as we become more advanced.  One
man writing code after his full-time job and on the weekends in order to turn
an algorithm, idea, and vision into hard code is just not fair to him or the
users like yourself who could greatly benefit from this service now.  The more money we raise, the bigger and
better a team we can hire to accelerate the production of the service and get it
in your hands faster.  
Campaign Goals:
$42,500 – base line
product including gym workouts, manual tracking, macro nutrient guidance,
accountability selection, mobile responsive functionality, and apps for iOS and
android  (version 1.0)
$100,000 – integration
with ATLAS and fitbit for workout, activity, and sleep inputs (version 2.0)
$200,000 - more
detailed nutrition guidance with suggested weekly shopping lists and basic meal
suggestions (version 3.0)
$300,000 – Integration
with scales, body fat analyzer, jawbone, and others (version 4.0)
$500,000+ – vote from you
the contributors on what you would like to see incorporated!! (version 5.0)
Risks and
challenges. The biggest risk
will be not raising enough
money to hire the talent
needed.  If this is the case, the
project will continue, it will just take significantly
longer as the money will have
to come from somewhere – which would probably be portions of my income.  If
the funding goal is not reached, it could extend the production timeline from 6
months to over a year. This is why its crucial that you share the campaign with as many people as
possible and ensure that they contribute!  We would all
rather have the system operational in the next few months, instead of 15 months
down the road.  So share
the campaign and follow up with folks to make sure they
contribute!
THANK YOU!! We
can't do this without you! Take action now and help us bring to you the
technology that can change your life and those of the ones you love!


                                 









Can't wait?  You can sign up for the old version (don't judge the layout, it'll be changing significantly) that does only workouts at the full retail price now at: 
www.workoutgenerator.net

story:
TWO WAY Fillet™ - Fish Cleaning System

Fillet A Better Way™

Our Story:   Two friends were busy cleaning limits of white bass, walleye, and crappie resulting in very sore thumbs by the end of the process.  Two fish slipped back into the lake.  They looked at each other and said: "There has to be something to help us Fillet a Better Way!" After several hours in our garage we had made the clamp and board shown below.  

 This clamp worked well holding fish on its side anchoring it for the fillet process.  To our surprise there was no product like this prototype in the Patent system, so we submitted a patent application.  The result was a Utility and Process Patent for the TWO WAY Fillet™ fish cleaning system, that keeps the meat and leaves the bones behind.  We found that using TWO WAY Fillet™ made cleaning fish fast, safe, with less waste, and with less cuts, scrapes, sticks and pressure on hands and thumbs - like giving you a third hand!

First working TWO WAY Fillet™ working clamp:

                   Original Home Made Prototype HDPE  Board With Hinge

Many anglers cringe when it is time to clean the fish because it is messy, the fish slip all over the place and the chance for getting stuck or cut by a fin or knife is very real.  TWO WAY Fillet™ fish cleaning equipment is proving it can change those ideas and opinions.

  • The secret is the way TWO WAY FIllet™ holds the fish by replacing the anglers thumb and forefinger on the lower jaw of the fish, positioning the fish on its side when you snap the clamp into the board.
The secret is how the TWO WAY Fillet™ positions the fish on the board:

  • TWO WAY Fillet™ system anchors the slippery fish to the fillet board on its side, freeing up a hand, like giving the angler a third hand.  This means that novice to experienced anglers alike will be able to fillet fish with confidence, safety and more accuracy - meaning more fish for dinner!
  • Perfect Gift Idea for every Angler.
When you are faced with a huge mess of fish to clean:

TWO WAY Fillet™ will help anglers finish this job easily, and go from the fish cleaning house to here:

Whether baked or fried, boneless fresh fish is delicious! 

It is also important to have an official taste tester:

Prototype in Use:   (Locusts heard in Background) :

  • This video shows a prototype in action with a nice white bass.  (No Locusts were harmed while taping this video.)
  • Your participation in this project will help jump start the launch of this  new, innovative, game changing fish cleaning equipment for all anglers. This means that more anglers will learn and enjoy cleaning their catch, which means that more family and friends will be able to enjoy freshly caught fish for lunch or dinner.

What We Need - to Launch TWO WAY Fillet

Immediate funding needs:
  • $4,500 to fund CAD drawings and  prototyping
  • $24,000 injection mold tooling for fillet board
  • $16,000 Injection Mold for clamp
  • $15.000 to make first production run of 1,500
  • Indiegogo funding added to our own investment to date will help to fund our first 12 months!  All funds over goal will be to put to ongoing patent expenses, increased production, travel and expenses of sport show displays and advertising.
  • We are working with a plastic company in Oklahoma City to have the mold made, and then to make the TWO WAY Fillet™ fish cleaning system there as well.  These funds listed come from their proposal to us.

Impact of Project

Help change the opinion of many anglers - that cleaning fish is messy, dangerous, and hard.  Replace that notion with this game changing invention - TWO WAY Fillet™.  

More anglers:

  • Will want to clean their catch -  will do it faster and  more accurately which means they will save more of their fish to serve for dinner.
  • Will be excited not just to go fishing, but to keep, clean and serve their catch for dinner.
  • Will improve the safety of cleaning fish - improved safety and accuracy means less hand and finger cuts, abrasions and sticks.
  • Will be able to Fillet A Better Way™, as if they had a third hand.

Risks & Challenges

Biggest challenge for us it to raise the money.   We have already had prototypes expenses, patent expenses, trademark expenses, and more.  We have shared our prototypes with several professional anglers and countless avid anglers all of whom have told us they want one.  One professional angler told us he that he never found a production fillet board to be any better than an old 2x6 that he uses.  However, this changed his mind. and he wants one from the first production run.   

Secondly, getting TWO WAY Fillet™ into distribution channels.  We have 3 professional anglers with contacts in this arena who have told us they will help with this once we have production inventory.  One is editor of fishing magazine and has told us he will have an article written about it when launched.

  • Built an information website on fishing:  www.practical-fishing-tips.com  - over 160 pages of information including cleaning fish, fillet boards, and much more.
  • Built website - online store www.filletboard.com .  Although viewable, this site is still under construction, which means that the store is not live yet, but will go live with first production run. 
  • We have registered and own 6 domain names surrounding the words fillet board.
  • 4 trusted, experienced, professional anglers have used a TWO WAY Fillet™ prototype and approved of its usage.   They each one encouraged us to proceed and have given testimonials and have requested their own TWO WAY Fillet™ to use with customers.
  • Identified other professional anglers/guides who are interested in finished product, and have volunteered to test and write articles.  They have also agreed to use TWO WAY Fillet to clean their fish in front of customers.
  • Will attend sport/fishing shows demonstrating TWF system
  • Will market to marina's and fishing shops across Midwest and walleye country.
  • Have discussed with 2 buyers for sport shops and retail stores who want to see the finished product.

  Other Ways You Can Help

Can't participate in donating at this time?  We need your help in spreading the word about this new fillet board:

  • Tell all your friends, anyone and everyone,  especially those who love to fish and/or spouses of friends who fish.  Everyone knows someone who loves to fish - pass on to everyone.  What a great gift idea for any angler.
  • Identify and inform any contacts that may have involvement in sport or fishing magazines shows, professional angling tours, fishing guides or walleye fishing
  • Use all the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My husband Gary and I bought our first scooters in 2006 for our 5th wedding anniversary. We bought two 50cc Honda Metropolitans and immediately fell in love with scootering. A month later, we took our little 50cc scooters on a 700 mile road trip across two states. It was the trip of a lifetime.

Scootering became the center of our lives. In the fall of 2006 we attended our first scooter rally – Scoot-a-Que organized by the local scooter club the Columbus Cutters.  Gary organized an on-line scooter club called the Easy Peasey Scooter Posse which today boasts over 150 members. Through scootering, we met amazing people who have become lifelong friends. Those of us in Columbus ride together every Sunday and play scooter tag; the Posse has grown to be a wonderful online community of scooterists.

In the summer of 2008 Gary and I decided to live our dream by opening our own scooter shop so we could spend 24/7 doing all things scooter related. One week before we were scheduled to open Gary suffered a heart attack and passed away on December 10th. Our dream, however, did not die. Gary's son Chris, in one of the most selfless acts I have ever witnessed, offered to move from Kansas to Columbus and help me run the shop.  Four days after his father's funeral Chris packed what he could in his car and moved in with me, leaving his friends and family behind to help continue, what is now, the Didier dream business.  Chris has an automotive technology degree and is an incredibly skilled and dedicated mechanic.  In the midst of grieving over his father's passing and moving to a new city where he knew no one, Chris jumped in and has built the reputation Gary and I sought to achieve - that of providing quality, honest service for members of the scooter community.  In fact, he has outdone himself to the point that for the last two years we have been booked 6 weeks out for service. We simply do not have the room to take in more bikes for service.  After 6 ½ years, we have outgrown our space.

Then, in one of those “meant to be” moments, I learned that the historic Glen Echo Garage was for sale. This was the location where Gary and I had wanted to originally open the shop but it wasn’t available then. I approached my dad, an entrepreneur himself, who I deeply admire and who’s opinion I cherish, and asked what he thought. He was 100% behind the idea and said how proud he was of us and how far we’ve come.

This is an important step in the growth of our business. We anticipate we can not only cut down on the time people have to wait for a service appointment but that we could double the amount of service our current location currently limits us to. We will be able to control our costs. We will have a parking lot! No more jockeying for a space on the street. And we will be right around the corner from our current location. We feel this move will help our neighbors as well. As a scooter shop we will continue the history and keep the integrity of the building as a service garage. I was born and raised and currently live in the University District and, following in my mom’s footsteps, am committed to the preservation and well-being of this community. In short, it’s perfect!

After much number crunching we realized that we can afford the mortgage and monthly expenses associated with a larger space. So we negotiated with the Seller and now we are in contract! However, as a small mom and pop (or mom and stepson in this case) business, what we don’t have is the down payment. We are using our own savings towards the down payment and the cost of the move but we need help.

This is where all of you wonderful people come in! Help us keep small business thriving in Columbus, help us keep a unique and historic building in the community. Summers are short! Help us to ensure you don’t lose half a riding season waiting to get your scooter in for repairs. It’s a win- win all around. You can help by sharing our campaign and making a contribution! Every contribution will be commemorated on a contributor wall. But we have other perks as well!

Thank you so much for clicking through and taking the time to read our story. Thank you for supporting me, Chris and Capital City Scooters.

Cheers!

Caitlin Didier

story:
Odd Obsession Movies is moving, expanding, and with your help we are staying open indefinitely! Our incredible collection of DVDs and VHSs will be moved in its entirety to the brighter and more spacious layout of 1830 N Milwaukee Avenue as of June 1st. 

We are using this crowd-fund to not only expand our already mammoth collection, but to become more sustainable in this age of streaming and downloading. We are asking for your help being that you are a key part of this very special cultural resource, and understand its value and importance.

The incentives we're offering are very generous including free rentals in varying durations, plus other really cool items like limited edition Odd Obsession coffee mugs, t-shirts, out of print VHS tapes, and even original African artwork! Whatever you can give within your budget will be well worth your while.

Our new space is two storefronts wide and much brighter, but most importantly it is way more affordable, which has been a major factor in our decision to move. This is a pivotal step for Odd Obsession to be able to upkeep and expand our collection of approximately 20,000 DVDs and 5,000 VHS titles, many of which have become damaged or gone missing, and are very expensive to replace.

We hope that this campaign will provide a cushion for us to research and apply for grants within our first year in this new space. We view ourselves as a Library of Film, an expansive resource which is being used by film critics, professors, students and enthusiasts, as well as people who just want access to cool movies they might otherwise not be able to find.

Spread the word about the great incentives this crowd-fund offers to all your friends and family who love cinema, and of course all of you should come and visit us in the new and improved Odd Obsession Movies as of June 1st 2015!

story:
The Paleo Revolution

Welcome to Baby Ruggles, where we're bringing Paleo cuisine and classic French pastry together in a modern and electric atmosphere. We are converting the Oui Desserts location on Kirby and Richmond into a new bakery, Baby Ruggles Bakery and Food Bar, offering decadent pastries, paleo desserts,  coffees, and clean sandwiches on artisan breads, and any money given here will contribute to our renovation using local, green products.

The Paleo Revolution, being lead by Bruce Molzan, offers unprocessed, healthy, flavorful food to the masses. Molzan has teamed up with pastry chef, Jennifer Ramos, a classically french trained patissier, to realize this concept in our new location in the trendy Upper Kirby area(currently Oui Desserts). Join us, and be a part of the rise of pastry innovation in Houston. 


The Impact

Paleo fare introduces a new way of eating that is sustainable to the environment, and free of processed foods. It harkens back to a time 2.5 million years ago when humans were lean, and ate whole foods like nuts, berries, meats, and vegetables. Fast forward to modern times and the average human is overweight, unhealthy, and unhappy with a diet of processed grains, sugars, and corn. Help us bring healthy, tasty, and delicious Paleo to your table!


What We Need & What You Get


We are seeking to raise $50,000 for the remodel of our new location and the latest equipment to bring Paleo to the multitudes. Once a contributor, you will become an integral part of our pastry transformation, and will be afforded unique opportunities such as, private baking lessons with Chef Jennifer Ramos or Bruce Molzan in your home, discounts, free desserts, and an all access pass to the grand opening of our bakery.  Embark with us on this venture and delve into the sugar coated world of Baby Ruggles.



Spread the Word!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Bruce Molzan

Bruce Molzan’s many years of experience in several famous Houston restaurants have made him one of the region’s most celebrated chefs.  After bringing his most recent projects, Ruggles Green and Corner Table, to a spectacular success, he reinvented himself once again with the opening of Ruggles Black with partner Neera Patidar in 2014. 

And, like with everything Molzan does, he has created yet another one-of-kind menu unlike anything else in the country making him the King of Paleo among foodies everywhere.

Molzan’s quest to constantly reinvent himself and his culinary art began with his training under nationally acclaimed chefs, Herve Glin, who served as a mentor, and at Los Angeles’ Spago under Wolfgang Puck.  However, it was at the Warwick Hotel in Houston, Texas, that Molzan was credited with changing the Houston dining landscaping by nixing the traditional meat and two sides entrees and replacing them with creative and inventive fresh farm-to-table vegetables and over the top signature desserts. 

Since the 1980s, Molzan has been a mainstay on the Houston restaurant scene constantly on the cutting edge of new trends and exceeding expectations across the Ruggles brand with other favorites such as: Ruggles 5115, Ruggles Bakery, Ruggles Bistro Latino, Corner Table, Ruggles Green, and Ruggles Black. 

Among his many local, regional and nation accolades, Bruce Molzan is a Bocuse d’Or winner. He is called upon by countless celebrities and remains a favorite of professional athletes – serving as the Houston Texans Taste of the NFL chef.  Like with all Molzan’s restaurants, his out-of-the-box vision for creating a one-of-a-kind dining experience is only magnified by his demands for exceptional service and an always lively atmosphere. 

Molzan earned a Bachelor’s of Arts degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management from James Madison University; graduated in the top ten in his class from the Culinary Arts Institute of America and continues to be one of the most recognized and innovative chefs in the industry.

Jennifer Ramos

Pastry Chef, Jennifer Ramos, was classically trained at The Culinary Institute Lenotre. The school was founded in 1998 by a third generation French chef, Alain Lenotre, who was trained as a cook at The Grand Vefour in Paris.

She is fluent in the French pastry arts, chocolate work, candy work, and sugar. She has experience in local specialty catering, worked under Chef Bryan Caswell at Stella Sola in Houston, and produced elegant dishes for The Olivette restaurant at the Houstonian Hotel.

 Ramos's journey to bring together time-honored pastry techniques with modern styles brought her to open Oui Desserts, the quintessential Parisian pastry stop in Houston. Her unique take on the French Macaron gained accolades as number two in Houston for it's gently crisp shell and bold  fillings of chocolate ganache and fresh, local fruit. 

By assembling with Chef Molzan and the Ruggles team, she hopes to add her confectionary prowress to the Paleo movement and create an invigorating experience for those looking to indulge in dessert.


Penny Roberts

Assistant Pastry Chef, Penny Roberts, comes from a enduring line of bakers, the Jeansonne's. A second generation immigrant from France, her grandmother, Marion Lacour Jeansonne's family settled in Louisiana where Marian soon integrated her French technique with local ingredients and traditional foods. Her recipe for flaky buttermilk biscuits won a state-wide baking competition and led The Popeyes restaurants to ascertain the recipe for their launch of bisuits in 1983. 
Chef Penny learned to cook in her small home kitchen, and went on to perfect her baking skills at The Houstonian Hotel, working with classic French pastries, modern chocolate work, candy making, and breads, and eventually becoming the pastry sous chef before developing her own catering service, Savory et Sucre. She arcuated her macaron techniques in the French meringue style at The Sweet Boutique in Houston, and studied under Chef Jennifer Ramos at Oui Desserts.
Oui Desserts(future Baby Ruggles) Location:
3411 Kirby Dr, Houston, TX 77098
(713) 487-9788
story_txt:
The Paleo Revolution

Welcome to Baby Ruggles,
 where we're bringing Paleo cuisine and classic French pastry together 
in a modern and electric atmosphere. We are converting the Oui Desserts location on Kirby and Richmond into a new bakery, Baby Ruggles Bakery and Food Bar, offering decadent pastries, paleo desserts,  coffees, and clean sandwiches on artisan breads, and any money given here will contribute to our renovation using local, green products.The Paleo Revolution, being lead by Bruce Molzan, offers unprocessed, healthy, flavorful food to the 
masses. Molzan has teamed up with pastry chef, Jennifer Ramos, a 
classically french trained patissier, to realize this concept in our new
 location in the trendy Upper Kirby area(currently Oui Desserts). Join us, and be a part of the 
rise of pastry innovation in Houston.  







The Impact
Paleo fare introduces a new way of eating that is sustainable to the environment, and free of processed foods. It harkens back to a time 2.5 million years ago when humans were lean, and ate whole foods like nuts, berries, meats, and vegetables. Fast forward to modern times and the average human is overweight, unhealthy, and unhappy with a diet of processed grains, sugars, and corn. story:
~755,400 people in metro Atlanta and north Georgia are food insecure. CCI works with farmers, teachers, and health professionals who are changing that.

In October 2014, the Center for Civic Innovation launched a program to find new or different ideas to solve Atlanta's challenge of food access. 49 entrepreneurs answered the call, and we brought on almost a dozen for a six month, intensive acceleration program. Today, in their six month, they are ready to begin testing their programs

We need funding to make important early-stage investments in these and future pilot programs. It is vital to the future of our city that we encourage low-cost experimentation to figure out what solutions work in our communities.

About our food entrepreneurs:

  • These pilot programs will test new or different ideas to tackle the problem of food access in Atlanta, especially on the west side of the city
  • The project topics focus on production, nutrition education, serving underserved populations (including pregnant women and children), tackling childhood obesity, and increasing food security
  • 30% of our entrepreneurs are growers, 20% provide educational services, 30% are focused on health and prepared foods, and 20% are retail service providers
  • 66% of our participants are of color; and 62% are women
  • 9/10 of the projects focus on Atlanta's most underserved communities

Your money helps support pilot programs for new solutions to food access and other civic challenges

We are so lucky to have had the support of the Atlanta community over this past year. All money raised from this campaign will help us invest directly in pilot programs of local entrepreneurs who have participated in our Civic Lab programs.

This matters: we are investing in innovation

Early stage capital is very difficult to get for social entrepreneurs. They are often not eligible for charitable contributions and they are not big enough for traditional investments. This makes funding their work very difficult. 

All projects have been vetted and guided by the Center for Civic Innovation and its partners at the Atlanta Community Food Bank, Arby's Foundation, and Invest Atlanta

How we ensure impact and learning:

  • We will monitor and report on all investments for six months, which will include on the ground support for each venture
  • We will provide each investment with mentorship and individual advising
  • All investment companies are given free space at CCI's office

Other Ways You Can Help

We are built off of the support of our Atlanta community. We need your help in more ways than one!

  • The Center for Civic Innovation just won the 2015 Echoing Green Global Fellowship-- spread the word! http://www.civicatlanta.org/echoing-green
  • Let people know about the work we are doing to help the entrepreneurs who are making our city better
  • Spread the word on Facebook and Twitter

We are so thankful for you!

story:
Summary

Hi everyone! Thanks so much for checking out our crowd funding page.  My husband, Al and I started Far From the Tree at the end of 2013 after returning from a three-year sabbatical in England.  It was there Al gained valuable experience making wine in Europe and earning his wine making degree. While he kept busy with his studies, I was falling madly in love with dry English ciders.  In July of 2013, we decided to move back to Massachusetts and create ciders that were not available in the U.S. market. And so Far From the Tree was born, with a mission to produce traditional, small batch, barrel-aged hard cider.

Al is the head of cider development and I run the operational side of the business.  Our cider house is located in Salem where we’ve been making cider since February of last year.  What sets Far From the Tree apart from the competition is our commitment to the local community. We use 100 percent Massachusetts apples and natural, locally-sourced ingredients in all of our products while adhering to traditional cider-making methods that go back hundreds of years. Cider was the drink of choice in early America, especially here in New England. 

During our first year, we’ve done so many great events from beer and wine festivals to fundraisers, tastings at liquor stores and being a part of several farmers markets. Receiving direct feedback from our patrons is of great importance to us.  We are passionate about creating new and interesting combinations that really get people excited about our cider. Their opinion is what keeps us motivated to continue to develop new varietals.

Bottom Line: We always knew we wanted to open a space where the community could stop by to see what we are up to, learn how we make our cider and also have the opportunity to sample our latest experiments. Well, we have found that space!  Our tasting room will be located at the corner of Jackson Street and Jefferson Avenue, about a half mile from downtown Salem. This is the perfect location for us since it is right next door to our cider house. While we have the funds to pay for rent, we will really need help from the community to build out this awesome space. We are planning to open our tasting room doors this summer!

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for at least $10,000 to help us make our tasting room one of the coolest community spaces in Salem. The funds will be used for tables and chairs, lighting, paint, flooring, a dishwasher, glassware and outside signs.  As a token of our appreciation, we will shower you with some pretty unique gifts, including: t-shirts, glasses, discounts on cider and merchandise, a mug club, a “meet the cider makers” party, a tutorial on how to make cider, an opportunity to create a new varietal or have a cider named after you and tickets to our pre-opening party.


Community Impact

Our company has been part of a group that has worked to change the zoning ordinance that allows breweries, wineries and distilleries to be located in Salem.  Before last summer, there was no use. Receiving approval to open our tasting room from the zoning board is not just a win for us, it is a win for the community. The city of Salem is more than just the month of October. It’s a thriving community of creative professionals and we are honored to be considered a part of this movement. We have felt at home here since day one. The community has been incredibly supportive and that notion alone has been the main catalyst for us to create this space. We envision being open six days a week and having special events regularly with music, poetry readings, artist exhibits, etc. We want to showcase not only our cider, but the impressive creative community that exists here in Salem.

We believe we have created a growing fan base comprised of people who are interested in seeing what we are up to next.  We are truly committed to using 100 percent Massachusetts apples and high quality ingredients.  We do not comprise on this.  Our ciders are mostly dry and we are working on a line of off-dry cider that will have a little more maple syrup added to enhance the apples’ flavor.  We plan on experimenting as much as we can so our fans will keep coming back to sample our latest and greatest products.  We value feedback from the community so please let us know if you have any ideas for a new cider. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If we don’t reach our entire goal, that’s OK.  Any amount of money will help us to get the things we need. Hey, our guests may have to sit on lawn chairs for a while until we can afford better seating, but everyone has to start somewhere, right? We would love help from builders, sign makers, interior designers, painters, etc.  If you have a skill or trade or know someone who could help us either for free or at a discounted rate, that would just as good as contributing funds. 

It would be also be beneficial to us if you could help spread the word via email and/or social media, especially if you have any talented folks in mind who you think would interested in donating to our cause.  We can’t wait to see you sipping on our cider in Salem’s first tasting room. Thank you greatly for your time and for reading this until the end. Cheers, friends!

story:
What this is all about....

Does turning a bus into a medical office sound crazy to you? Well, maybe it is... but it's also a great way to bring healthcare to those who need it the most.

My name is Anja Widmann and I´m an American Board Certified pediatrician. After completing medical school in Germany and pediatric residency in New York, I moved to Puerto Escondido, Mexico to open a pediatric practice in 2012. Some would call that crazy, too. But it has been very rewarding, interesting and challenging.

                                        

 Now it´s time to expand that care to communities further off the grid.

Along the coast of Oaxaca, one of the poorest states in Mexico, there is a lack of access to pediatric healthcare. Many children will spend their entire childhood  without ever seeing a Pediatrician and families are relying on very basic health care offered by occasional health brigades and local nurses. Many of the rural medical facilities are deficient of basic medical supplies, equipment and people are required to travel large distances for adequate care.

I want to change that....

The focus of the project is to offer basic pediatric health care, including well and sick child care, preventive medicine and education on a variety of health related topics in various communities along the coast.

So, this is what I will do:

             

I will remodel this bus into a fully functional mobile medical unit and I will visit communities along the Oaxacan Coast 1-2 days per week. There will be an affordable fee for consultations, in order to cover ongoing expenses and to ensure self sustainability of the project.


I NEED YOUR HELP to fund the purchase and transformation of the bus. Please donate and support a project with a direct impact on local healthcare!!

FYI, I´m not affiliated with any religious, political or non- governmental organizations. 

If you have any questions please contact me at dra.anja@oasisdelpacifico.com!

In case you want to know more details:

 A lot more details....


1. STATEMENT OF PROBLEM

1.1 Introduction to the problem

The state of Oaxaca is one of the poorest and most underdeveloped states in Mexico. This area suffers from shortages of many things; medical and dental care being some of the more serious needs of these communities.

The cities and large towns have medical care available especially for those who can pay for it. In small, out of the way towns, where only a subsistence style of living is available, medical care is sparse and qualified pediatric care mostly not available. In these communities with high rates of poverty and disease and with limited access to health resources, children are extremely vulnerable as parents may not have the means or sufficient knowledge to provide nutritious meals, pay for clinic visits, prevent accidents or recognize potentially serious childhood illnesses.

Childhood is a critical time for physical, mental and emotional development and serious health problems during this time can adversely affect an individual for the rest of their life. Children suffering from malnutrition, infectious diseases, violence, injuries, and chronic diseases (HIV, asthma, etc.) are more likely to have challenges learning in school and less likely to succeed. Recognizing and treating these health issues as soon as possible will allow them to recover and increase their capacity to learn and gain a meaningful education. Preventing and treating disease in childhood is essential for the development of individuals, communities and the nation.

Examples of the illnesses that are common in these communities are malnutrition (in both of its extremes: Obese and underweight children), anemia, respiratory illness, asthma, intestinal parasites, chronic diarrhea, Dengue fever and other tropical diseases.

1.2 Statement of need

There is an apparent need for pediatric and primary health care in these low-income areas. Limited transportation, lack of access to health related information, cultural differences and language barriers are some of the factors leading to suboptimal healthcare coverage in this area.

These communities are among those with a high percentage of children living in poverty and without access to general health care, let alone specialized pediatric care.

As a traveling health clinic whose purpose is to effectively provide access to the high quality healthcare to underserved children from birth to 18 years we would like to build strong community-based relationships. These partnerships will allow to gain community trust, leverage resources, improve program capacity and increase access to healthcare for children in need.

There is a need for “medical home” for each patient.  A medical home is not a place – it’s a partnership between a pediatric clinician and the child and family. By establishing an ongoing relationship, supported by our custom made electronic health record system, the health care provider can follow through to ensure all a child’s health needs are met. 

That’s an important approach. But, children who have been medically underserved and are challenged by poverty, need even more.  They often have multiple medical issues and problems that have compounded.

Ironically, these children who often need the most care are the ones who typically have access to the least.  We believe that these kids need an “enhanced medical home” that provides primary pediatric care, including screening, prevention, identification and management of acute and chronic conditions, as well as health education for the children and their family.

2. PROJECT DESCRIPTION

2.1 Mission Statement

The Oasis del Pacífico Mobile Pediatric Care Unit  will provide affordable, high quality primary pediatric care and family-centered education to communities along the Oaxacan Coast.

2.2 Statement of purpose

A mobile pediatric care unit, covering a various communities along the Oaxacan coast will accomplish the following:

1) Increase access to cost effective, high quality pediatric care.

2) Provide the type of care that supports, educates and reinforces families’ health choices.

3) Provide family-centered care that promotes strong familiar bonds.

2.3 Geographic reach & Population served

The mobile clinic will be based out of Puerto Escondido, a small town on the pacific coast in the state of Oaxaca, Mexico. Initially will offer services to communities within eight selected municipios of the districts of Juquila and Pochutla.

1.  District of Juquila:

·  San Gabriel Mixtepec

·  San Pedro Mixtepec
·  Santos Reyes Nopala
·  Santa Catarina Juquila

2.  District of Pochutla

·  San Pedro Pochutla
·  San Baltazar Loxicha
·  Santa Maria Tonameca
·  San Sebastián Coatlán

These communities lack local access to nearby basic pediatric care and patients and their families are required to travel large distances to receive such care. 

2.4 Project overview

The Pediatric Mobile Clinic will travel to communities along the Oaxacan Coast, providing pediatric health care where it is needed the most.

Healthcare:

The Pediatric Mobile Clinic will improve the quality of care and the overall health of children living in these communities by bringing services directly to the populations at highest risk, providing comprehensive medical care including:

·  Well-child exams
·  Sick visits
·  Basic laboratory testing
·  An array of health & developmental screenings

Health education:

The Clinic also will provide significant patient-centered health education focusing on healthy balanced nutrition, importance of physical activity, basic first aid, and common childhood illnesses. We will provide this education through interactive PowerPoint presentations, group discussions and through the development of community lead health projects. We believe that it is important that families take responsibility for their own health and want to support them in making healthier and better choices for their children and themselves.

Pharmacy:

We will provide common pediatric medications from an on-board pharmacy since the nearest pharmacy is often miles away and many families cannot afford the necessary medications for their children. We will sell medication at wholesale prices to make them more accessible.

2.4.1 The first phase (4-6 weeks)

During this initial phase we will purchase this well preserved microbús. With a team of already established volunteers, including an experienced mechanic we will convert this unit into a full functioning pediatric mobile practice.

2.4.2 The second phase (4-6 weeks)

During this phase we will contact local authorities to ask for their support in this project and will establish a schedule for visits in the initial 8 communities. In each community we will create a group of local volunteers that are willing to help and support the project. We will also start advertising the service in the communities, working closely with local government agencies, schools and

2.4.3 The third phase

During this phase we will initiate our visits to the different communities. All visits will be documented in our electronic medical record system, which will allow adequate follow up and facilitate continuous care. The goal is to see between 20-30 patients per day, which allows an adequate amount of time spent with each patient.

2.5 Anticipated outcomes

The community will benefit by the increased access to quality care. As an immediate benefit we will contribute to lower infant and child morbidity rates and increase knowledge and awareness throughout the population via multiple educational presentations.

Because of the clinic's regularly scheduled visits to the communities, a long term follow up of patients will be possible, including monitoring of growth and development and closer follow up on chronic conditions and reoccurring problems that can be addressed on a regular basis. This is an improvement compared to the health brigades that visit these communities much less frequent.

With increasing experience the goal is to identify and expand services to additional areas in need, for example maternal healthcare, dental care etc.

2.6 Mobile Medical Care Unit

The used microbus is in very good condition and is being offered at an attractive price. Turning it into a full functioning medical mobile unit will require remodeling and adjusting the interior design, including fitting it an A/C unit and clean water supply structures, as well as basic diagnostic and medical equipment.  The size of the mobile unit will allow for medical diagnostic support in form of a small lab.

2.7 Staffing and Maintenance

The medical director and pediatrician for this mobile unit will be Dr. Anja Widmann, a board certified pediatrician that works at her pediatric office in Puerto Escondido, supported by local volunteers( including nurses, anthropologists, nutritionists and midwifes/ doulas) who already expressed their desire to participate in this project. The mobile clinic will be maintained by local volunteers and a mechanic, who are supporting this project. 

Ok, let´s talk money.....Budget Overview

We need help purchasing, repairing, remodeling, repainting, refurnishing & adapting this bus into a mobile medical unit.
In order to make the project self- sustainable and to not depend on further funding we will cover all operational cost ( fuel, repairs, medical supplies, salaries etc) through the reasonable nominal fees we´ll charge for our services ( between 100-200 Mexican pesos ( = approx. 6-12 US dollars )per patient encounter).

This Budget is an estimate after detailed inspection of the Camper Van and requested quotes for adjustments, repairs and refitting etc.

                                                                                                                  US DOLLARS

  • Microbus ( actual price)                                                            3 000.-
  • Mechanical Repairs/Parts                                                        1500.-
  • Interior remodeling                                                                      1 000.-
  • Furniture                                                                                            700.-
  • Medicines and supplies first year                                            1000.-
  • Medical equipment                                                                       1000.-
  • Exterior repainting /Logo                                                           1000.-
  • Malpractice insurance                                                                   400.-
  • RV insurance 1st year                                                                     400.-                                 
                                                    Total:     10 000.-

story_txt:
What this is all about....

Does turning a
bus into a medical office sound crazy to you? Well, maybe it is... but it's also a great way to bring healthcare to those who need it the most.
My name is Anja Widmann and I´m an American
Board Certified pediatrician. After completing medical school in Germany
and pediatric residency in New York, I moved to Puerto Escondido,
Mexico to open a pediatric practice in 2012. Some would call that crazy, too.
But it has been very rewarding, interesting and challenging.

                                         Now it´s time to expand that care to communities further off the grid.
Along the coast
of Oaxaca, one of the poorest states in Mexico, there is a lack
of access to pediatric healthcare. Many children will spend their entire
childhood  without ever seeing a Pediatrician and families are relying
on very basic health care offered by occasional health brigades and local
nurses. Many
of the rural medical facilities are deficient of basic medical supplies, equipment and
people are required to travel large distances for adequate care.
I want to change that....
The focus of
the project is to offer basic pediatric health care, including well and
sick child care, preventive medicine and education on a variety of health
related topics in various communities along the coast.
So, this is what I will do:

             

I will remodel this bus into a fully functional mobile medical unit and I will visit communities along the Oaxacan Coast 1-2 days per week. There will be an affordable fee for consultations, in order to cover ongoing expenses and to ensure self sustainability of the project.

I NEED YOUR HELP to fund the purchase and transformation of the bus. Please donate and support a project
with a direct impact on local healthcare!!
FYI, I´m not affiliated with any religious, political or non- governmental organizations. 
If you have any questions please contact me at dra.anja@oasisdelpacifico.com!   In case you want to know more details:
 A lot more details....


1. STATEMENT OF
PROBLEM
1.1 Introduction to the problem
The state of Oaxaca is one of the
poorest and most underdeveloped states in Mexico. This area suffers from
shortages of many things; medical and dental care being some of the more
serious needs of these communities.
The cities and large towns have medical
care available especially for those who can pay for it. In small, out of the
way towns, where only a subsistence style of living is available, medical care
is sparse and qualified pediatric care mostly not available. In these
communities with high rates of poverty and disease and with limited access to
health resources, children are extremely vulnerable as parents may not have the
means or sufficient knowledge to provide nutritious meals, pay for clinic
visits, prevent accidents or recognize potentially serious childhood illnesses.
Childhood is a critical time for
physical, mental and emotional development and serious health problems during
this time can adversely affect an individual for the rest of their life. Children
suffering from malnutrition, infectious diseases, violence, injuries, and
chronic diseases (HIV, asthma, etc.) are more likely to have challenges
learning in school and less likely to succeed. Recognizing and treating these
health issues as soon as possible will allow them to recover and increase their
capacity to learn and gain a meaningful education. Preventing and treating
disease in childhood is essential for the development of individuals,
communities and the nation.
Examples of the illnesses that are
common in these communities are malnutrition (in both of its extremes: Obese
and underweight children), anemia, respiratory illness, asthma, intestinal
parasites, chronic diarrhea, Dengue fever and other tropical diseases.
1.2 Statement of need 
There is an apparent need for pediatric
and primary health care in these low-income areas. Limited transportation, lack
of access to health related information, cultural differences and language
barriers are some of the factors leading to suboptimal healthcare coverage in
this area.
These
communities are among those with a high percentage of children living in
poverty and without access to general health care, let alone specialized
pediatric care.
As
a traveling health clinic whose purpose is to effectively provide access to the
high quality healthcare to underserved children from birth to 18 years we would
like to build strong community-based relationships. These partnerships will
allow to gain community trust, leverage resources, improve program
capacity and increase access to healthcare for children in need.
There is a need for “medical home” for
each patient.  A medical home is not a place – it’s a partnership between
a pediatric clinician and the child and family. By establishing an ongoing
relationship, supported by our custom made electronic health record system, the health care provider can follow through to
ensure all a child’s health needs are met. 
That’s an important approach. But,
children who have been medically underserved and are challenged by poverty,
need even more.  They often have multiple medical issues and problems that
have compounded. 
Ironically, these children who often
need the most care are the ones who typically have access to the least. 
We believe that these kids need an “enhanced medical home” that provides
primary pediatric care, including screening, prevention, identification and
management of acute and chronic conditions, as well as health education for the
children and their family.
2. PROJECT
DESCRIPTION
2.1 Mission Statement
The Oasis del Pacífico Mobile Pediatric
Care Unit  will provide affordable, high quality primary pediatric care and
family-centered education to communities along the Oaxacan Coast.
2.2 Statement of purpose
A mobile pediatric
care unit, covering a various communities along the Oaxacan coast will
accomplish the following: 
1) Increase access to
cost effective, high quality pediatric care.
2) Provide the type of
care that supports, educates and reinforces families’ health choices.
3) Provide
family-centered care that promotes strong familiar bonds.
2.3 Geographic
reach & Population served


The mobile
clinic will be based out of Puerto Escondido, a small town on the pacific coast
in the state of Oaxaca, Mexico. Initially will offer services to communities
within eight selected municipios of the districts of Juquila and Pochutla. 

1. 
District of Juquila:
· 
San Gabriel Mixtepec
· 
San Pedro Mixtepec· 
Santos Reyes Nopala· 
Santa Catarina Juquila
2.  District
of Pochutla
· 
San Pedro Pochutla· 
San Baltazar Loxicha· 
Santa Maria Tonameca· 
San Sebastián Coatlán
These
communities lack local access to nearby basic pediatric care and patients and
their families are required to travel large distances to receive such care. 
2.4 Project overview
The Pediatric Mobile Clinic will travel
to communities along the Oaxacan Coast, providing pediatric health care where
it is needed the most. 
Healthcare:

The
Pediatric Mobile Clinic will improve the quality of care and the overall health
of children living in these communities by bringing services directly to the
populations at highest risk, providing comprehensive medical care including:
· 
Well-child exams· 
Sick visits· 
Basic laboratory testing· 
An array of health & developmental screenings

will also start advertising the service in the communities, working closely
with local government agencies, schools and 
2.4.3 The third phase
During this phase we will initiate our
visits to the different communities. All visits will be documented in our
electronic medical record system, which will allow adequate follow up and
facilitate continuous care. The goal is to see between 20-30 patients per day,
which allows an adequate amount of time spent with each patient.

The community will

condition and is being offered at an attractive price. Turning it
into a full functioning medical mobile unit will require remodeling and
adjusting the interior design, including fitting it an A/C unit and clean water supply structures, as well as basic diagnostic
and medical equipment.  The size of the
mobile unit will allow for medical diagnostic support in form of a small lab.
2.7 Staffing and Maintenance
The medical director and pediatrician

Ok, let´s talk money.....Budget Overview

In order to make the project self- sustainable and to not depend on further funding we will cover all operational cost ( fuel, repairs, medical supplies, salaries etc) through the reasonable nominal fees we´ll charge for our services ( between 100-200 Mexican pesos ( = approx. 6-12 US dollars )per patient encounter).

story:
Who are we?
Penuel Bicycles is a California based bicycle shop (4.5 out of 5 Stars on Yelp) located in the heart of North Inglewood.  We strive to offer our customers and community the best bicycles, accessories and service the industry has to offer within a budget that meets our customers needs. 

Recently, we featured in an article on KCET's website concerning the coffee bar prospect and the revitalization of LaBrea in Inglewood.

In our quest for excellence, we have attracted customers from all walks of life as well as Industry Champions, and put on a small, intimate Champions Ride with 7x National Champ Rahsaan Bahati and 4x State Champion Charon Smith.
 


We opened our first retail location in 2010, a modest 260 sq ft with an engaging coffee bar.

Coffee Bar


Local Cyclist stop by and take advantage of the coffee bar


Local Cyclist stop by and take advantage of the free coffee bar


Local Cyclist hanging out before a ride

Since then, we have been blessed to move into a 1500 sq ft retail location on the corner lot, and from there the renovations begun.

Rooms we had to knock down for Coffee Bar Space

Then we started to remodel and make room for the coffee bar


Coffee Bar allocation on retail floor

Proposed Coffee Bar Space



What will the coffee bar serve?
Coffee Shops have been long time meeting/gathering locations for cyclist and commuters alike.  The Penuel Bicycles Coffee Bar will serve coffee, latte and espresso based drinks as well as various teas and smoothies.  You can come to the Penuel Coffee Bar, get a drink, connect to the Wi-Fi and simply hang out before getting back to your day to day events.  Drink will be available for dine-in at the outdoor seating area or to go.  We need additional finances to help secure everything we need in order to have a successful Coffee Bar.
 
Where will money go?
   •  Building Permits
   •  Building supplies
   •  Construction workers
   •  Plumbing work
   •  Espresso Machine
   •  Blenders
   •  Coffee Bar P.O.S.
   •  Air Conditioner
   •  Electrical work
   •  Refrigerator
   •  Coffee/Latte/Espresso cup washer
   •  Water Filtration system

Why do we need your help?
Penuel Bicycles has committed to building a premier Bicycle Shop with unsurpassed service.  Part of this commitment is to provide our customers with a pleasurable full service experience.  We need your help to expand our customer experience to include a refreshing drink at the Penuel Coffee Bar.
 How can you get involved?
   •  Donate on Indiegogo
   •  Tell a friend, family member or associate about the campaign
   •   Stop by and say hello!!

Rewards
Depending on your level of support:
Penuel Bicycles - Bikes & Coffee T-Shirt



Penuel Bicycles- Bikes & Coffee Jersey


Penuel Bicycles- Bikes & Coffee Bibs


Penuel Bicycles- Bikes & Coffee Vest


Penuel Bicycles - Bikes & Coffee Jacket
