story:
HELP SAVE BETHLEHEM

Greetings from Bethlehem United Holy Church of America, Inc.  located in the rural heartland of Durham, NC, for some 92 years! Our church looks as if it were right out of a storybook on the country road where it is located. During worship on Sunday morning or Bible Study on Wednesday night, you will find our sanctuary filled with warm smiles, genuine love and care.

But we are in trouble. We have had a mold problem in our basement, one that has made two of our faithful ill and threatens the health of other members. We have already been graced with help recently when the the Disaster Relief of the NC Baptist Association of Men removed a tree that crashed into our roof and repaired the damage. 

Unfortunately our last disaster  sapped our resources. We know the Lord will provide and we are reaching out to the faith community to help us.

With $20,000 in tax deductible donations, we will be able to continue our mission bringing the gospel to as many people as possible. We will fix the mold problem, that is close to our food bank, create a handicap accessibility for our bathroom allowing some worshippers to be comfortable when they attend church, and also create a space for our Youth Round Table.

Our small congregation of 25 parishioners is made up of working class and poor people who faithfully support their church. But they don't have the deep pockets to bring our upgrades to fruition. Unfortunately, we cannot do it alone. So I am extending an invitation to you to help us. Any donation is helpful.  

Our church is an important asset to our community. It is a North Carolina Food Bank distribution site, is a local distribution for the Marine Toys for Tots project, have adopted a local elementary school providing back to school supplies and we provide the Rev. Martha Hodge Robinson Memorial Scholarship annually to local high school students. The church is relevant to the community. 

Of course we feed the spiritual souls of our church community with noon day prayer and biblical instructions on Wednesdays in addition to our Sunday services. The Christian Education Director, Andrew Petersen, PH.D – leads us weekly with the History of the Early Church. The book club allows everyone to  read books with spiritual themes while discussing how they impact us as a Christian community.  We also hope to return to the glory days of hosting revivals and conventions, which Bethlehem used to do in the early and middle decades of the 20th century.
story_txt: HELP SAVE BETHLEHEMGreetings from Bethlehem United Holy Church of America, Inc.  located in the rural heartland of Durham, NC, for some 92 years! Our church looks as if it were right out of a storybook on the country road where it is located. During worship on Sunday morning or Bible Study on Wednesday night, you will find our sanctuary filled with warm smiles, genuine love and care.But we are in trouble. We have had a mold problem in our basement, one that has made two of our faithful ill and threatens the health of other members. We have already been graced with help recently when the the Disaster Relief of the NC Baptist Association of Men removed a tree that crashed into our roof and repaired the damage. Unfortunately our last disaster  sapped our resources. We know the Lord will provide and we are reaching out to the faith community to help us.With $20,000 in tax deductible donations, we will be able to continue our mission bringing the gospel to as many people as possible. We will fix the mold problem, that is close to our food bank, create a handicap accessibility for our bathroom allowing some worshippers to be comfortable when they attend church, and also create a space for our Youth Round Table.Our small congregation of 25 parishioners is made up of working class and poor people who faithfully support their church. But they don't have the deep pockets to bring our upgrades to fruition. Unfortunately, we cannot do it alone. So I am extending an invitation to you to help us. Any donation is helpful.  Our church is an important asset to our community. It is a North Carolina Food Bank distribution site, is a local distribution for the Marine Toys for Tots project, have adopted a local elementary school providing back to school supplies and we provide the Rev. Martha Hodge Robinson Memorial Scholarship annually to local high school students. The church is relevant to the community. Of course we feed the spiritual souls of our church community with noon day prayer and biblical instructions on Wednesdays in addition to our Sunday services. The Christian Education Director, Andrew Petersen, PH.D – leads us weekly with the History of the Early Church. The book club allows everyone to  read books with spiritual themes while discussing how they impact us as a Christian community.  We also hope to return to the glory days of hosting revivals and conventions, which Bethlehem used to do in the early and middle decades of the 20th century.

story:
Short Summary

 Ciao! I'm Ivano, a 31 years old Italian mate!

After 10 years of working in the hectic film production industry in Milan, I decided that I needed to slow down. 

So, I headed to Australia where I ended up spending 2 years. During this time, I mainly worked and travelled by myself cruising across the country. After my experienced finished in the Downunder, like many other backpackers, my plan wasn't different, and I headed to Asia. 

The differences between the western and asian world are huge, as a tourist, one notice the various colours, smells and tastes immediately. Locals spend most of their time in the streets and life goes on at a different pace too. At the beginning all these differences disoriented me, but then I realised how this lifestyle allows people to share much more, the weather encourages people to be outdoors too, and not long after, I felt in love with the asian culture.   

I travelled around Southeast Asia for a while but when I went to Cambodia I felt my soul in peace....and my second visit to Cambodia resulted in a 10 years leasing!

Cambodians are smiling, simple and big-hearted people who had a recent sad story to tell. I personally, connected with Cambodians straight away as they made me return to feel the human warmth. The biggest problem between us is the communication, and I don't only mean the language, but also the culture, education, life style and life experience differences. 

Day after day, spending time with them, I manage to learn basic Khemer that allowed me to be respected and get closer to the local community. 

Khemer people have a strong attraction to the western lifestyle, leading by consumerism and fashion, and finding a balance between the new and the traditional side of the culture could be challenging.  

Despite the differences, this place enchanted me, its people touched my heart while nature encountered me at every corner. I had discovered a new Ivano and I realised that I had a new mission. 

Nana, is one of those special persons I met over here, and certainly became one of the closest friends now. She's Cambodian, works in a restaurant now and she will be the person who will manage our shop when this project will be finished and the business running. 

Oun Nim,  she's a sweet and clever little girl (photo), being only two years old she conquered my heart. Her parents are a wonderful young couple who helped me to set ground for this project, connecting me with the right people and their family and friends, smiling people that live life in a really easy way without sadness and silly frustrations.


My project aims to create a place that allows me and likeminded people to escape the consumerist world and return to a healthy and simple way of living.

My will is to build an eco-sustainable house to rent and two small shops, made from local and recycled materials from the existing structure in the land (photo) using everithing is possible from the "old house" where "the grandfather" lived for the last 10 years. Now he is over 80 years old and he moved into his dougther's house, in his honor I designed "the villa" trying to remind as much as possible the memory of the "old house". 


Help Nana, a special Khemer friend,  by giving her the opportunity to manage our own business, have a better income and enjoy a better quality of life. 


My Father is involved in this adventure, 65 years old man, when I told him about my project he booked the fly to come here and 5 days later was next to me. I think this is a beautifull way to spend time together plus his knowledge building wise can help me a lot.

Cintia my partner is involved too to support me and give me some advices when I lost the track. She's my smile, my tears and my eyes.

This house will be perfectly located, 500 meters from the best Cambodian beach and in the middle of a small local town surrounded by tropical nature. 

The house will have 3 floors and will respect the look of the local wooden houses, although it will have a concrete foundation to make it a long-lasting structure. The ground floor will be completely open and will become the relax area with river view, where there will be plenty hammocks and hanging chairs to make as chill out as possible. On the first floor, kitchen and toilet will be built. The toilet will be make in concrete to make it confortable and practical to the guests. The second floor will have the bedrooms all in wooden structure recycled from the old house structure existing in the house. 
The house will be surrounded by old trees like palms, banana and mango trees, and new trees and tropical plants will be planted. The house will be wrapped up in green creating a refreshing and relaxing space.

All the project should be done before the December 2015

Your support will be key in the realization of this project in terms of quality and timeframe.

35000$ Total Budget

8000$   Local Building Team 5 workers + additional helpers

16000$  Construction Materials

7000$   Furniture and decoration

1500$     Electricity, water and internet connection set up

500$     Garden and fences

2000$   Set up Nana's shop


I am investing all my savings in this project because I truly believe in it. I didn't question myself much about the risks and problems but went with the flow and followed my soul.

I am sure that it going to be an amazing place where people love the easy life can satisfied themselves having a good time!

Thank you to your interest and support in this Project!

story:
Here's the basics

My name is Sabrina and I'm an artist and college student in North Carolina. I love creating awesome things and I've been running SpiritMilk for almost a year now and while it's been amazing I'm having a hard time saving up the money to get things really moving. With school and life expenses I've had to put advancing the business on hold.

You contribution will help me finally get my own website, tools to create more great pieces and keep the store stocked, as well as time saving manufacturing tools so I can spend more time creating and less time frantically running around.

Getting this funding right now would mean turning SpiritMilk into a full business instead of a hobby. I hope to be able to focus more strongly on branding and local interaction this year and that means I'll need to buy tents and a whole slew of documentation. This is a critical time for my little store, and I can't do it without your help.

What We Need

A handy breakdown of expenses

  • Resin and Molds - $120
  • Sticker Making Supplies - $450
  • Dremel, Drill Press, and Vices - $150
  • First Order of Prints - $150
  • First Order of Acrylic/Wooden Charms - $200
  • Website Fees - $50
  • Legal Fees and Incidentals - $380
This is everything I need to get an initial investment in a business that could be able to sustain me far beyond that.
If I don't make my goal the priorities are the legal documents I need in order to sell my items in person and the website fees which come to just under $200. If I go above that the next thing would probably be the dremel, drill press and vice grips.
There's some extra included to account for fees by indiegogo and bank fees.

Risks & Challenges

Financial hurdles are all that stands in the way of SpiritMilk being a huge success. The business has had plenty of interest, thousands of views every month and over a hundred sales. However this has not been enough to make a solid investment in furthering the business while also keeping my expenses met. Advertising costs money, craft supplies do to and when you want to make art that lasts and satisfies it takes a lot of startup cash and that's what I'm asking for here. It's going to be a lot of work but the bigger I get the more help I can find to get through it. I'm ready for any challenges that might arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Let people know about SpiritMilk, get excited for what it could become!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Jesse Collins I am 34 years old 
  • Every person who helps me reach my goal is helping me fund a dream of calling something my own and help me have something I can pass down to my kids.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am looking to raise at least 15,000 usd. This will help me get a truck, trailer, power washer, and lawn equipment that I would need to start up.
  • What ever funds I am able to raise will go toward what ever equipment I am able to get.  Know that even if I don't reach my goal whatever is raised I am thankful. 
  • The Impact
  • I have lined up a customer base with a complex. 
  • As I cannot get proper funding from a bank this is my last option.  I have never done anything like this before, I am stepping out  on faith alone.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Just passing the word along goes a long way to reach as many people as possible.

story:
Julesy's BnB (Malta), in the Mediterranean

Hi, I'm Julie Culley. My partner Glen Jones and I opened a tourism business in Malta, called Julesy's BnB in January 2015. We're running this Indiegogo campaign to expand our business.

We'd love for you to be part of our adventure, so we're offering fantastic deals on accommodation in Malta, which you will see on the right.

We're Australians from Adelaide, South Australia, in our 40s who've grown tired of the rat race. We bought a historic house of character in Malta (c1750), and we've ditched our careers to give people an outstanding 5-Star stay away from their home in the historic Three Cities region, 10 minutes across the Grand Harbour from Valletta (the Capital city) by ferry. Check us out on TripAdvisor and get one of our Perks, and you'll see exactly what we mean!


Glen's mother (Josie) was born in Malta and immigrated to Australia with her parents and siblings in 1955. Malta was a much different country back then, still under the British Empire and struggling from the aftermath of WWII. Sixty years on, Malta is now 'the' place to be in Europe (and some say the world), with over 1.6M tourists (excluding up to 5 cruise liners everyday) visiting this tiny Mediterranean island every year.



Malta, an archipelago in the central Mediterranean lies between Sicily and the North African coast, is a nation known for historic sites related to a succession of rulers including the Romans, Moors, Knights of St. John, French and British. It has numerous fortresses and megalithic temples dating to 3600 B.C.E. With 300+ sunny days a year.

We adore Malta's rich history, culture and architecture. But more importantly the Maltese people are so welcoming and friendly.
Julesy's BnB offers our guests a whole series of excursions and tours, and ensures our guests get the very best out of Malta during their stay with us. Foodies can also participate and enjoy a gastronomic experience with Julesy's Kitchen too.

Our B&B is best described as a 5-Star luxury boutique hotel, with personalised service. Our mission is to exceed our guests expectations and make them part of our family. The issue is the "boutique" part, whereby we only have 2 guest rooms available and run at around a 95% occupancy rate. In fact, we turn away far more business than we can take.

Our business plan, market research, competitive analysis and operating plan are all in place and in full swing. We just desperately need to expand! The only way to grow the business is to acquire an adjoining house and link the two properties together.

What We Need
We need to buy the adjoining house and refit the property to our standard. There is room to put in an in-ground pool for our guest's enjoyment as well. Our existing property is all complete, albeit Julesy's Kitchen urgently needs to be fitted out with a semi-commercial kitchen, so I can conduct my cooking school. The adjoining property will provide an additional 6 guest rooms, all with ensuite bathrooms. As you can imagine there's a lot of money required to restore and fit-out a house of this magnitude. A lift with complete disabled access to all rooms and ensuites will also be incorporated.

We'd love to launch our expansion with no debt, so we're looking to raise €330,000 (around USD$360,000)
We're confident that we will reach our goal. But, if we don't, all funds from our campaign will still  go to the expansion project. We will then supplement the balance with traditional funding.
What you get by contributing
Contributions will get you updates through various platforms. You can select from a 25% genuine discount off our room rates, up to a completely FREE stay with us at Julesy's BnB, with a whole host of tours and a hire car included. Check out our Perks on offer and select the ideal one for yourself!



The Impact

A contribution to the success of our campaign will have several impacts.

We have secured financing to complete our project, but a successful Indiegogo campaign will mean no borrowing. It will also allow us to showcase our beautiful property to more international guests and give our guests a great memorable experience.

For the village of Cospicua in theThree Cities where Julesy's BnB is located, it will mean economic development because we will be using all local supplies and services including contractors, construction products and labour.

For Malta, it means more exposure. People from all over the world love vacationing here, but even though it's only slightly off the beaten track, it remains largely undiscovered by foreign tourists. However the tourism market in Malta over the last 3 years has grown by over 7-8%, and it seems there is no letting up. 

Challenges

Establishing a business in our new country hasn't been easy, but Glen and I are up to the challenge of having more guests to look after. We are also both about to commence learning the Maltese language, as our local neighbours will appreciate us fitting in more with them.

We've assembled a great team in Malta, including a project manager, legal and business agents, a great architect, a dedicated contractor, several trusted advisers, and marketing experts. We're also getting good support from local officials in the Maltese government.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are ways you can help our campaign besides financially.

You can spread the word in your network, like us on Facebook, or best of all forward a link to our campaign to people you think might be interested. Anything you can do to help us reach a bigger audience, including using the Indiegogo share tools, would be much appreciated.

Please also bookmark our website at www.JulesysBnB.com as hopefully one day you'll book your accommodation with us, when you visit Malta.

story:
Custom Wigmaker. Designer. Hairstylist 

#GENIUSWIGMAKER 
Merria Dearman Inc. is located in Manhattan at 414 East 58th St. where Merria, the 2015 Humanitarian Award winner from www.citygirlbeautyproject.org, has personally changed the lives of hundreds of individuals suffering from hair- loss.  This indiegogo campaign is dedicated to financing the manufacture of Dearman-designed semi-custom pieces.   This new manufacturing initiative will secure stock to be used both at our New York location and outside the city as well to provide Merria’s life-changing wigs to a larger network. 

The Impact

This is my solution. My mission is to provide a service that alleviates just one, but one important side effect of the diseases that cause hair loss. My mission is not only to educate my client, but empower them too. I want to teach them about the wigs and design hairpieces that work for them and their unique lifestyle.  I want to give them options, and most importantly, follow through. 

Every time I give someone their confidence back, its like winning a battle. My campaign will give those who are not able to come directly to Manhattan, the same effect as if they were with me in my salon chair. 

"MERRIA’S EXTREME TALENT AND GENUINE PERSONALITY IS WHAT MAKES HER A ROCK STAR OF THE WIG WORLD"

"Merria Dearman is the most talented wig maker I have ever met! I have been living with alopecia for 8 years. Alopecia is a type of hair loss that occurs when the immune system mistakenly attacks hair follicles. I have been completely bald for 4 years. 

When I met Merria she took her time getting to know me, learning about me and my situation and wanting to know my story.  She asked to see pictures of me with hair so she could have a base to work with.  She handmade the most beautiful wig that made me feel like me again.  She was able to transform me back to the person I once was, were I was the most comfortable."  -Kara Crews


More about Merria. 

Merria Dearman Inc. Huffington Post Article: 

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/merria-dearman/one-hair-at-a-timea-wigma_b_5454328.html 

Merria Dearman on Social Media 

twitter: @MerriaDearman 

instagram: @MerriaDearman 

facebook: /MerriaDearman

story_txt:
Custom Wigmaker. Designer. Hairstylist 

#GENIUSWIGMAKER 
Merria Dearman Inc. is located in Manhattan at 414 East 58th St. where Merria, the 2015 Humanitarian Award winner from www.citygirlbeautyproject.org, has personally changed the lives of hundreds of individuals suffering from hair- loss.  This indiegogo campaign is dedicated to financing the manufacture of Dearman-designed semi-custom pieces.   This new manufacturing initiative will secure stock to be used both at our New York location and outside the city as well to provide Merria’s life-changing wigs to a larger network. 


    The Impact This is my solution. My mission is to provide a service that alleviates just one, but one important side effect of the diseases that cause hair loss. My mission is not only to educate my client, but empower them too. I want to teach them about the wigs and design hairpieces that work for them and their unique lifestyle.  I want to give them options, and most importantly, follow through. 
Every time I give someone their confidence back, its like winning a battle. My campaign will give those who are not able to come directly to Manhattan, the same effect as if they were with me in my salon chair. 



"MERRIA’S EXTREME TALENT AND GENUINE PERSONALITY IS WHAT MAKES HER A ROCK STAR OF THE WIG WORLD"
"Merria Dearman is the most talented wig maker I have ever met! I have been living with alopecia for 8 years. Alopecia is a type of hair loss that occurs when the immune system mistakenly attacks hair follicles. I have been completely bald for 4 years. 
When I met Merria she took her time getting to know me, learning about me and my situation and wanting to know my story.  She asked to see pictures of me with hair so she could have a base to work with.  She handmade the most beautiful wig that made me feel like me again.  She was able to transform me back to the person I once was, were I was the most comfortable."  -Kara Crews



More about Merria. 


Merria Dearman Inc. Huffington Post Article: 
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/merria-dearman/one-hair-at-a-timea-wigma_b_5454328.html 



Merria Dearman on Social Media 
twitter: @MerriaDearman 
instagram: @MerriaDearman 
facebook: /MerriaDearman 



$25 Contribution Wig Tee! 




Other ways to help: 
If you are unable to contribute to the campaign financially, a simple share on social media can help spread our mission

story:
Mobile Pet Monitor

Howdy, I'm Karen and  I believe animals aren't just pets, they're part of the family!  

 I am developing a better in-car solution for my pets when we travel or just run errands around town together- at times it's too hot or cold to leave them in the car.  Also, my big guy, Gunnar sometimes gets nervous when I exit the car (he's the one in the video) and I worry about him so I rush through my stops just to get back to the van. 

We currently have 2 dogs, 1 cat, and 1 horse.  

Here's the solution I'm asking you to help develop with me:  Mobile Pet Monitor

  • Cellular camera inside your vehicle.
  • Allows you to see & talk with your pet(s) when traveling or running errands together and you need to leave the vehicle.
  • Provides a constant virtual presence in your absence.
  • Remote starts your car from anywhere and keeps it running with the app.
  • Ensures safer pet traveling.
  • People we've interviewed who live in Metropolitan areas stated they would use it so simple "watch their car" as it was parked in the city ramp or lot.
  • Secondarily, this device is a theft deterrent since it has the ability to take a photo of anyone who breaks into your vehicle.
  • It has a clean and simple design and an even simpler app to run.  I personally struggle with computers and the whole "Internet of Things/Connectivity" so I'm developing it such that if I can work it, anyone can. (Yup, you guessed it, I'm guiding my computer folks to keep it as simple as it sounds.)
If you're the kind of person who believes as I do, that pets are family and when you go places together you want them to be safe and comfortable while you're apart, then I'm asking you to join me and be a part of the revolution of making this world a better place for the "other" members of our family.


Why $168,000?

Since I'm asking you to be a part of this I believe you have a right to know why $168,500 (plus my Mom always told me, "honesty is the best policy," and I'm not going to disappoint her).  

Here's the breakdown of the finances to get this product running sooner rather than later:

  • Component Selection (guts for the camera & in-car charger): $7,500
  • Custom Basic Enclosure (outer shell & charger): $2,500
  • Firmware Development (making camera, charger and vehicle all talk with each  other via iOS and Android): $108,500
  • Mobile App Development (iOS and Android): $50,000
  • Total: $168,500
  • Estimated cost for a single unit will be $399.
  • Additional monthly cellular charge estimated to be $10-20/unit.


Perks:

  • $10- Founder: part of team Mobile Pet Monitor, sincere thanks, name on Founders Page of website.
  • $25- Founder Plus Pet: Part of team Mobile Pet Monitor, your name on Founders Page of website, PLUS a picture of your pet immortalized on Founders Page.
  • $50- Founder Plus AND Commemorative Wooden Coin

  • $100- Founder Plus AND Commemorative Metal Coin

  • $299- Early Bird Special
  • $569- Two Car Starter Pack


Why Be Part of Mobile Pet Monitor Development?

  • Make a huge difference in the safety and comfort of your pets when together in the car, which in turn allows you to be with them more.
  • Life is always improved for the better when pets are around us.  
  • Pets give unconditional love and this lets you give some of that back.
  • There's nothing better after a hard day than coming home and being greeted  by pets, wagging their tails and so happy to see you- no matter what!
  • Animals provide protection for the family. 
  • I know my pets would lay down their lives to ensure no harm would ever happen to my little boy. As a parent, I can never thank them enough for that peace of mind.


Risks & Challenges

Okay, here is the evolution/hurdles of Mobile Pet Monitor:

  • November 2014- realized what I thought was a weakness (lack of computer skills) was really one of my greatest strengths (I can keep it simple and straight-forward such that if it's simple for me, it is simple for most Americans).
  • January 2015: attended CES in Las Vegas to see if anyone else was developing a similar product.  No one has this idea on their radar right now.
  • January 2015: started a business (OhZ) to develop Mobile Pet Monitor.
  • Finding the right people (wireless/product development, App, and Optics firms) took several months as I did not know the industry nor who was really good at what they did along with good people to work with.
  • Currently have the development team in place and the process has started.
  • Funding is the next hurdle, to date it is being self funded.


Other Ways You Can Help

Being part of the birth of this device is not limited just to financing.

If you believe that this is a great cause for the animals in your lives but right now might not be the right time to financially contribute, "spreading the word" is equally as valuable.

  • Indiegogo- share buttons make it fast and simple to get the message out.
  • www.MobilePetMonitor.com -  visit our website for information. 
  • Facebook- Mobile Pet Monitor site to "like".
  • Pinterest- share it with a pin.
  • LinkedIn- share with the people on your site if you like this.


Timeline:

  • June 2015: Indiegogo launch
  • August 2015: ramp up development and production due to wonderful contributions from folks like you.
  • January 2016: Mobile Pet Monitor shipment

story:
JOIN ME AND SHARE IN A VINTAGE CHEF'S FOOD ADVENTURE

I am dedicated to creating a chef-friendly kitchen surrounded by a modest home. There Oregon's bounty from farm, ranch and pasture can be shared and enjoyed with gusto and food lovers and people who love to cook. A home tucked away in a tranquil green space with a spectacular view of Mt. Hood. and the paradise that is Portland, Oregon.

There comes a time in one’s life as the years roll by when living that life may become a tiresome thing. My most sincere goal is to have my life lived and share with what I love to do. Join me in this Indiegogo campaign and you will in turn allow this to happen. This good fortune life has afforded me will be that much more rewarding when this sharing takes place. The satisfaction I receive cooking for friends and family is the same as most food lovers experience. I have been involved the world of food for more than 40 years. First as an apprentice cook in a San Francisco Bay-Area French restaurant, Le Tonneau and then serving as an executive chef at many food industry places. Finally at my own restaurant Belinda’s in  Portland, Oregon.  And while there i was fortunate to serve many lovers of fine food and wines from around the globe.

Subsequently I was a food industry consultant and a general manager/chef for many different types of food ventures. Now is my time to live in a quiet home, in this case a mobile home in an older established park, surrounded by nature, magnifies the 'quality of life' factor for me that is so important when time continues to march on.

Having a well equipped and outfitted kitchen to cook for people is much like prying open a fresh oyster shell, just plucked from the icy waters of the Northwest, and there one finds 5 or 6 pearls inside.......not just a single pearl. What else could a ‘Vintage Chef’ want? What else you may ask? How about a successful Indiegogo campaign where interested people and food lovers from all over the globe, not just Portland and the United States, have participated, Consequently they may become curious to see where joining and sharing in A VINTAGE CHEF'S ADVENTURE journey will take them.


I will keep everyone involved with social media messages and postings during the duration of this campaign; offering interesting recipes and little-known and unique food tips. It seems that not a day goes by I do not learn another food fact that ends up making cooking more fun or an easier activity and i plan to share within these pages.. Recipes that I have found to be excellent ones in the past, consequently well received, along with ones new to me I want to share many of those too. There will be comments and observations by friends that are chefs, cooks in restaurants and hotels, avid home cooks.......plus some of my food-lover friends that want to contribute and share to make this journey more interesting.

I hope you will consider joining all the folks who would like to see the outcome of my VINTAGE CHEF'S FOOD ADVENTURE. Look to the perks section where you will find 'A Family-Style Feast'. A feature I am really looking forward to implementing.

 The number one thing I am looking forward to doing within my new kitchen is making people happy and wanting to return, much like the experience of going to a new restaurant that has become your new favorite place to dine. This is this man's #1 goal. Why not take a look at these PERKS and join others with the fun?

I offer this quote that say to myself quite often.

I have modified it....... borrowed it, to be proper, from the famous 1930'S Comedian Ed Wynn, Col. Harland Sanders, founder of Kentucky Fried Chicken and Apple founder Steve Jobs.

Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn’t matter to me........Having my head hit the pillow at night knowing I have done something worthwhile for another.

That is what truly matters to me.

Ross Pullen 2015

.......and on that note I add my own favorite quote:

If you must eat crow make sure it has a good sauce.

Ross Pullen 1972

story:
Help bring Artisan Chocolate Festivals to the U.S.

We’re Artisan Chocolate Festivals, a team of creative individuals that have come together to help small artisan chocolatiers around the country  to promote their products, their craft – and public awareness – through participation in a series of chocolate festivals that are open to the public. This has been done in Europe and Asia for decades but has only recently been introduced here in the United States.

A first class venue for artisan chocolatiers.

Many smaller, local chocolatiers – some of them literally "mom & pop" – wish to bring the joy of chocolate to Americans by displaying and offering the chocolate delicacies they create , but simply can’t afford the costs associated with this kind of an undertaking. So to help, we plan on holding a festival in which, with your assistance, we can seriously reduce the usual exhibit fees!

We've got a great team. But we need you on it.

We have already staged a “pilot” show, a small local event that was very well received and embraced by the community. That’s how we know that the same kind of event, larger and on a much more comprehensive scale, will surely be successful.

Our next show is scheduled for April of next year, in Chicago. But to make it happen, we need your help. Your donation to our goal of raising $60,000 to fund the first of these events will go a long way towards making this dream come true.

A portion of proceeds will go to charities.

When we hold these Artisan Chocolate events, we’ll also be working with worthwhile local community charities and charitable projects. So your involvement benefits not only all who love chocolate, but also people in need in the communities where we hold each event.

Please donate today.

America’s chocolatiers need your help to preserve the fine art of artisan chocolate making. Won’t you help by donating today?

story:
For the past three years Vegan Flava Cafe has been a mobile caterer in the Durham, Raleigh, Chapel Hill, Triangle area.   We are now expanding and have found a location in Durham, 4125 Durham Chapel Hill Blvd (old Blue Note Grill location).  We are looking to make this location a triangle favorite by serving your sense of flavor with a satisfying taste of live and cooked food, smoothies, teas made with Kangen water, Kombucha on tap, vegan beer and wine, in-house food preparations/demonstrations and healthy eating classes.  You will also enjoy our poetry nights, movie nights, Sunday brunches, and health & wellness seminars.

 Help us make this vision a success.  Although, we have secured our location, we exceed our initial startup funding and we still need a little help putting some "flava" in the space and getting the things we need to make it a cozy atmosphere for our customers.  Your funds will be used to make small repairs and renovation, establish accounts with local health food distributors, and hire additional staff.    So help us by allowing us to help you by selecting one of our perks.

No contribution is too small $10 goes a long way!  Not to mention, you will enjoy the perks of helping us see this vision.

story:
Draktsho Vocational Training Centre for Special Children and Youth – is a registered Civil Society Organisation and non-profit foundation in BHUTAN, and the only one of its kind in the country - that aspires to enhance the living standards of children and youth with various disabilities. Their approach is to empower their students through vocational training and other necessary life skills to build self-esteem, determination, a sense of purpose and skills that would provide gainful employment and eventual integration in our society.

For more information, please visit their website: www.draktsho-bhutan.org

The center has now grown into 140 students with disabilities, and 20 teachers. Draktsho’s need for funding support has become even more critical and urgent, and directly undermines its objectives. 

This fundraiser is to support Draktsho East - their center in Eastern Bhutan to feed 73 special children with various disabilities for a period of a year, or more.

A Finnish NGO called the Omega Foundation has been generously sponsoring the food programme of Draktsho’s center in eastern Bhutan. The support however comes to an end by the end of this year. From 2016 onwards, Draktsho has to sustain even the food expenses independently, and is struggling to find sponsors. Draktsho spends approximately USD 1400 a month to feed 73 special kids with disabilities and 6 teachers in the eastern center. Therefore we hope to raise USD 16,000 to feed this center for a year starting in 2016.

Please support this cause and donate to make this possible. 

Draktsho will be listing all the names of the donors and benefactors on their website to acknowledge, and thank you for your generous support and contributions.

For this worthy cause and to raise awareness on the need for greater support for disabilities in Bhutan, I will be racing the 268 km the Tour of the Dragon mountain bike race in one day. While the race itself is an excruciating and thrilling experience that last for 12 hours, I would have put 4 months of training – in sun, rain and dust, time away from family and work, race expenses etc - to put my best foot to the pedal. I am kick-starting this campaign by donating USD 268 for every kilometre I will ride on race day!!

www.tourofthedragon.com 

Together, lets enable our special children with various disabilities in Bhutan.

story:
Hello, I am Jc Dale. I am 28 with 2 beautiful little girls and an awesome German Shepard. I have been in the Army National Guard for 8 years now with one deployment to Iraq in 2009. I have found my destiny and that is continuing my service to the people in a unique way using transportation. 

  • This Campaign is important to me because the funds that are raised from it will allow me to purchase a larger vehicle to accommodate the current demand. I have been in business for 4 months now with over 600 likes on the 2 vets and a limo facebook page witch can be found at www.facebook.com/2vetsandalimo or you can view our web site built by yours truly at www.2vetsandalimo.com we have many reviews already on our google plus page and our FB. We all have families that we have to provide for and mine is my life, and this business is my passion. Just as I have served this nation, I enjoy continuing the service by making people happy and feeling safe while with me. 
  •  
  • The magnitude of meeting the goal set forth in this campaign will not only allow 2 vets and a limo to provide transportation for the active heroes organization; taking veterans from the VA hospital to the local Veteran retreat, but allow us to provide the transportation needs that are here in Louisville Kentucky and all over the United States. I foresee this company growing and there are long term goals in place and ideas that noone else is doing. If you are still reading this than I will explain a little further. If you are a Veteran or a family member of one or most likely you know a Veteran, than you know that Yellow cab company is at every post in the United states. They currently are monopolizing the transportation business on posts. Any prior soldier or current one will tell you that when they went to another state to do training at a Military school house they have normally flown to these posts and do not have transportation. When a veteran makes the decision to go out on the town in the City they are visiting they want to go in style and they want to go in a vehicle with a driver they feel safe with. Now in no way am i representing all soldiers opinions or saying that yellow cab is not safe as I have rode with them many times and soldiers ride with them every day. I am simply saying that there is room for another transportation service. I want to put luxury sedans and 15 passenger vans wrapped in different branch of services camouflage vinyl. Put a local unemployed Army National Guard soldiers in a suit and put him in as the driver. Soldiers are always looking for ways to travel with all the new battle buddies they made at their new Military school and what better way to accommodate to them by offering such a nice ride and at an affordable rate. 

What We Need & What You Get


  • We need 25K to fund our current operations. 15k will go to a 10 passenger Limousine and 10K will go towards a 15 passenger van. We have been finding local vehicles for sale and we are hoping to make a purchase to meet the current demand. As discussed above and in the video, We already have came to an agreement with Active Heroes and in the next few months be providing the Veterans Transportation from the VA hospital to the Veteran Retreat so we need to be able to accommodate to that as there are many of them needing the ride.
  • Our current 13 passenger bus we have been working on longer than a month will have an amazing water fall inside along with an LED infinity Mirror. If you contribute to this cause you can expect a shout out on our FB page and a free airport pick up anytime you come to Louisville Kentucky. 
  • If we do not meet our goal than what funds are contributed they will be applied to insurance for the current vehicles, maintenance, and completing the bus we have been working day in and day out to get done.

The Impact

This project is so valuable to our Nation because soldiers need transportation to places they want to go and have fun when they do get some free time. Also people want to feel good when they go out i.e newly wed couple, maybe a date night with someone special, an anniversary, being picked up or brought to the airport, and many more. 

  • As of now we have already locked in a contract with Active heroes and Have had over 25 customers/runs in the Limousine since we started business 4 months ago. we have many excellent reviews, and at lease 3 times a week someone inquires about needing transportation for 10 or more people.
  • This is not your average idea or business. There is not another one like this. Veteran owned and operated by trusted Soldiers in your community. We have served our nation over seas and now we want to continue that service in our community. When it comes to professionalism we knock any transportation company out of the park. 

Risks & Challenges

There has been risks involved and challenges as most of everything in life does.
  • One of the first risks was me pawning my motorcycle I had purchased with the money I made while over seas just so I could buy the first limo. I was able to get it back from pawn through hard work and dedication to this business, by promoting our web site and Facebook page, standing on corners handing out flyers, even sitting out side bars waiting to see if someone needed a ride home just to make extra money to get my bike and keep the insurance on the vehicle.
  • We will do whatever it takes to make this work, and with the support of the community and our hard work we can do anything we put our mind to.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • please like and share our FB page and web site and make noise about our campaign.
  • you can use the Indiegogo share tools to easily share with all your friends and family.
story_txt:
Hello, I am Jc Dale. I am 28 with 2 beautiful little girls and an awesome German Shepard. I have been in the Army National Guard for 8 years now with one deployment to Iraq in 2009. I have found my destiny and that is continuing my service to the people in a unique way using transportation. 

 This Campaign is important to me because the funds that are raised from it will allow me to purchase a larger vehicle to accommodate the current demand. I have been in business for 4 months now with over 600 likes on the 2 vets and a limo facebook page witch can be found at www.facebook.com/2vetsandalimo or you can view our web site built by yours truly at www.2vetsandalimo.com we have many reviews already on our google plus page and our FB. We all have families that we have to provide for and mine is my life, and this business is my passion. Just as I have served this nation, I enjoy continuing the service by making people happy and feeling safe while with me.

There has been risks involved and challenges as most of everything in life does.  One of the first risks was me pawning my motorcycle I had purchased with the money I made while over seas just so I could buy the first limo. I was able to get it back from pawn through hard work and dedication to this business, by promoting our web site and Facebook page, standing on corners handing out flyers, even sitting out side bars waiting to see if someone needed a ride home just to make extra money to get my bike and keep the insurance on the vehicle.
We will do whatever it takes to make this work, and with the support of the community and our hard work we can do anything we put our mind to. story:
This July we celebrate our four year anniversary and everyday we’re still astonished by what we’ve been able to accomplish and the social change we’ve made.

We’ve been privileged to work with GRAMMY winning celebrities, athletes and actors all in the name of giving back. From our first national cause campaign with KEM, a toiletry drive for the homeless, which helped thousands to our Beauty for the Bold initiative which traveled to NY, Atlanta and more delivering make-overs and hair supplies to women and children in domestic violence shelters, to our current campaign “The Giving Boutique” now in our second year, this clothing drive and five city tour allows homeless children the chance to shop for back to school clothes- minus the price tag of course. Our Give Me 5 reading program has provided more than 30,000 books to kids, we’ve built classroom libraries and put books directly in the hands of kids, based on their unique interests. To have collected and distributed over half a million items in less than four years, is no doubt a blessing from God. We never take for granted that without the support of our loyal readers and followers we wouldn’t be where we are today. With our warmest regards we thank each and every one of you, our friends of BCG across the country and last but certainly not least, we thank God for the vision and ordering our steps, which have lead us to be a vessel of good works in the community! 

To celebrate our four years in business; we have set a goal to raise $4,000 via a Crowdfunding Campaign to support Three of BCG’s Signature Campaigns in just 30 days. Funds used will support: The Giving Boutique - funds will be used to purchase new underwear and clothing for homeless youth in five cities Atlanta, Tampa, Dallas, Oakland and Detroit. Give Me 5 - This fall our goal is to makeover three libraries in Title 1 schools and provide 10,000 books, funds will help make this happen. Sunday Soul - In October we will celebrate two year of our homeless feeding initiative #SundaySoulATL - Soul Food and Old School Soul Music for the Homeless, our goal is to expand Sunday Soul into other cities before the end of 2015. 

We’re asking all of our supporters to pitch in by donating a minimum of $4 for our causes, help us show the world that indeed Giving Is Good!

story:
Who We Are 

We are two midwives, Djina Ariel and Carlee Ann Brown, working toward improving the quality of maternity care for women and families. Our goal is to open Yolo County’s first freestanding birth center. We need YOUR help in bringing this important project to fruition. 

The Impact 

Women and their families in Yolo and most surrounding Counties currently have no options to give birth in a freestanding birth center. Midwife-led care at birth centers is one path to improving maternal and neonatal outcomes. A community birth center in Yolo County will profoundly expand much desired options for women and their families. Midwife-led freestanding birth centers are safe, cost-effective, and well-accepted alternatives to hospital delivery for physiologic management of birth in low-risk healthy women. 

Freestanding birth centers have become an integral part to mainstream maternity care. Professional maternity care organizations such as the American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology (ACOG) and Society for Maternal Fetal Medicine (SMFM) support birth centers as a safe option for low risk women. Furthermore, the American College of Nurse-Midwives (ACNM) the National Association of Certified Professional Midwives (NACPM), and the Midwives Alliance of North America (MANA) all support birth centers as a safe option for healthy women choosing natural childbirth. 

Our Mission 

Midwives of Yolo County Birth and Women's Health will be a licensed and accredited freestanding facility. Our midwives are dedicated to safe, evidence based, and individualized care that supports shared decision-making. Our services will include family planning, gynecological services, preconception counseling, comprehensive prenatal, labor/birth, postpartum care, and lactation support.

Our goal is to provide accessible, empowering, client centered care, while ensuring the health and safety of mothers and babies. Our midwives are committed to respectfully serving a diverse community. The midwives will work with established hospitals and providers for consulting, collaboration, and transfers of care if the pregnancy is no longer appropriate for midwifery care in a birth center setting.

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign seeks to raise the $10,000 needed to get this project off the ground. Your contributions will help to fund: 

  • Ultrasounds, birth tubs, beautiful and comfortable beds, birth stools, and squat bars for the birth center.
  • Execution of our redesign for our space, making it luxurious and calm, while also meeting state and national medical standards for birth center facilities.

Challenges

Our greatest challenge thus far has been finding a site in Yolo County to transform into a community birth center. By having these funds available, the minute we find that special place, we'll be able to sign a lease and start to create the space and facility needed to house the new birth center. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are seeking community involvement.  Whether you'd like to help with outreach, fundraising, marketing or join a painting party, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@midwivesofyolocounty.com

story:
1 in every 5 of us lives with at least one disability.

We're raising money to launch the Compassionate Vendor Program!

What is the Compassionate Vendor Program?

C.V.P. is the FIRST of its kind world wide. A real game changer for people that live with unseen disabilities...and you can be on the ground floor of this exciting global movement. 

The Compassionate Vendor Program certifies all businesses (from restaurants, to coffee shops, from retail stores and hotel chains just to name a few) in every industry that bring our training module to each employee that interfaces with the general public, their customers and their families, in their establishments.

Bringing education, complete with practical tips and techniques easy to use when interacting with customers, on how to best serve those with unseen disabilities to customer service representatives will create a more inclusive, compassionate, and welcoming community for every one.

For more information on C.V.P.'s creator/CEO and the program itself, please visit www.CVPGlobal.com

Unseen disabilities focused on in each training include but are not limited to:

·  Autism Spectrum Disorder

·  P.T.S.D.

·  Alzheimer’s/Dementia

·  Other mental and sensory disabilities (all mainly “invisible”)

With certification of each establishment comes:​

·  A C.V.P. window decal to display on your front door, proudly announcing to customers your investment in inclusive service to the community

·  Each employee that attends a training will receive a C.V.P. lapel pin to wear while at work

·  C.V.P. Table tents/table signage

·  Each business is listed for three years (the length of the active certification) on the CPGlobal.com online directory (no additional cost). 


What We Need & What You Get

We need MONEY! in order for C.V.P. to launch successfully.

The Compassionate Vendor Program is in jeopardy of stalling completely. There is not enough cash flow at this time to support the full time position required to fully launch C.V.P. into the world.

A breakdown of our current needs:

40% staffing costs

50% to cover 7 months of overhead

10% for the National ADA (Amer. with Disabilities Act) Symposium in Denver, CO.


Our monthly overhead includes:

·  Office space

·  Insurance

·  Web services

·  Accounting

·  Marketing consultant

·  Utilities

·  Transportation for pitches

·  Marketing material

·  Printing costs

·  Shipping/ Postage costs

Why include the Natl. ADA Symposium?

As a vendor at the symposium C.V.P. will gain fantastic exposure by government agencies from across the country. These agencies employ customer service representatives for a number of their services (from public utility departments to parking enforcement and almost every other public department in between).

Booth rental alone is $800, not to mention all of our marketing material, signage, and travel costs.

 ** If we are lucky enough to earn more than our request of $36,000.00, anything beyond will go toward creating more of our infrastructure. Creating job/s, employing more marketing tactics, working toward national media recognition, etc.

The Compassionate Vendor Program launch and growth is a marathon not a sprint.

Featured Perk (of 3):

If you donate $35.00 or more you will receive an “I Support” lapel pin. These pins are exclusive to our Indiegogo campaign and can only be obtained through your contribution here. It’s like a Secret Society Decoder Pin of your very own (reference to A Christmas Story, intended).

Your lapel pin declares to the world:

I believe that all abilities are beautiful.

I support love regardless of abilities.

I support a more inclusive community for ALL.

I support seeing the value in each and every member of our society.

I support disability education for customer service representatives of every industry.

I support a new, radical, expectation of customer service.

I support progress.

I support compassion and kindness for that is how we are going to change the world, together.

I support shifting the cultural shame and stigmas surrounding people with disabilities wherever possible, through global education.


Risks & Challenges

If we cannot generate capital the Compassionate Vendor Program will be all but dead in the water. We cannot continue working on this as we have without some revenue. We are a small team of a CEO and a few interns that are committed to this global movement, but if we don’t have the money to sustain our needs and begin to create the infrastructure to support this platform, C.V.P. will never get off of its feet.

Once we can sustain ourselves (for at least a few months at a time) we continue to do what we have been doing, reaching out to agencies, school districts, and corporations (through their ever present gate-keepers) to introduce this program, physically pounding the pavement to local businesses with brochures in hand, and attending Meet The Buyer government events (can we say C.V.P. certification for all DMV offices?) that always require travel to get to them, and network network network, beginning locally so as to keep costs as low as possible; just to name a few ways.

We are not afraid of the hard work, we are afraid that we will have to abandon the mission before it can really begin. And that, would break our hearts.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some are simply unable to contribute to our campaign monetarily, but that doesn’t mean that you are not valuable to our vision and mission. Our love for you is not conditional.

Please make noise about our campaign via your networks, your Socials, your personal relationships, on your blogs, using the Indiegogo share tools, or simply screaming it from the mountaintop. We often say around here, how can we change the world if the world doesn’t know we exist?

The Compassionate Vendor Program is a radical new idea; it’s never been done before, which is exhilarating and terrifying all at the same time. How do we get C.V.P. to catch fire? YOU can help us fan the flames. YOU can be on the ground floor of a global movement.

Together, we here at Team C.V.P. wholly believe that we can change the world to a more inclusive and compassionate global community for all of us.

This truly is a Movement to Change the World.

story:
Life Shell is a project that aims to build a prototype and test the next generation of emergency and rescue crafts.

A bullet proof inflatable craft that allows to survive and withstand any kind of emergencies.

- CLASS IV BULLETPROOF  

LiquidArmor - Class IV Military Graded .30 Caliber M2AP Armor Piercing

- IMPACT / SHOCK ABSORBENT 

Up to 1Kg of Dynamite, 65 Tons of falling debris

-  HEAT RESISTANT / FIRE PROTECTIVE

SEAgel up to 1300*C. blowtorch

- THERMAL INSULATED / INFLATABLE SNOW SHELTER  

Protect from freezing and hypothermia in extreme weather conditions.

- FLOATING  RESCUE POD 

Floats as a rescue raft. Hermetically sealed from inside

- COM / EMERGENCY BROADCAST / GPS

Emergency signal is broadcast to rescuer after door it is sealed. Onboard GPS to track location. 

- HIGH ALTITUDE DROPS / GLIDING CAPABILITIES

Highs Speed Release Parachute , External Airbags , Aerostat Balloon.

- INFLATABLE EASY TO STORE 

A BRIEF INTRODUCTION

The world's cities are sprouting with plans for new towers and skyscrapers, a sign of twin booms in creativity and wealth. But many people still have concerns for safety & survival  in case of emergency.
 

GENERAL APPLICATION 

IN CASE OF PUBLIC SHOOTING, LIFE SHELL BULLET PROOF KEVLAR TECHNOLOGY OFFERS SHELTER AND RELIABLE PROTECTION.

Think about all of the public places you go in and out of each day - churches, schools, stadiums, theaters or libraries. They're all places that attract a large volume of people but also go relatively unprotected.

Life Shell capsules can be installed in this vulnerable places to offer protection until law enforcement authorities arrives to the rescue.

This technology implementation could also act as a deterrent for criminal individuals wanting to do harm in a peaceful community.

Motivated by the latest news of shocking earthquake and natural disasters around the world we thought of a device that can potentially save thousands of lives and avoid casualties.


MILITARY APPLICATION

Life shell can offer protection to soldiers if overwhelmed or isolated during military operation. It can be deployed and offer bullet proof protection, while under enemy fire, to soldier/s waiting for reinforcements  or extraction.


HUMANITARIAN APPLICATION

Life Shell can offer bullet proof protection to rescuers and refugees during humanitarian operation in war territories in case of ambushes from aggressors. It can guarantee protection while broadcast emergency rescue calls to authorities and initiate military rescue intervention.


NATURAL DISASTERS PROTECTION APPLICATION

This project aims ultimately to build a prototype and test the next generation of emergency and rescue crafts. This technology offers emergency aerial to ground protection for people in a crisis situation, similar by comparison to  what life rafts provide for people in shipwrecks at sea.


http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/07/20/the-really-big-one

LET'S GET PREPARED. A natural disaster of titanic proportions is overdue to strike the U.S., physicist Michio Kaku warns.

http://www.cbsnews.com/news/titanic-earthquake-tsunami-overdue-wipe-portions-pacific-northwest/

Thailand Tsunami 2004

JAPAN EARTHQUAKE & TSUNAMI 2011


EXTENDED TECHNOLOGY APPLICATION FOR AVIATION SAFETY

Life shell technology could potentially be used for emergency escape or embedded into modern airplane architecture to provide extra level of protection to passengers in case of emergency and crash landing . Lining the fuselage with Kevlar and non newtonian fluid mixture would help the structure stay intact and not brake off in peaces while offering protection to passengers from fire related injuries. Airbags and crash sensor could help passengers also avoid injuries during crash landing.


EXTENDED TECHNOLOGY APPLICATION FOR SHIP'S SAFETY

It is very common for a ship to lean on one side before sinking making it impossible to lower life boats and life rafts  during abandon ship emergencies. Life shell technology could potentially solve this issue and guarantee emergency escape in any circumstances.

WHAT IS LIFE SHELL?

The life shell is a inflatable  craft that can easily be deployed  from any structure including skyscrapers or airplanes for emergency escape and rescue in case of accidents, natural disasters, destructive fires, tsunamis and even in the case of terrorist attacks. Life Shell can protect people in case of building collapse thanks to its impact resistance and heat protective properties.

HOW DOES IT WORKS ? 

CLASS IV BULLETPROOF (LiquidArmor )

 A special LiquidArmor ( Non-Newtonian Treated Kevlar ) helps absorb the impact and reduce or stop penetration to the body from firearm-fired projectiles and shrapnel from explosions.

IMPACT/SHOCK ABSORBENT ( Kevlar, Zylon lining, Airbags, QR Parachute)

This invention utilize a combination of non-newtonian fluids technology along with Kevlar airbags that allows the life shell to be shock resistant for high altitude drops and high pressures due to high force impacts . Additionally a quick release parachute is utilized in case of high altitude drops to slow down accidental fast acceleration and ultimately guarantee a safe descent .


A dilatant Non- Newtonian fluid provides protection, as well as material flexibility.

The inner lining of the life shell is composed of freely moving molecules however, upon impact the molecules bind together turning the soft putty into a solid block barrier.

HEAT RESISTANT / FIRE PROTECTIVE ( Zylon , SEAgel )

SEAgel (Safe Emulsion Agar gel) is one of a class of high-tech foam materials known as aerogels. It is an excellent thermal insulator . This material is used to line the inner and outer layers of the Life Shell craft to enable it to withstand fire and be heat resistant. Also the Zylon material used on outer layers and airbags act as additional level of thermal insulation and protection from fire.

THERMAL INSULATED / INFLATABLE SNOW SHELTER ( Zylon Buffer Layers ) 


FLOATING LIFE RESCUE SHELL ( Safe Emulsion Nitrogen Agar Gel )

SEAgel (Safe Emulsion Agar gel) can be made lighter than air using hydrogen - causing it to float or hang in the air. It insulates against temperature, noise, and electric current. SEAgel is also completely biodegradable, as it is made entirely of biological material and can even be eaten.

 

INFLATABLE, EASY TO STORE & EASY TO DEPLOY ( Inflatable )

Life Shell prototype will consist of a single seater inflatable sphere shaped pod.  Having said that, there are no limitations for this technology  in future application and development. 

The inflatable property of Life Shell Pod makes it extremely compact, easy to store and deploy in case of emergency.


           



THE MAKING OF LIFE SHELL PROTOTYPE, BASIC REQUIREMENTS, SKETCHES

Inner Seats


Inner Airbags

Inner Shell


Inner Shell - Sealed Door


Lift Gas Unit & Deployed Outer Airbags 

Quick Release Parachute 

The Inner Shell

The inner shell has a main entrance, a sealing door, an air tight surviving area, after impact floating airbags, air emergency supplies, safety seats and belts, frontal impact protective  cushions, fire extinguisher, gps locator, on board computer, communication systems and water and surviving supplies . 

The outer layer of the inner shell is made of Kevlar lined with polyethylene and special dust (non-newtonian fluid mixture) to make it impact and puncture resistant. The non Newtonian fluid properties protect the inner area also from heat and deformation from impact.

The life shell is also designed to float and keep the inhabitants safe in case of ocean surges and tsunamis.

The Outer Shell

It contains the inner shell and has an anchor point to grip to mount and releases mechanisms. It holds gas tanks for external airbags, the external airbags, mounting springs to inner shell. On this shell we have cameras feeding wirelessly to the inner shell.

HELP US HELP BUILD A SAFER WORLD

After 5 years spent in collecting technical data and executing research studies in collaboration with SACEMP Engineering Ltd we are closer than ever to make the life shell project a reality. We are raising money to build a prototype and test it so that we can possibly consider a market pilot in 2018. 

WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR ?

I'm asking for $50’000 to build a prototype of a new emergency rescue craft concept. 

THE MAKING OF THE LIFESHELL POD 
The money raised will go  into the manufacturing of prototype including material, mold and casting creation. 

ON BOARD ELECTRONICS BY INTEL EDISON

A small portion will go into hardware and software development for airbags and shoots release synchronization. A particular thanks to Intel Edison platform that enable us to lower our over all development costs . http://tinyurl.com/lgqbb8t

WILL IT WORK? HOW CAN THIS DEFY THE LAW OF PHYSICS?

Yes, it is possible for it to work and no, it does not defy the laws of physics. Most of the work is done by the on-board high speed computing synchronization system and sensors. 

One of the essential elements for this technology to work is the exact timing and sequence in which each element is deployed during release and landing. Very similar by comparison on how ABS, Airbag and automated safety systems work on cars. Just bit more complexed. Also to adopt lift gasses and high efficiency and quick release best-of-class parachutes have a huge impact on the overall functionality of the system. 

The latest development in terms of materials also plays a key role. The utilization of dilatant Non-Newtonian fluids in conjunction with Kevlar, Zylon and CNF materials have resulted in optimized distribution of force along the entire structure and allow best shock absorption during landing and ultimatelly avoid hot-spots upon impact.

 The introduction of SEAgel Hydrogen based foam has been also extremely important for optimal thermal insulation and make Life Shell fire resistant. Being SEAgel lighter than air also allows for overall weight to be reduced and improve floating and gliding capabilities.

PROJECT HISTORY / TIMELINE

story:
The EcoME Center is located in the West Bank, next to Jericho, 

accessible to all people without the necessity for permits, is run by 

Palestinians, Israelis and Internationals on a volunteer basis, and 

over the course of its history has hosted thousands of people from 

all ages, religions and social backgrounds for gatherings, meetings, 

workshops and multi-cultural events.

In these times, as the climate of fear and separation is escalating in 

our region, a place of sanity offering a different and healed vision for 

the land and people of the Middle East and the world is urgent.

For the past 5 years, EcoME has served as that place. 

 EcoME invites people to come and share, rest, connect, heal, be real and consciously choose to live in respect and co-existence with each other and the 

earth. 

We, the EcoMe team, and its wider community from Israel, Palestine and all over the world, invite open dialogue in which all religious and spiritual 

perspectives are heard and honored, uniting us around our common 

heritage as humans brought forth by a loving Creator for life, hope, 

love and community.

And now, after 5 successful seasons, we need your help to take this inspiring project to the next level!

Our core group of 10 dynamic and dedicated Israeli and 

Palestinian change-leaders, who have been supporting and 

volunteering in EcoME over the past years, have opened EcoME on JAN 2015 and have been working hard with hundreds of volunteers to widen EcoMe's outreach communities and the double the workshops and meetings that take place in the center. 

This year for the first time, our schedule was fully booked with programs that will continue to create and nourish a strong Alliance of local leadership for change:

• A 14 days Non-violent communication forum as well as two intensive weekends

• Weekends for women, men and youth empowerment 

• Arabic and Hebrew and English intensive courses as well as weekly classes

• International educational leadership programs for youth

• Artist residency program and art workshops

• Multicultural art & music events and Open mic nights

• Yoga Classes

• Meditation and healing courses

• Documentary ans storytelling workshop

• social clowning workshop

•An international youth exchange program

•Bio- dynamic Beekeeping workshop 

and many more..

This is where your help is so valuable : 

First mission: 

Over the summer time, because of the difficult weather conditions in the desert, we are not able to run programs At EcoME, in order to be able to save the location for next year, and NOT to take all the center apart, we decided to pay rent for the summer and pay our neighbor to live in the center through the summer break. 

In order to do so we will need 12,000 $.

Second mission :

Our structure already includes 

6 meeting spaces, compost toilets, a kitchen, showers, an artist's 

studio, sleeping quarters for EcoME guests, an organic garden and much more all of them has been redecorated and fixed in the past 7 months. 

with the other 8,000$ we are trying to raise, we are aiming to:

Build small rooms for teachers that are giving workshops and courses at EcoMe

Build a smart grey water system,  make all our workshop spaces waterproof as well as the kitchen

To be able to give more scholarships for people in need (students, volunteers)

To start the EcoMe outreach program- reaching communities that can not come to EcoMe due to the current situation in the West bank 

To allow our team members to sustain themselves independently. 

Many people have already stepped in and helped with hands on work, donations and support. If you wish to be part of this creation, you can order one of the perks we have made, you can pass on this campaign and tell about it to others, and you can even come and work with us.

Your investment will help to transform lives and our society!

We are so grateful for this opportunity to live and allow a space for peace in our region.

Thank you!

The EcoME team 2016
