for funding for startup financing that will be needed to get our nightclub
started, coordinating with the Santa Clarita zoning board with finding a
location for our nightclub, funds for leasing or renting our nightclub
location, obtaining a food and liquor license, hiring managers and employees,
marketing and advertising and other expenses associated with opening up a
nightclub and restaurant. With the help of a business consultant with over 40 years’
experience in startups and business management, we have already completed our
entire our business plan, including a 3 year income projection, and the schedule to implement it. If we don't reach our goal we will implement the steps one at a time as we continue to fund raise.

Here are the great perks we are offering:
$10 – 1 Free admittance
$50 – i5 T-Shirt plus 1 free admittance
$100 – Free admittance for you and 3 friends plus 4 i5 T-Shirts
$500 – 1 Year VIP Membership that includes no cover charge and no waiting in line for a full year! 
$1000 – 1 Year VIP Membership for 2 people that includes no cover charge and no waiting in line for a full year plus 2 i5 T-Shirts and a $100 gift certificate for food and beverage! 
$10,000 – 3 Year VIP Membership and YOUR OWN PRIVATE PARTY FOR UP TO 50 GUESTS! On a Sunday, Monday or Tuesday night (alcohol not included) Contact us for details at info@i5nightclub.com.
   The Impact 
In Santa Clarita, we have two local colleges with over
24,000 students in our area with no place to have fun. If we are able to raise
enough funds to open up a new nightclub in our area, then young people in Santa
Clarita would not have to travel very far to find something to do. This would
also help promote safe and vibrant activity in support of Santa Clarita's
social experience in the community as well by keeping the entertainment dollars
local. This club will have all the high tech features of a fancy LA Downtown
clubs with high quality audio systems and lights including lasers. 
Whether there’s an EDM DJ performing or we’re having a retro
night of disco, we will be prepared to dress the part and give people the same
sort of high-quality experience they would expect if they were driving into the
city.
  In addition
to benefiting the youth, our club (tentatively called i5) will benefit the
community of Santa Clarita by keeping revenue and tax dollars in the area.
There is no good reason for us to send off our own citizens every weekend,
their pockets filled, to Los Angeles. They could get the same experience here
at home, and our schools and public services could use the money they spend to
continue to make the town bigger and better. This is a win for everyone, but
mainly, we don’t want to lose our family and friends!


     With your
support, your positive contributions that you can offer to our businesses will
help the nightlife in Santa Clarita area and provide a
fun and exciting place for students and young people alike to go to instead of
having to travel to Los Angeles. Please
help us keep our friends at home!
   Risks & Challenges        While starting a nightclub sounds like fun, it is also hard work. There are, generally, several challenges to opening a dance club.  Between personnel, supplies and location costs; it is expensive to open a nightclub.  The most challenging have to do with dealing with the city. Knowing that, we have already found and spoken to all of the applicable departments of Santa Clarita and lined up what permits we need and what the city requires as to how we operate the business. We have already contacted the suppliers and distributors of our necessary supplies and equipment as well as the location we want. Our comprehensive business plan addresses all of the supply costs and operating expenses we will be facing and how to manage them profitably.     We know exactly how we want our business to be run and what kind of clientele we are trying to appeal to, but we need your help to get started and make our vision a reality. 
      With your support and generous contributions, we can help bring the nightclub scene to Santa Clarita and improve the quality entertainment that is offered in our area for our young people. Help spread the word to support creative and financial vitality in Santa Clarita's social experience for visitors and residents.
Thank you in advance for your help!

Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can’t make a contribution at this time, we completely
understand but there are still ways you can help us with our Santa Clarita
nightclub and restaurant. Please take a few moments and share our story and
this crowdfunding campaign with your friends and family via social media,
email, and through word of mouth or Indigogo's share tools!

story: The local council closed and demolished our local swimming baths in Crook County Durham England UK leaving everyone in the local community without. My aim is to build a swimming pool on private land to give my children and all my friends children the opportunity to learn to swim that one one day could save their life. Building plans and consent have now been agreed by the local council. We just need your help to fund this project and make a difference to the lives of our children within our local community. A BIG thank you for your every bit of support in donation. Every penny counts. THANK YOU

story:
We’re Gluten Free Baking and Living, and our motto is: - Gluten free food should be good enough that everyone wants to eat it. No one should have to make do with bad bakes, and free from shouldn't be free from taste or quality ingredients! We've developed a range of amazing gluten free flour blends to transform your gluten free baking, and once you try them, you'll never want to go back to the supermarket stuff!
What's so special about our flour?

Our gluten free flour blends are a perfect gluten free substitute for wheat flour, with no nasty additives! Our flour really is different – it gives great results to gluten free baking, without GMOs, chemical additives, or weird stabilisers, and it works exactly like wheat flour – first time, every time.

Our flour blends have been tried and tested on our baking courses, and give amazing results to your free from cooking. We know that baking gluten free can be tricky - recipes call for all sorts of different flours that can be difficult to source, and getting the proportions just right at home is time consuming. 

The prepackaged gluten free flour blends that are currently available can produce bakes with a bitter flavour and cloying aftertaste, and just don't work like traditional flour. Our blends work just like regular wheat flour in recipes, and as a bonus, they're more nutritious too! 

With our blends, you can make great gluten free baguettes, delicious bread, delectable pastry, irresistible scones and cakes, through to luxurious béchamel sauce, crepes suzette, choux and puff pastry and all things in between - with just the one bag of flour!

We want to make it easier for everyone to bake gluten free at home, and with our flour, you can bake ANYTHING and EVERYTHING and get incredible results. Once you've tried our flour, you won't go back, that's our promise.


Why are we raising funds on Indiegogo?


We've created our very own plain flour blend, and we know it's the best gluten free flour out there. But we need your help to raise funds to produce two more - an incredible brown bread blend, and a premium Italian flour blend, a first for the gluten free market.

We need your help to add to our range, so that everyone can make free from food that's not just 'good enough' at home - with our flours, it can be great! 


What makes our flour so good?

* It’s more nutritious than the gluten free flours currently on the market, and has better quality ingredients

* It’s a much better substitute for wheat flour in traditional recipes

* It contains tapioca flour, rice flour, potato flour, whole corn flour and sorghum flour – perfectly balanced to give incredible bakes

* Tapioca flour has wonderful binding qualities for gluten-free baking

* Potato flour makes bakes light and moist, and is “sticky” like traditional wheat flour

* Whole corn flour is rich in vitamins and nutrients, including beta-carotene, vitamins A, E, B6, thiamine (B1), riboflavin (B2), niacin (B3), pantothenic acid (B5), folate (B9) and choline (B12)

*Sorghum flour is nutrient rich, and contains more protein, fibre and minerals like phosphorus, potassium, calcium and iron and antioxidants than other gluten free flour substitutes

* The blends are allergen free, so they’re perfect for bakers with other dietary restrictions

* No nasty additives, stabilisers, or GMOs - just the good stuff

Our Story

Our flour blends were born out of desperation for something decent to eat when Ian was diagnosed with coeliac disease in 2012. The sugary, additive laden offerings in the supermarket free-from aisles left us feeling disappointed, and we knew we could do better ourselves.

When we started baking our own gluten free breads, cakes and puddings, we hit on something great – but the flours that were available left us wanting more too. They were too bitter, lacking in nutrition, and just didn’t produce the same results as their gluten filled cousins. So we made our own!

Our Process

We started incorporating higher protein whole grain flours into our recipes, like teff, sorghum and Italian maize flour. The results were so good, we rapidly evolved our own blends and recipes, and used them in the delicious recipes and techniques we teach to people on our courses. From these blends we have created an incredible gluten free flour that has already garnered widespread acclaim.

What will my contribution pay for?
We need £15,000 to pay for: Production of our flour blend, the development of a brown bread blend and an Italian stone ground flour blend, the costs of designing and printing the packaging, the design of a new recipe booklet to accompany the flour blends, and creating marketing content to spread the word. We won’t be receiving any of these funds as personal income – every contribution received will be invested in our company and our products. By helping us, you’ll be helping hundreds of thousands of others create great gluten free baking in their own kitchens too. 
Who is the Gluten Free Flour Company?
We are Deborah and Ian Thackeray, the founders of the Gluten Free Flour Company. Our company was born out of the desperation for something decent to eat when Ian was diagnosed with coeliac disease in 2012. Our gluten free journey has seen Deborah become a qualified nutritionist, the launch of our gluten free baking courses that we run across the UK, and now our very own flour blend.
Your help and pledges will make an enormous step towards making this happen. Creating a fine range of gluten free flours that make gluten free food that everyone wants to eat.
About Deborah
Deborah started baking as a child to help her mother feed her younger brothers and baked throughout her adult life, acquiring a core of knowledge and skills in the process. She is a registered nutritionist with a BSc in Nutritional Medicine. Deborah specialises in supporting people with digestive disorders and autoimmune conditions, and is passionate about healthy and delicious eating, as well as leading our incredible gluten free baking courses.

About Ian

Ian has been a passionate cook for much of his life, through to the dinner parties and big family gatherings like his eldest daughter's wedding and the Christmases over the decades. Christmas 2012 saw family and friends gather for a festive meal that was entirely gluten free – right down to the adapted Eliza Acton Christmas pudding recipe from 1845! Towards the end, someone said "you should really start teaching this" and so in Feb 2013 they ran their first gluten free baking course, and rest is history.

 Websites
Glutenfreebaking.co.uk
Redapplenutrition.co.uk

Our Partners
We recognised early on that we needed experienced professionals to help us with the technical aspects of bringing our great flours to life.
Edme Ltd - www.edme.com Vastly experienced and innovative company supplying the baking trade for over 125 years. They invested in a dedicated gluten free mill in 2013 to serve the rapidly growing worldwide gluten free market. 
Mulino Marello - www.mulinomarello.it This mill was started in 2009 as part of the farm diversification by led by Guido and his wife Rosa when he took over the farm from his father Stefano. The mill is set in Camino Monferrato, an indescribably beautiful part of the world that has been growing great food for thousands of years. The grains ground into the wonderful flour are grown on the family farm and the farms of their neighbours. 
We need your help to bring our campaign to life, and make gluten free baking easy and enjoyable for everyone. Don't forget to share our page with your friends and family - we need your support!

story:
Our campaign: We need $15,000 to transition from a small stall at the Pittsburgh Public Market to our very own retail store!

When I started baking sticky buns and pies in my grandmother's kitchen at the tender age of 5,  I never dreamed that one day it might turn into the thriving business it is today. Now Eliza's Oven makes tens of thousands of baked goods each year, has two part-time employees and two seasonal employees, and is out-growing our 200 sq/ft space at the market that acts as both production space AND retail space!

Currently Eliza's Oven retail capacity is very minimal. You have to call ahead to pre-order large orders and ALL cakes.  No just waltzing in off the street for that last minute birthday cake or to dash in to get that death by chocolate cake in hopes "someone" will get off scot-free for forgetting an anniversary.   Instead, we spread the wealth of our scrumptious pastries through wholesale accounts ranging from grocery stores to small tea shops and our catering efforts encompassing business breakfasts and lunches as well as weddings and celebrations.

On the heels of our second anniversary, we have an opportunity to open an actual storefront in Point Breeze.  Where you ask?  Well...

For a year and a half now, the once barber shop at 7105 Reynolds Avenue has sat empty and looks more and more sad and lonely as the days go by.  It is in need of some serious TLC and loving company and a purpose to stand proud again.  As a member of the community I have the desire to help in the beautification and restoration of this building both for the betterment of the neighborhood as well as for the betterment of my business by offering me a lower monthly rent for the business, residential foot traffic (it is right by a park!) and the ability to take more control over the day-to-day operations of my business that is not allowed to me at the moment--being based in a community/shared environment.    Not to mention that a bakery & cafe would not go amiss in this awesome community! 

Look at our plans for the building below!

If all goes according to plan we will open in February 2016! 

What will you sell?

Everything!!

OK, Seriously. Eliza's Oven will continue to make the high quality pastries uniquely flavored with locally produced craft beverages.  And while you will still be able to make a custom order for your birthday, office event, or wedding, you’ll ALSO be able to stop in to get a delicious treat, pick up cupcakes on the way to a party, grab a pan of one of our fabulous savory pies for dinner or get a last-minute gift box for your sweetie.

In addition to our current menu we will be expanding our savory pies and our fresh breads selections to better serve the residents of Point Breeze as well as expanding our catering and wedding/celebration services

You can see our full menu online, but we are constantly rotating in new and seasonal flavors, so your best bet will be to stop in and browse!

How will we spend the money?

We already have most of the things needed for the baking end of things, like lots of baking pans and whisks and measuring cups, but now we need to invest in the BIG things! And not only big things, but expensive things!

How much will all those big things cost?  After our research on market prices and quotes for similar projects our projection for final costs are $15,000.

This is how we’ll spend the money:

  • Commercial equipment: A commercial refrigerator and sinks!
  • A custom-built counter from our friends at Jonathan Moran Woodworks.
  • A sign for the outside of the building
  • Flooring
  • Paint and other spiff-up-ery for the interior
  • Cash register (we figure it is time to retire our little cash box!)
  • Construction to replace the facade of the building
  • And the biggest of them all, a power upgrade, which will require pulling more lines from the main grid into the building--oof!!

Expanded Goals

Our initial $15K goal will allow us to get into the building and open - but there is so much more we need. If we raise additional funds, here’s what we’ll spend it on: 

  • $16,500: A dough sheeter, to aid us in pie production!
  • $17,500: Website update, cash register accessories, sound system.
  • $18,000: Greater visibility: Two sandwich board signs for the sidewalk, and a beautiful and eye catching display for the window - done with the aid of a professional!!
  • $19,000: Give back! Increase the amount of cupcake donations we are able to give to support Pittsburgh Area nonprofits! We already give a significant number of donations and discounts – but we could definitely do more!

 

Who are we?

Eliza's Oven consists of me, Eliza Jane Bowman, Karen Baum, my part-time baker and full-time actress extraordinaire, and Lauren McNulty, My cafe manager, loving wife and mother of 3 - also a local Point Breeze Resident!

I am a self-taught baker, who took the skills I learned from my grandmother, the generous amounts of information online and in my many many cookbooks and combined it withe amazing local flavors of our partners Wigle Whiskey, East End Brewing Co., Commonplace Coffee, Healcrest Urban Farms, Clarion Farms Beef, Brunton Dairy (and many many more!) to create the most delectable flavors for our pies and pastries, such as our Steak in Stout Gravy Pot Pie and our Jump Jitter and Java Cake.  And of course, we specialize in stickybuns, just like my Grandma did!

The Risks

Okay, I’ll tell you what you already know: running a food business is hard work! We can’t predict the future, but here’s what we do know:

  • Customers love our products! A lot of our success is due to our awesome customers reviewing us on YELP and telling their friends to come and find us! Whenever I think, “Hold on, what am I doing??” All of the positive feedback from customers is what keeps me in the business.
  • In two years Eliza's oven has doubled in size and more than quadrupled our production, and we are looking to continue in that direction!
  • Our rent will be less than what we are paying now, except instead of a shared space with lots of limitations, we’ll have our own store AND retail hours, AND be able to expand production even more. So, almost the same rent with new and different kinds of income? Let’s do it!

story:
Hi, I am Gigi Page,  a Chocolatier and owner of Bouquets Of Chocolate. A uniquely new addition to the gift giving market. "Chocolate" is a very desired and appreciated gift. I have been a chocolatier since 2010. Along with investing lot's of time & money, I have Trademarked & LLC this concept. My business plan takes this business into Franchising within a couple of years.

The storefronts will consist of the bouquets but also inventory many varied price point chocolate inspired gifts. Truffles, Fudge, Brownies, Candies, along with desserts including gelato. I will include a" World Chocolate Tasting Bar," were samples of unusual flavors can be enjoyed by patrons. I will further teach small groups the art of "Tempering".The décor will be bright and inviting, no matter the choice of your purchase, It will be a delight.

Now I am in need of cash for the building and Build out of the store. This is why I am Crowdfunding & asking for your participation. I need YOUR help.This campaign means everything to me in getting to launch this business. I have worked so hard on developing the overall concept,  It will give me the life I need for my future.

Please check out my website Bouquets Of Chocolate.com to see an array of decorated Bouquets for all occasions as well as checking out this campaign to see the "Perks" I am offering in appreciation for your help. No amount too small, I am so grateful. Please ask your friends to take a look and participate also. Thank you for your interest and sincere thanks for your help.
story_txt:
Hi, I am Gigi Page,  a Chocolatier and owner of Bouquets Of Chocolate. A uniquely new addition to the gift giving market. "Chocolate" is a very desired and appreciated gift. I have been a chocolatier since 2010. Along with investing lot's of time & money, I have Trademarked & LLC this concept. My business plan takes this business into Franchising within a couple of years.
The storefronts will consist of the bouquets but also inventory many varied price point chocolate inspired gifts. Truffles, Fudge, Brownies, Candies, along with desserts including gelato. I will include a" World Chocolate Tasting Bar," were samples of unusual flavors can be enjoyed by patrons. I will further teach small groups the art of "Tempering".The décor will be bright and inviting, no matter the choice of your purchase, It will be a delight.

story:
WHAT IS BRETTY FINGERS?


Bretty Fingers was a name given to me by a friend who joked that everything I touch gets inoculated with the wild yeast species Brettanomyces and gets funky and wild. I proudly wear shirts with Brettanomyces splayed across them, to the horror and chagrin of various brewers and winemakers I've met. While the name is, thankfully (a brewer who cannot brew a beer without infecting it certainly isn't desirable), a joke, I was proud of the title as a passionate lover of all funky and wild beers – so proud, that I gleefully take it as my brewing name in this project.

WHO AM I?


My name is Aiden Robert Jönsson. I am born and raised almost entirely in Los Angeles, but with Swedish family. I now live in Stockholm, where I have been studying and creating a life for myself. My studies have been in marine and mechanical engineering, as well as in meteorology and climatology.

My big thing is fermentation. I've been fermenting things for six years now, brewing beer and mead, baking with sourdough, making kimchee, sauerkraut, and all manner of fermented vegetables. Most who know me introduce me with, "he ferments … everything." I have worked in a brewpub in Anaheim, California, as well as interned in breweries in and around Stockholm.

Now, I take on increasingly complex projects in the realm of fermented foodstuffs, and have moved on to brewing mostly with alternative & wild yeasts and lactic acid bacteria – farmhouse and wild, mixed-culture ales.

I wish, more than anything, to make fermentation my way of life and to become an advocate for fermentation and rich microbial biodiversity. This project is exactly the venue through which I want to explore this life path.

THE PLAN

In order to get Bretty Fingers' beers out to the world, we're going to need a few things to get started. Here's a breakdown for you, so you know exactly where the funds will be going:


  1. BREWHOUSE USE. Luckily, we have been invited and blessed with the collaboration of the brewery Brewing Költur, and while I won't have to start from scratch with building a brewhouse and getting the proper licenses – which is good news for us all, because beer can be made and sold as soon as the project is funded – I will need to pay for brewery usage fees. Bretty Fingers will use the brewhouse with each day used, but each batch will be around 1 000 SEK/€107/$120 in electricity, sanitization, and water use.

  2. FERMENTORS. My biggest plan is to ferment darned near everything in oak. Oak provides a few things for the wild yeast and bacteria: food for the bacteria and wild yeast sp. Brettanomyces, a residence for the house culture of these yeasts and bacteria to build up and live in, and a dynamic environment allowing small amounts of oxygen to feed and continue the fermentation. This allows for a peculiar, specific, and truly unique wild flavor to be imparted in all of Bretty Fingers' beers. We will be acquiring a slew of freshly emptied wine barrels, each one costing 1 900 SEK/€206/$235. The more barrels, the better – we can get longer-aged, dynamic beers going to release down the road – but we need at least six to start off with!

  3. FITTINGS & TRANSFER SUPPLIES. We need stainless steel fittings, hoses, valves, a barrel filler, a bottle filler, and carbon dioxide for moving beer around and to build our oaken fermentors into useable brewery equipment.

  4. CLEANING SUPPLIES. I'll need the typical sanitizing solutions for brewing: Saniclean, PBW, and most importantly, barrels need to be kept clean between batches by using K-meta (potassium metabisulfite) and citric acid.

  5. KEGS & BOTTLES. Lastly, and not least, we'll need bottles, caps, and kegs to get our beer out to stores, pubs, cafés, and restaurants. Funky beers go best in champagne bottles; both due to high levels of carbonation and continued fermentation in the bottle (my goal is that all of our beers will be ageable and dynamic, more in the direction of complexity in wine), and because of green glass' ability to let light react with aromas in the beer, just like in traditional farmhouse and funky beers. A pallet of 37,5 cl champagne bottles costs 13 031 SEK/€1 397/$1 568 – along with a bit more in capping and labelling costs.

  6. INGREDIENTS. To brew beer, you need malt, grains, and hops. A typical batch will be around 1 200 SEK/€128/$144 in ingredient cost, and the occasional special batch will cost more for fruit, extra malts, and other special treatments.

If the project isn't fully funded, don't worry – I will have a way to get fermentors filled! I'll purchase at least five oak barrels as well as all of the other supplies – bringing Bretty Fingers to life come heck or high water within the year.

THE IMPACT

I've been told that I need to ferment things for a living – it's just what I'm most passionate about, and what I wish to do most with my life. It's not just about eating and drinking; it's a whole life philosophy about experience and discourse.

My beer, food, art, and ideas have been received with enthusiasm and a desire for availability. Right now, I'm not able to give or make available to everyone around me the things that I create, but I want to make a venue through which I can provide. I want the world to see what I can create, an insight into my mind about my tastes and experiences in the world.

So what will we all gain from getting Bretty Fingers started? I cannot stress how much it will mean. I've been asked to break into the brewing world in various ways, and it's become evident that having Bretty Fingers as my creative outlet will be not just a huge boon to me in getting out what I need to get out and doing what I love, but for Sweden and the world to get beautiful wild, funky, complex flavors in beer. The diversity of the brewing world is something that we truly need, and the world deserves to see what this beautiful land has to offer in agriculture and biodiversity. So we will all get incredible flavors readily available out of it.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

There are a number of hurdles that Bretty Fingers will have to overcome. One is scale: I am starting on a very small scale, small batch project that will do greatly with a little more availability. I will start with what I can, but the better the startup capacity, the more options I will have for diverse creations and the more able we all will be to get a hold of Bretty Fingers' beers.

The challenge of getting the beer out there is going to be a great one. I will need many hands in help. I will need to hire occasional help for bottling, packaging, and other such things that requires a lot of manpower. But with a little help from everyone, we can do this.

Luckily, I already have everything in place legally and businesswise, so that the hurdle that stands in the way of most breweries is already done with. Distribution is already in place, and a following already exists. The greatest challenge now is to get barrels onto the farm and filled.

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

It's okay if you can't contribute! But a few clicks and some word of mouth can mean a whole lot for making Bretty Fingers a reality. It would mean the world to me if you share this project to your friends and online community, and tell people about it if you want it to come true!

Thank you, and Bretty Fingers greatly looks forward to providing you with delicious beer and food in the near future!

story:
Silver Fern™ Brand: Low Net Carb Paka Syrups 

We have developed an amazing line of low net carb syrups that are naturally sweetened with Kakato™ sweetener. These syrups come in five flavors, are natural and contain no artificial flavors, sweeteners or colors. They don't use sugar alcohols and have no added sugars. They taste just like the real thing.

We need your help to get the price of these amazing syrups down to as low as possible. The larger the production run we do, the lower we can get the price. We want everyone to benefit from these low carb syrups and the lower the price the more people can enjoy them!


The Syrup Dilemma

There are many popular protein pancakes and/or mixed grain "healthier" pancake mixes on the market, but what syrup do you put on them? That's the dilemma. There is nothing you can put on pancakes that isn't comprised of sugar, sugar alcohols, artificial sweeteners, or straight fructose. Your favorite organic real maple syrup has something like 53 diabetes inducing grams of sugar per serving. It's just not healthy. It may be 100% natural and organic but it is also 100% not good for you. What about the sugar alcohol and artificial sweetened syrups? They don't taste good. Everyone wants the real flavors of real syrups but without all the real drawbacks associated with them. That's why we need your help to launch the first line of syrups that solves all of these problems.

Take a look at these nutritional highlights for our Paka High Protein Pancake Mix:

Wow! That's a great nutritional deck for a pancake right?

Now put some real maple syrup on it and you get this combined nutritional deck:

Yikes! What's the point of a healthier pancake if you are going to drench it in unhealthy syrup?

What the world needs is a healthy syrup that compliments a healthy pancake! It was no easy task, but after over a year of research and testing we have done it!

Paka syrups by Silver Fern™ Brand are natural, high in fiber, low in calories and have only 2 or 3 net carbs per serving. We bet you can't tell the difference between Silver Fern™ Brand and full sugar syrups.

We need your help so we can do a larger initial production run to keep the cost of Silver Fern™ Brand Paka Syrups as low as possible.

The Silver Fern™ Brand Story

Silver Fern was born in 2014 out of a simple vision: to create the ultimate natural sweetener. Kakato™ sweetener was the result of that effort. Kakato™ sweetener is made from natural ingredients, has no sugar, no sugar alcohols, includes dietary fiber and looks and tastes just like real sugar.

The bottom line is Kakato™ sweetener provides all the good:

  • Natural
  • Looks like sugar
  • Tastes like sugar
  • Dietary fiber
  • Low calories
  • Low glycemic index
  • Satisfying and filling

And none of the bad:

  • No unpleasant aftertaste
  • No unpleasant digestive side effects
  • No artificial or chemical ingredients

Kakato™ sweetener changed everything. We immediately started to develop it into new products; baking mixes, drink mixes, meal replacement shakes and more.

The Syrup Solution

We then researched and tested for over a year to find a way to turn Kakato™ sweetener into a syrup. Introducing Silver Fern™ Brand syrups, made from natural Kakato™ sweetener:

  • Taste just like real syrups
  • No unpleasant aftertaste
  • No artificial colors, sweeteners or flavors
  • No sugar alcohols
  • Fewer calories than sugar syrups
  • High in dietary fiber
  • 0 g to 1 g of sugar per serving
  • Low net carbs
  • Low glycemic index
  • Filling and satisfying

Take a look at this comparison below. Pay extra attention to the net carbs!

     Versus:

 

Silver Fern™ Brand Paka Syrups may not change the world, but with your help we can change the way people enjoy pancakes forever!


Flavors:

Silver Fern™ Brand Syrups will launch in 5 amazing flavors!

Strawberry, Blueberry, Maple, Blackberry & Raspberry

What's Inside:

Paka Syrup by Silver Fern™ Brand


Your Contributions

With your help, we can make a bigger initial production run and help bring the cost of Silver Fern™ Brand Syrups way down to help more people enjoy healthier pancakes!

  • $3 - Shout out on our Facebook Page & a $5 off coupon at SilverFernBrand.com
  • $13 - One 16 Oz. Bottle of Silver Fern™ Brand Maple Flavored Syrup
  • $13 - One 16 Oz. Bottle of Silver Fern™ Brand  Strawberry Flavored Syrup
  • $13 - One 16 Oz. Bottle of Silver Fern™ Brand  Blueberry Flavored Syrup
  • $13 - One 16 Oz. Bottle of Silver Fern™ Brand  Raspberry Flavored Syrup
  • $13 - One 16 Oz. Bottle of Silver Fern™ Brand  Blackberry Flavored Syrup
  • $26 - One 16 Oz. Bottle of Silver Fern™ Brand Maple Flavored Syrup and a box of Silver Fern™ Brand High Protein Pancake Mix
  • $50 - 2 Bottles of Silver Fern™ Brand Syrup (Maple, Strawberry) & 2 Boxes of Silver Fern™ Brand High Protein Pancake Mix
  • $65 - 5 Bottles of Silver Fern™ Brand Syrup (Maple, Strawberry, Blueberry, Blackberry, Raspberry).
  • $150 - Five Bottles of Silver Fern™ Brand Syrup (Maple, Strawberry, Blueberry, Blackberry, Raspberry), 3 Boxes of Silver Fern™ Brand High Protein Pancake Mix & one 11.7 oz. Canister of Kakato™ sweetener - Ships free to the U.S. 
  • $300 - Ten Bottles of Silver Fern™ Brand Syrup (2 Maple, 2 Strawberry, 2 Blueberry, 2 Blackberry, 2 Raspberry), 8 Boxes of Silver Fern™ Brand High Protein Pancake Mix, a 30 Oz Canister of Kakato™ sweetener, an embossed Silver Fern™ Brand stainless steel canister - Ships free to the U.S. 
  • $1000 - Ultimate Pancake Lovers: Twenty Bottles of of  Silver Fern™ Brand Syrup (4 Maple, 4 Strawberry, 4 Blueberry, 4 Blackberry, 4 Raspberry), 30 Boxes of Silver Fern™ Brand High Protein Pancake Mix, Four 30 Oz Canisters of Kakato™ sweetener,  Two 11.7 Canisters of Tino Fiber Supplement, Two embossed Silver Fern™ Brand stainless steel canisters, Two Shaker Bottles - Ships free to the U.S.

story:
Isabella Gourmet Foods, a boutique artisan grocery in downtown Santa Barbara, has had its doors open for 1  1/2 years now - no easy feat for any small business, and we are well aware that it wouldn't still be thriving without the support of our talented vendors and kind customers who walk through our doors everyday. 

Since its inception in May 2013, Isabella Gourmet Foods has flirted with freezers. We opened the store with a modest horizontal ice cream freezer to support a small selection of stock, including Freezer Monkey Pops, Sugar & Salt Creamery Almond Milk Sorbets, and Recipes Gluten-Free Cookie Dough. Nearly 2 years later, we have sold the freezer in anticipation of a larger upright, double-glass door commercial freezer that can support the demands of our customers. With the installation of the freezer, we intend to bring you regional favorites like Negranti  Sheep's Milk Ice Cream and McConnell's Ice Cream, as well as revive old favorites like Freezer Monkeys Pops and Bon Bons and Tartisan Frozen Sweet and Savory Pies.

A few months ago, we ran an unsuccessful crowdfunding campaign that was broad in scope and ambitious in plan. Now we're honing our vision and taking it one step at a time (not that we've abandoned our more far-reaching plans by any means!). A freezer will be the next phase in a plan capstoned by the commencement of the Cebada Wine Tasting Room upstairs.

Imagine having frozen meals that you can grab on your way home from work for a quick and easy dinner! Picture being able to pickup a pint of artisan-crafted ice cream, or grab a loaf of frozen gluten-free bread to savor at your leisure!

In exchange for your generous support, we've put together a thoughtful list of perks to show our appreciation. 

We're especially excited to offer our 3 tiers of Isabella Gourmet Foods Membership, available only to donors on this Kickstarter Campaign. Choose from Gold, Silver, or Platinum and receive a bevy of perks over the course of the next year! 

Even $5 puts your name on our large store window (like a celebrity!) so the public knows just how lucky we are to have you onboard.

Most of the our perks connect you to the local food scene in a very intimate way, especially the VIP tour of local artisan farms and production sites. Some are more tangible items, like the very special Limited Edition Print of an original drawing of shop by local artist Ali Rybczyk.

Finally, your support extends far beyond monetary donation and perks.

Every share on Facebook, Instagram, and Twiiter, every blog post and newsletter blurb, and every mention to your customers, family, and friends brings our campaign and our mission to support local artisans (and those artisans from farther flung regions), closer to fulfillment.

Help us fund this freezer and we'll bring you the next level of Isabella Gourmet Foods: Frozen!

Meet our dream freezer!

True TS-49FG-LD 54" Stainless Steel Two Section Glass Door Reach In Freezer with LED Lighting - 49 Cu. Ft.
story_txt: Isabella Gourmet Foods, a boutique artisan grocery in downtown Santa Barbara, has had its doors open for 1  1/2 years now - no easy feat for any small business, and we are well aware that it wouldn't still be thriving without the support of our talented vendors and kind customers who walk through our doors everyday. Since its inception in May 2013, Isabella Gourmet Foods has flirted with freezers. We opened the store with a modest horizontal ice cream freezer to support a small selection of stock, including Freezer Monkey Pops, Sugar & Salt Creamery Almond Milk Sorbets, and Recipes Gluten-Free Cookie Dough. Nearly 2 years later, we have sold the freezer in anticipation of a larger upright, double-glass door commercial freezer that can support the demands of our customers. With the installation of the freezer, we intend to bring you regional favorites like Negranti  Sheep's Milk Ice Cream and McConnell's Ice Cream, as well as revive old favorites like Freezer Monkeys Pops and Bon Bons and Tartisan Frozen Sweet and Savory Pies.A few months ago, we ran an unsuccessful crowdfunding campaign that was broad in scope and ambitious in plan. Now we're honing our vision and taking it one step at a time (not that we've abandoned our more far-reaching plans by any means!). A freezer will be the next phase in a plan capstoned by the commencement of the Cebada Wine Tasting Room upstairs.Imagine having frozen meals that you can grab on your way home from work for a quick and easy dinner! Picture being able to pickup a pint of artisan-crafted ice cream, or grab a loaf of frozen gluten-free bread to savor at your leisure!In exchange for your generous support, we've put together a thoughtful list of perks to show our appreciation. We're especially excited to offer our 3 tiers of Isabella Gourmet Foods Membership, available only to donors on this Kickstarter Campaign. Choose from Gold, Silver, or Platinum and receive a bevy of perks over the course of the next year! Even $5 puts your name on our large store window (like a celebrity!) so the public knows just how lucky we are to have you onboard.Most of the our perks connect you to the local food scene in a very intimate way, especially the VIP tour of local artisan farms and production sites. Some are more tangible items, like the very special Limited Edition Print of an original drawing of shop by local artist Ali Rybczyk.Finally, your support extends far beyond monetary donation and perks.Every share on Facebook, Instagram, and Twiiter, every blog post and newsletter blurb, and every mention to your customers, family, and friends brings our campaign and our mission to support local artisans (and those artisans from farther flung regions), closer to fulfillment.Help us fund this freezer and we'll bring you the next level of Isabella Gourmet Foods: Frozen!Meet our dream freezer!True TS-49FG-LD 54" Stainless Steel Two Section Glass Door Reach In Freezer with LED Lighting - 49 Cu. Ft.

story:
My Story

Hello, my name is Jamar. I will introduce you to my campaign designed to raise funds to complete my food truck C'est Bon Manger. My project began 3 years ago when I became discouraged with only having just enough to survive. I thought surviving was not for me. I wanted to thrive. I wanted to give. I wanted to make a difference in other's lives. 

I prayed about this and came up with an idea to start a food truck. After putting the numbers together I thought, there is no way I can do this business in less than 5 years. I was wrong. During this time I began to develop a prayer life, I began to make going to church a priority, and I developed a trust in God like never before. To my surprise, money just started to come in from unlikely places I was able to figure out how to use money I had in other places to fund my project. Long story short, in a matter of two and a half years I was almost done with my food truck project. I truly believe the difference was the way I now lived. I took a chance, believed in God, and consulted Him for even the smallest of things. Everything started to change. I am now at the very end of this project and understand that another test has begun. I am 90% complete and totally out of money. The option of borrowing is no longer there because I am at my max. 

I began to worry, but not for long because I came to the understanding that I've made it this far, I just have to dig deeper into my faith in God. I came up with an idea that I would ask friends, coworkers, and family to borrow or donate money on a smaller scale. I didn't know how to ask or if it would seem like I were begging or soliciting them for money. At this time I remembered doing research on another food truck in the Atlanta area and how this food truck owner struggled to get his business off the ground. I decided to contact him and one of the ideas was the indiegogo.com, a crowdfunding website. The idea was almost like the one I had for asking friends and family for donations. I thought, could this be the way? 

After careful thought and prayer, here I am, asking you the person viewing this campaign to contribute to my food truck project.

What will I use your funds to do for my business?

I will purchase 2 commercial refrigerators, 2 fryers, I can't fry french fries and fish in the same fryer, a 2 well steam table, and a countless amount of small items needed to run the business. 
I will also pay labor to the great guys at Kajun Kampers RV Service to install all appliances.

The Impact

I am hoping your contributions exceed my goal because I will give a percentage to my church and to the school I teach at. My church is in the process of building and could use the additional funds to help. Since I am a teacher, I am faced on a daily basis the harsh reality that kids don't have the necessary items such as school supplies, decent clothing, books or technology. These items I feel will help them to compete for those scholarships in high schools, and the jobs needed to support their families after college. I want to make a difference in these areas, and will use my business to do my part.

Risks & Challenges

I have found that beginning a business is very challenging. There are many obstacles to overcome. I have learned through this project that discouragement can damage your dream and drive to finish.

I do feel that there are risks to this business, just like any other business. I am determined to make this dream a reality and to thrive while doing it!

Other Ways You Can Help

I do appreciate everyone's contributions to my campaign. If however you can not help in a monetary way, please consider me when talking to friends or family members about this cool food truck campaign.
Indiegogo has share tools that can you assist in this manner.

story:
The Nuts & Bolts.

Atto & Sons is a new, family based gourmet food company.  Our passion for food comes through with each of our three hand-crafted products.  You would know what I mean as soon as you taste it.  

 

We have three products in our repertoire:  Torshi (left), Roasted Lentils (right), and Fresh Vegetable Relish (not pictured above).  All 3 of these offerings are Gluten Free, Vegan, and have a distinct flavor and texture with a high nutritional value.

Much of our product line comes from generations of this same passion that I mentioned above, most recently inspired by our late grandfather - a man who has only ever been spoken of in a positive light - Fuad Atto. 


  • Hey there fine food lovers!  My name is James Atto.  My younger brother, Jeffrey, and I have started this here food company about 18 months ago, and are on the precipice of a really big "crossroads moment" in our business.  We are both avid food lovers and appreciate nutrition and integrity in what we eat.  It's called "Truth through Food."  (P.S. I'm on the left - this is what I look like clean-shaven; more on that below)
  • In order for our business to grow into a sustainable one, we have to make some moves.  It is so important for us to raise these funds, because if we cannot provide ourselves with the freedom, flexibility, and efficiency that our business needs, this will significantly hinder our growth.  
  • How can you help??  Our goal as a company is to be a wholesaler.  The volume of our production every time we cook (currently) is limited. If we want to get into grocery stores (Not just any grocery stores, but a store near you!) we need to increase our output capabilities, and keep the price appealing to these retailers... and what better time than today!?

Der Ofen = The Oven.

What You Get for Donating.

      

Here is the "give and take":

  • Our main objective is to purchase a new or used rotating rack oven with convection capability.  We use this oven to make our unique Roasted Lentils.  We have 3 flavors:  The Standard, Mediterranean, and Spicy. 
  • This oven is paramount to the success, growth, and further development of Atto & Sons Roasted Lentils product. An oven of this kind can range anywhere from $10,000 (used) to $30,000 (new).  
  • Any donations in excess of our goal will be directly attributed to production equipment needed for other facets of the Roasted Lentil process (mixers, kettles, sheet trays, speed racks). 
  • *NO MATTER how much we raise, we will be donating a minimum of 10% of our net funds to Camp-Casey (www.camp-casey.org), which is a Michigan-based horseback riding program for children with cancer. 

  • The majority of the perks we are offering are food-company related.  However, we know how to have fun, and we are also offering some off-the-wall, entertaining perks which you may have never thought you'd see.
HERE COME THE PERKS.
  • Highlights include (starting with the photos below): Shaving my head or my beard in any style that you want (to make grandma happy - she hates my beard!)  The hair is out of control, too!

[This is Grandma Victoria showing how she would like to pull off my beard]

...other perks include a private acoustic music performance (you can choose the set list), Atto & Sons Swag Bag, tons of food products, IT consulting sessions, personal Chef Sessions (we'll come to your house and cook our products, or apply our products to a fresh meal), and an epic night on the town including drinks, transportation and Karaoke!

The Impact.

By your contribution, you will have a direct impact on our ability to bring in the most cutting edge equipment needed to scale our business.  What does it mean to scale a business?  That is a great question.  This means that we will be able to increase our production capabilities, AND having significant equipment (as a Rotating Convection Rack Oven) will allow us to produce much higher quantities, but still keep our costs and pricing  as reasonable as they are today. 

  • It's not just a business move.  Our mission with this company is to provide unique, textural foods with a High Nutritional Value.  We are trying to contribute to the overall mental and physical well-being of all of our current and future customers.  


  • It's tough to feel good about what we are putting into our bodies these days, and we want you to feel very confident when you buy and consume our products.  Our approach is to create as natural a product as humanly possible, and our production process has a lot to do with the end result.  We're pretty happy with this process so far, but we cannot maintain this current level of consistency unless we continue to improve the manner in which we produce.  
  • Even if we don't reach our entire goal, 10% of all net donations will still go to Camp Casey, and the rest of the funds will be attributed toward this rack oven or any associated payments.  

We're Up Against It.

It's definitely tough to compete in the marketplace because there are many other quality products out there right now.  

  • One way we are fighting this challenge head on is to create products that no one has ever seen before.  Specifically, our Roasted Lentils are a product which could make or break our business. However, every time we sell directly at an event or Farmer's Market, you would never imagine how often I hear "I've never seen (or tasted) anything like this before."  (And that's how I like it).  
  • The biggest obstacle we have in the short-term is getting to market first.  We already have a small line of local stores which are begging for the Roasted Lentils to be on their shelves, because no one currently has a product like it. Help us to be the first!

You're helping just by reading.

Even if you cannot contribute monetarily, please tell 6, nay 7 people that you know to come and visit our page.  Reading about our vision and mission will definitely give you peace of mind, especially if you ever doubt the integrity of the retail food industry, as so many do these days.  

  • Remember, you are donating 10% of YOUR donation to Camp Casey, an amazing local charity putting on AWESOME programs for children with cancer and their families. 
  • At the very least, check out our videos, and if it doesn't make you at least chuckle or smile, we'll give you a $1 off your next purchase.  
  • Please, please, PLEASE share this on your social media (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, etc).  We appreciate all of your support, thoughts, and plain old good vibes coming our way!

Let's do this.

story:
As seen on:


What do we know about balance? Either we have it or we don't, right?

What do we know about IQ? It can be low and it can be high.

What do we know about creating harmony between the two? Nothing? 

Enter OrganIQ Food. That's that something.

OrganIQ Food is eatelligence.

It is a preventive, unique snack based on the principles of traditional Chinese medicine, developed and produced by a team of healthy lifestyle enthusiasts in Croatia.

OrganIQ presents a perfect blend of 100% natural, unrefined grains, legumes, oil seeds, carob, cocoa and aromatic herbs, essential for the balance of the human organism.

What's in it?  15 ingredients. 100% organic. 

This one-of-a-kind plant-based meal presents an ideal solution for people with dynamic and stressful occupations that leave no time for nutrition.

How does it work?

Easy enough - OrganIQ mixes well with milk, water or yogurt. Find the one that works best for you and use it twice a day, we recommend mornings and evenings.

It'll work its magic within 3 weeks of daily usage, removing any imbalance within our organism and replacing it with perfect harmony.

WHY OrganIQ?

OrganIQ has powers like no other superhero.

Here are some facts about OrganIQ as a preventive food suplement:

  • strengthens and balances all the energy systems of the human organism
  • maintains blood sugar levels which reduces pancreas strains
  • it's very suitable for the implementation of low-calorie diets
  • ideal for the nutrition of vegetarians and macrobiotics
  • provides excellent recovery for debilitating illnesses
  • does not contain sugar, artificial sweeteners, flavors, colourants or      preservatives 
  • a source of fiber, contains natural carbohydrates and omega-3 fatty acid
  • low on gluten

Clinically tested and approved by the medical staff of the Clinical Hospital Center Dubrava, Croatia.

OrganIQ  Food has a list of problems it likes to deal with, such as:

  • Digestive problems, excess stomach acid, nervous stomach, bowel problems
  • Chronic physical fatigue, pain in the musculoskeletal and connective system
  • Stress, lack of concentration, irritability, motivation and poor memory

  • Obesity, weight reduction
  • Cardiovascular disease, disorder of blood pressure, anemia, excess cholesterol
  • Diabetes, control of blood sugar
  • Nutrition of athletes, sports injury, injury tendency, lack of fitness

What will you get?

A specially designed box which contains 42 bags of this super balancing blend, as well as OrganIQ Food brochure, with detailed description of what it can do for you.

Each bag weighs only 25g, and with it's a pocket size so you can carry it with you anywhere with you.

Why do we need your help?

We have spent a year developing and manufacturing our product, testing it via clinical trials and capturing testimonials of patients who used OrganIQ Food.

Our plan is, after the successful set up of a manufacturing plant in Croatia, to establish mass production in the US. However, the tools needed for this size of production have proven to be a financial setback.

BUDGET calculation


TIMELINE

TEAM OrganIQ

Aida Poparić

Project Manager, project Alpha

Aljoša Lijić

Graphic Designer, working his magic in the creative zone

Ivor Kušić

Developer, our campaign superstar - enhances our performance, giving advice on crucial matters

Tatjana Papo Kušić

CFO, keeps us from legal troubles and watches over our budget like a hawk

Boris Kušić

CTO, helps us deal with technical bumps on the road

Aleksandra Birta & Tomislav Ostoić

The team behind our eatelligence video

Mateja Vrčković

Photographer, the genius behind our campaign shoot

Other ways you can contribute

To all the people who can't contribute financially, we ask you to spread the word! OrganIQ can help your sister, uncle, girlfriend, grandma, dad, cousin, your boss, even your mailman! It's eatelligence in your pocket!

Thank You!

Team OrganIQ

story:
Dear Friends/Colleagues,

As some of you may or may not know, I am involved with a 501(c)3 non-profit organization called Community2Community Haiti (C2C Haiti). My family hails from the island nation which occupies the western third of the island of Hispaniola. I have been blessed enough to visit several times, and can tell you that the country is so much more than the oft-moniker “poorest nation in the Western Hemisphere.”  It is a beautiful country full of amazing scenery, wonderful food, rich history and culture, and a warmhearted, hard-working, resilient people who want nothing more than to move forward.

When I looked for an organization to volunteer my time/financial support with, I wanted to choose one that is honest and making a tangible impact. An organization that is about more than just heartbreaking photos of malnourished children, as these campaigns (while well-meaning) tend to provide short-term solutions to the much greater economic, political, educational, and infrastructure challenges. Many of these solutions also hinder economic development by fostering dependence, and contribute to the cycle of poverty – putting local farmers, merchants, clothing manufacturers, construction workers, etc. out of business.

Since the earthquake...
While thousands of NGOs flocked to Haiti before, during, and after the horrific earthquake in 2010, progress has been slow and has many asking where the money has gone. Sustainable and long-term progress in moving things forward doesn’t come from charity and handouts – it comes from empowering people to become self-sufficient, independent, and to participate in rebuilding their own communities - creating jobs, improving public infrastructure, and providing access to education and healthcare.  

Why Community2Community Haiti (c2c Haiti)
That’s just what Community2Community Haiti is all about - developing communities by working WITH the community. C2C works side-by-side local community groups in Petit Goave, Haiti – passionate engineers, architects, teachers, and medical professionals, building solutions from the ground up – built for the people, by the people.

I am writing to ask for your support in helping me raise funds as a Community2Community Haiti Ambassador. You’ll be supporting:

Our Water Initiative: building a water distribution system that will give our community partner on the mountainside access to clean, potable water and developing commerce with sales of surplus water to neighboring communities
Our Reforestation Initiative: planting one million trees in Haiti, raising awareness about the root causes and severe impacts of deforestation
Our Education Initiative: we sponsor a school program that educates 315 children in our mountainside community, building a temporary school shelter and paying teacher stipends. Community2Community's central education initiative is the construction of the Saul Louis Community School - a state of the art facility that will allow the children in the community to prepare for higher educational platforms and provide adults with training programs regarding health, business and economic development.
Our Road Initiative: building a road that will connect our mountainside community with surrounding towns – facilitating commerce and travel to and from work and school.  

So says the proverb, “Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man how to fish and he will eat for a life time.” Please join me by considering making a one-time donation or becoming a C2C neighbor. You can become a C2C neighbor for as little as $15 a month, and one-time donations of any size would be greatly appreciated by the people of Petit Goave! Donations are tax deductible and go straight towards the project we are running in Haiti.  

Please view this short video (with yours truly making a cameo appearance) to learn more about how your contribution can make a difference: http://bit.ly/1Gj5dtJ

 
Warm regards,

Eveline Dominique

To become a C2C Neighbor for as little as $15 per month, click here: www.community2community.info/c2c-neighbor

To learn more about C2CHaiti please visit us online: www.community2community.info

Follow us on Facebook & Twitter
https://www.facebook.com/C2CHaiti

https://twitter.com/c2chaiti

story:
Introduction

The Wandering Bonsai was created by me in Los Angeles in 2007. I am a rabid gardener and Bonsai enthusiast and would spend hours in the yard, one day I decided I wanted to give back to my community but creating and selling beautiful Bonsai. Unfortunately, turning The Wandering Bonsai into a business was put on hold due to a career change, then a move to Las Vegas, then life, then more life. Almost ten years later, I am finally ready to fulfill my dream, and I will launch this dream in a unique and innovative way. 

Join me in making this concept a reality by funding my startup costs! 

My goal is to create a mobile Bonsai shop by outfitting a 12 - 14 foot enclosed trailer into a retail 'store' from which I will sell Bonsai and supplies as well as teach classes and workshops. By keeping the Bonsai shop mobile provides an opportunity for more exposure in the community and drastically reduces expenses in the form of utilities, rent, etc. allowing for a stronger focus on delivering quality products.

The Market  

Austin is the perfect city to launch this endeavor, it has become the epicenter of mobile retail, specifically food trucks, but we are starting to see a trend towards non-food retail and people are paying attention. There are also an endless number of festivals, street fairs, and farmer's markets around Austin that would love to have a Bonsai retailer join their vendor list. Everyone loves a beautiful Bonsai and there is always a demand for Bonsai as gifts but after joining the Austin Bonsai Society and working with the limited number of retail options here in Austin, it is also clear that there is a need for a legitimate retail supplier of tools, pots, and soils in the greater Austin area. Right now most intermediate to expert Bonsai enthusiasts buy their necessary tools and supplies from online vendors. The Wandering Bonsai hopes to alleviate their need to buy online by providing those items in our shop.  

Financial Path to Success  

With The Wandering Bonsai's unique vision and the gap in retailers in Austin, the company expects its profits to steadily increase over the first year. Even with our conservative projections, net profits are projected to increase by almost 80% over the next three years, from ~$15,000 to ~$27,000 and will maintain a 35-40% net profit each year. To get this startup business off the ground and maintain sufficient cash over the first year, the company will be asking to borrow $30,000. Our projected cash flow will increase our cash balance and allow us to leverage this asset to creating new opportunities. During this time, we do not expect any difficulties in maintaining sufficient sales to meet our costs.

Our startup table does not reflect the 30,000 as I've decided to include the Indiegogo expenses and a small truck downpayment totalling $4,500. 

Keys To Success

1. Location - a mobile retail trailer will provide us the opportunity to cater to the entire Austin community.  

2. Knowledge and dedication- Daniel Pintauro - Tabares' knowledge, expertise and dedication to the art of Bonsai will propel the business forward and create a regular clientele.  

3. Need - there are very few Bonsai retailers in the Austin area so The Wandering Bonsai will fill a void by offering Bonsai and products for both the novice and expert.  

4. Unique - the unique idea of selling Bonsai and its various parts and offering maintenance plans and classes out of a mobile retail trailer will create excitement and buzz.  

5. Health care - What makes Daniel's vision unique is his dedication to the life of your tree; a Bonsai is an investment and so Daniel includes a free pamphlet on the care of each type of Bonsai, as well as offers maintenance plans, babysitting, yearly replanting plans, and triage sessions.  

6. Social media - combining the mobile unit with a social media presence will further the reach of the business, specifically providing customers with information on where the mobile unit will be stationed any given day. 

The Product

The Wandering Bonsai will sell everything and anything related to the art of Bonsai.  

•Each new Bonsai will be prepared, by Daniel, using traditional techniques of reweaving roots, potting, styling, trimming, pruning, and wiring. 

• You will also be able to purchase an assortment of pots, soil, fertilizers, tools, and ornaments. These items will range in price and will cater to both the novice and expert Bonsai enthusiast. 

• After purchasing a Bonsai, you will have the opportunity to purchase maintenance plans, yearly replanting plans, babysitting options, and triage sessions. Maintenance plans include options for the customer to bring the Bonsai to the booth for quick trimming and a checkup, home visits, or drop off plans. 

• Maintenance plans include checking soil, light wiring, trimming, and fertilizing. Yearly replanting plan includes the traditional unweaving, cleaning, and trimming of roots, new soil and fertilizer, branch trimming, pruning, branch wiring, choice of bigger or different pot (extra fee for new pot), and choice of different layout in pot. 

• There will also be a calendar of classes and workshops available for varying fees that you can sign up for at the trailer or online. 

• We will focus on creating starter packages for the novice that include everything you will need to keep your new Bonsai alive, including fertilizer, tools, guides, and more. 

• Lastly, we will be teaming up with the Austin and San Antonio Bonsai societies to sell locally created products including paintings, pots, ornaments and tools.  

Profit and Loss

SWOT Analysis

Our strategy for targeting each segment of our market is as follows:
•    Novice: We will have a sizeable collection of potted Bonsai that have been prepared, by Daniel, using traditional techniques. Each pot will have a handmade tag, made of balsa wood, listing the species of plant and comes with a pamphlet detailing the needs and care of that species of Bonsai. We will offer numerous ‘starter Bonsai’ and ‘starter kits’ to maximize the potential reach to those new to Bonsai. Recycled boxes will be offered to carry your Bonsai home and there will be plentiful options for those giving the Bonsai as a gift. They can even purchase a variety of maintenance plans and can rest assured that they will have somewhere to turn for questions and concerns.

•    Expert: We will have a sizeable collection of every item a Bonsai enthusiast would need to purchase. Tools in multiple price ranges, various soils for purchase, wire of every size, hard to find tools and items, books, specialty pots, as well as hard to find Bonsai.

•    Foot Traffic: In terms of strategy, this segment is the same as novice. Providing a fun and attractive trailer that makes them want to stop as well as a fun collection of Bonsai and other items for purchase is tantamount.

Strengths

•    A knowledgeable owner who takes great care in creating the Bonsai he sells who has excellent customer service skills.
•    Reliable and dedicated suppliers offering the highest quality raw product at the lowest prices.
•    A strong grasp on how to use social media to increase sales, particularly because the store is 'mobile' and will require frequent updates on where the shop will be located each day.
•    Wandering Bonsai will fill a large Bonsai education gap by offering monthly classes and workshops for anyone interested in learning more about Bonsai.

Weaknesses

•    First time business owner and first time retailer.
•    Success will be based partly on word of mouth and social media exposure.
•    Internet Bonsai retail options are vast and reliable.

Opportunities

With a population of over 2 million in the Austin area, there is no shortage of customers to introduce to the art of Bonsai. Our biggest opportunity is the massive gap in retailers available for local, reliable, and high quality Bonsai and Bonsai supplies. For instance, on certain days of the week, there is only one available retailer within a 45 mile radius of downtown Austin and they only have beginner Bonsai and no supplies.

Threats

•    The possibility of another Bonsai retailer surfacing in the Austin area.
•    Intolerable price increases from suppliers.
•    Drought or inclement weather conditions could significantly decrease interest, availability, or sustainability of the Bonsai trees themselves.

story:
Short Summary

Whether it’s personal, small business or corporate customers, I work to tailor my services to meet your needs. I find ways to do more so that you can do less and enjoy much-needed work/life balance.

Errand Runner/Concierge Services/Personal Assistant/Event Planner Assistant/ Creative Help/Referral and Research Help

When you don’t have enough time…I do!

A little about me my name is Trish. I am a natural born giver who loves to help people in anyway I can. The company name is after my belated father whom has had an major impact on my life by teaching me the importance of servitude. I was born in New Orleans but I have lived in Texas for over 10 years. As a sociology major and graduate from Texas Southern University I truly love people and have a heart for servitude. I spent most my life helping take the stress off of others or giving back to my community.

https://farrellsdaughter.wixsite.com/mysite

What We Need & What You Get

Projection of funds needed.

Business Plan - 425

Advertising & Marketing - 3,000

Petty Cash - 1,000 

Networking Local Event - 1,000

Mailing Address - $106 (year)

Blog editor - $40 per month for (year)

Website and Domain - $500

Mentor - Free 

Total - 6,511

Check out the perks section. 

The Impact

I want to provide new moms, busy professionals, and the community with affordable services and resources that can relieve some of life’s stress. That way I would give them the gift of time, and I would also be supporting my them in a way they never thought an errand service could. I believe that having more work life balance will lengthen people’s lives and add value. I also want to encourage others in the community to help those around them with small task because time is more valuable than money.  

My long term goal is to create a successful business that can also contribute to the community and services members of all social and economic backgrounds.

My father was a self-learned butcher and worked hard all his life. He never had much money but he would give his last to help anyone. He was also very big on making others around him smile and happy in anyway. He put a great deal of value in helping others in anyway possible and has shown me the value of selflessness. I hope to leave that impact on the community around me.

Risks & Challenges

Every business has it's risks and challenges. Even though I have experience in service of all types, I still can't be 100% sure that I will provide all the products that the potential customers need or like. I plan to have a mentor once I have reached my funding goal we will hit the ground running to build a business that will serve the DFW community. 

I will however do my best to listen to the customers and to be attuned to their needs so that I can adapt everything based on their feedback.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Tell your friends and family. Please share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools! If you are in Dallas you can always contact me and ask how you can help!

story:
Short Summary

I'm software professional and son of farmer from Marathwada region of Maharashtra, India. Currently I'm living in Jacksonville, Florida, USA. I've spend my teenage years in village (Tondchir, District Latur) before moving to City (Aurangabad, Maharashtra) for graduation. I know how much hardship farmers go through even when there is proper rain for that year but when there is drought for given year it become much harder. I want to help those farmers who are in dire situation due to third consecutive drought in the region. I'm running NYC Marathon on Nov 1st 2015 and would like to raise fund for helping the needy farmers in Marathwada region. I would be donating raised amount to Naam Foundation lead by Actor and activist Nana Patekar and Makarand Anaspure. More details about the contribution and accountability added at the bottom. 
In Marathwada region of Maharashtra, India it's third consecutive year for drought. It's one of the worst drought in history. This caused more than 600 farmer suicides in 2015 in this region. 

What We Need

I'm looking for funding from anyone who would help by donating some amount to save lives of the farmer impacted by drought. Raised amount will be donated to the Naam Foundation and receipts will be shared with you.

The Impact

There is nothing important than life of a person. Due to hard financial situation farmers are doing suicides and helping hand can save their life. This can help towards small kids of those farmers, widow of farmer who did suicide.

Risks & Challenges

As stated earlier, Entire raised amount will be donated to the Naam Foundation (NGO) started by Nana Patekar and Makarand Anaspure. These two individuals are accomplished Actors / Directors and helping needy farmers and widows of the farmer. Here are few links about their contribution and help to farmers.

How Nana Patekar & Makarand Anaspure are helping the farmers

Nana Patekar & Makrand Anaspure setup Naam Foundation

India Today News about Drought situation and Nana Patekar interview about how they are helping

Other Ways You Can Help

Need help from you to spread the word by sharing the campaign so others can contribute to this cause. Please share on social media, through email, etc.
