I'm running NYC Marathon on Nov 1st 2015 and would like to raise fund for helping the needy farmers in Marathwada region. I would be donating raised amount to Naam Foundation lead by Actor and activist Nana Patekar and Makarand Anaspure. More details about the contribution and accountability added at the bottom. 

In Marathwada region of Maharashtra, India it's third consecutive year for drought. It's one of the worst drought in history. This caused more than 600 farmer suicides in 2015 in this region.    What We Need I'm looking for funding from anyone who would help by donating some amount to save lives of the farmer impacted by drought. Raised amount will be donated to the Naam Foundation and receipts will be shared with you.   The Impact There is nothing important than life of a person. Due to hard financial situation farmers are doing suicides and helping hand can save their life. This can help towards small kids of those farmers, widow of farmer who did suicide.
    Risks & Challenges As stated earlier, Entire raised amount will be donated to the Naam Foundation (NGO) started by Nana Patekar and Makarand Anaspure. These two individuals are accomplished Actors / Directors and helping needy farmers and widows of the farmer. Here are few links about their contribution and help to farmers.
How Nana Patekar & Makarand Anaspure are helping the farmers
Nana Patekar & Makrand Anaspure setup Naam Foundation
India Today News about Drought situation and Nana Patekar interview about how they are helping
Other Ways You Can Help
 Need help from you to spread the word by sharing the campaign so others can contribute to this cause. Please share on social media, through email, etc.

story:
NORSK


We want to give you the opportunity to be almost entirely alone in the middle of wild nature, sheltered within the comfort of your very own lighthouse. But help is needed to make it happen.

Littleisland Lighthouse tower can be fixed and live for another hundred years. Photographer: Lucas Amaral. 

At the edge of the world, a one hundred year old lighthouse tower is standing on a desolate island deteriorating, while the northern lights are dancing above, the Norwegian Sea is rolling in the west and the Lofoten mountains are standing steady in the south. Littleisland Lighthouse  can be fixed and live for another hundred years, for the price of 220.000 Euros.

Available for you. For some people 220.000 Euros might not be an awful lot of money, but for Elena Hansteensen who lives at the lighthouse, it is a lot.

"I bought this lighthouse for a relatively small amount of money, very soon ten years ago. Promising to make it available to other people, I left journalism and humanitarian work around the world in order to focus on this lighthouse project in the middle of the sea. But I didn’t have a lot of savings and had to be creative about how to move on."  

Littleisland seen from the neighboring island with a  view to the Lofoton mountain range in the south. Photographer Julien Carnot.

Help from volunteers. Thanks to around 200 volunteers coming from all over the world, we have now managed to establish a small guest section with two double rooms in the old house of the lighthouse keepers’, an ecologically grown green garden and a herbal land. A very sturdy boat, a floating quay and a boat lift helps making the lighthouse available for people to visit all seasons. A huge solar panel is giving us electricity during summertime, and while awaiting a windmill we are using a diesel generator a couple of hours a day on the darkest days of the year.


Guest Section. There are a few practical challenges to cope with when living alone on an uninhibited island at the edge of the Norwegian Sea. It’s all worth the struggle when guests can come and share this adventure.  We receive guests all year round in our guest section, currently two rooms.

"The very best of tiny hotels" - Travel and Leisure

Here you see one of the rooms in our small guest section, with view to the sea and Lofoton mountains. Photographer: Hector Noguera and Kaitlin Hutchison

"Set to become a cult destination" - Condé Nast Traveller


Lighthouse renovation. The time has now come to renovate the lighthouse tower itself. We want to make it available to you and others who would like to come and live in this hundred year old house. The plan is to turn it into a suite of three small rooms where one person, a couple or a small family could stay for some days. Here you will enjoy the island and the truly unique 360 degrees view to the ocean and the Lofoten mountains. So if you are dreaming of staying a few days at a lighthouse in the middle of the ocean, the idea can come true if you contribute to the renovation of Littleisland Lighthouse Tower.

Northern lights can be seen from September through to April. 
Photographer : Ingebjørg Kårstad 

The renovation project. The lighthouse tower being situated on an island and high up in the rocks makes the renovation more costly and it will be mostly impossible to recoup. However, the Norwegian Cultural Foundation thinks this is a building that should be restored and protected through use. Therefore they give 54.000 Euros to this project. Another Norwegian foundation called ’UNI stiftelsen’, has also given us a grant of 11.000 Euros. But we still need more equity to be able to start this unique renovation project. Your support will therefore be very valuable! And we would like to thank you by giving you something in return. Please take a look at the perks on the side bar and check out if you want to go for one of them. All supporters' names will be featured on our webpage, if you allow us. You will be contacted about this.

Illustration of the two upper floors of the lighthouse tower and how they might be after the renovation. Drawings by Tuuli Köller. 

Where will the money go? The lighthouse tower has suffered from serious water leakages over several years.  Cracks in the balcony will be covered. The metal part of the tower is rusty and needs sanding. Then the metal will be galvanised before it is painted. All the windows in the glass top must be changed. For most of this we need professional help. Then we can work on the indoor; new floor, walls and insulation, bathroom to be made and a heating system installed. Some of this can be done on a volunteer basis but most has to be done by professionals. 

The Norwegian Cultural Foundation thinks this is a building that should be restored and protected through use. They help out with 54.000 Euros. Photographer: Hector Noguera and Kait Hutchison. 


Watercolor paintings of the lighthouse tower by Tuuli Köller, are offered as a perk.

Follow through live cam. Given that we get the financial help needed, the work is planned to start spring 2016. The lighthouse tower would then be ready to live in the summer season of 2017. If we don't receive all the money needed we will go for the exterio renovation first, in order to reduce further damage of the building. The lighthouse owner, Elena, is ready to take up a private loan for the difference between the gifts, the grants and the costs. But the more help we get the easier it will be to take up a loan for the rest. You will be able to follow the work in progress online through an outdoor camera, which is to be set up when the work starts. We will also update all financial contributors with regular newsletters.  


Video by Mihai Gideon


Norsk.

Vi ønsker å gi deg muligheten til å bo i toppen av et fyrtårn ytterst i havgapet. Men vi trenger litt hjelp for å få det til.


Litløy fyr kan renoveres og settes istand til å vare i nye hundre år. Foto: Lucas Amaral.

På ei øde øy står et hundre år gammelt fyrtårn og forvitrer mens nordlyset danser over, Norskehavet bølger i vest og Lofotfjella står stødige i sør.  Den gode nyheten er at det kan settes istand. For to millioner kroner kan Litløy fyr stå i nye hundre år. 

Tilgjengelig for deg. To millioner kroner er kanskje ikke så voldsomt mye penger for enkelte. Men for Ellen Marie Hansteensen som bor på Litløy fyr er det mye.

"Jeg kjøpte fyret for en relativt liten sum, for snart ti år siden. Planen var helt fra starten å gjøre fyret tilgjengelig for andre slik at flere enn meg kunne nyte denne spesielle plassen. Så jeg forlot journalistjobb og humanitært arbeide for å fokusere på dette fyrprosjektet i havgapet. Men uten oppsparte midler ble det nødvendig å tenke kreativt for å komme videre."

Litløya sett fra naboøya med utsikt mot Lofotveggen i sør. Foto: Julien Carnot

Verdifull hjelp fra dugnadsgjester. Takket være omlag 200 frivillige som har kommet fra hele verden gjennom disse årene, har Litløy fyr i dag en liten gjesteavdeling på to dobbeltrom i den gamle fyrvokterboligen. Vi har også et hageanlegg og dyrker økologiske urter og grønnsaker. En svært sjøsikker og trygg båt, samt flytebrygge og båtheis gjør det mulig for gjester å besøke Litløy fyr hele året. Et stort solcellepanel gir oss strøm i sommerhalvåret. Vinterhalvåret må vi bruke dieselgenerator et par timer om dagen, inntil vi kan sette opp en vindmølle.




Gjesteavdeling.  Det er noen praktiske utfordringer som skal løses når man bor alene på ei øy i havgapet. Men når gjestene kommer og nyter denne eventyrlige plassen er det verdt arbeidet. Vi tar imot gjester hele året i gjesteavdelingen som består av to dobbeltrom.  

"Små hoteller - store opplevelser" Politiken.dk

Her ser du ett av våre to gjesterom, med utsikt til havet og Lofotfjella i sør. Foto:  Kaitlin Hutchison og Hector Noguera.


"Set to become a cult destination" - Condé Nast Traveller


Fyrtårnsrenovering. Tiden har nå kommet til å renovere selve fyrtårnet. Vi ønsker å gjøre det mulig for gjester å bo også der. Planen er at det skal bli en helt unik plass å bo for en person, et par eller en liten familie, i ei natt eller fler.  Fra fyrtårnet kan du ta innover deg 360 graders utsikt over hav og fjell. Dersom du synes tanken om å bo noen dager i et fyrtårn ytterst i havgapet høres spennende ut, kan den bli virkelighet dersom du bidrar til renoveringen av fyrtårnet på Litløy.

 Nordlyset kan ses fra september til april. Foto: Ingebjørg Kårstad. 

Fyrtårnsprosjektet. Fyrets plassering på ei øy og høyt oppe på en fjellknaus fordyrer restaureringsprosjektet og gjør det svært vanskelig å tjene inn omkostningene. Men Norsk Kulturminnefond mener Litløy fyr bør settes istand og bevares gjennom bruk. De har derfor bevilget 500.000 kroner til renoveringen av fyrtårnet. UNI-stiftelsen har også gitt oss tilsagn om støtte, på 100.000 kroner. Vi trenger likevel mer egenkapital for å kunne gå i gang med dette unike prosjektet. Din støtte vil derfor være svært verdifull! Vi ønsker å takke deg for bidraget ved å gi deg noe tilbake. Ta en titt på tilbudene i kolonnen til høyre og se om du finner noe av interesse. Navnene på dere som støtter oss vil publiseres på våre hjemmesider, om dere tillater det. Du vil bli kontaktet. 



Illustrasjon av de to høyeste etasjene på fyrtårnet og hvordan det kan bli etter restaureringen. Tegninger av Tuuli Köller.


Hva går pengene til? Fyrtårnet er i dag preget av store fuktskader som har forverret seg over flere år. Sprekker i betongen skal tettes. Alle metalldeler på tårnet er rustne og trenger først å sandblåses. Deretter skal metallet galvaniseres før alt blir malt. Alle vinduene i glasstoppen må skiftes. Alt dette arbeidet må utføres av profesjonelle. Etterpå kan vi begynne å jobbe med det innvendige; nye gulv, isolere, lage bad og oppvarmingsanlegg. Enkelte ting kan gjøres på dugnad, men profesjonelle må utføre mesteparten av dette arbeidet også. 


Norsk Kulturminnefond mener Litløy fyr bør settes istand og bevares gjennom bruk. De har derfor bevilget 500.000 kroner til renoveringen av fyrtårnet. Foto: Hector Noguera og Kait Hutchison. 

Akvarell av fyrtårnet, malt av Tuuli Köller, er en av gavene vi ønsker å gi deg for din støtte. Se mer i kolonnen til høyre.

Følg oss direkte på webcam. Gitt at vi får den pengestøtten vi trenger så starter arbeidet våren 2016. Da blir fyrtårnet klart til å ta imot overnattingsgjester sommeren 2017. Dersom vi ikke får alt vi trenger, vil vi fokusere på den utvendige istandsettingen først, for å hindre mer skade på fyrtårnet. Fyreier, Ellen Marie, vil ta opp privatlån på differensen mellom bidrag og kostnader. Du kan følge arbeidet underveis online på webcam som vi setter opp når arbeidet starter. Vi kommer også til å oppdatere alle bidragsytere med jevnlige nyhetsbrev.

story:
Grassy Roots Pharmacy & Nutrition: Buy a Meal, Save a Life Campaign


The “Buy a meal, Save a life” campaign stems from a core principle embedded in the Grassy Roots Pharmacy & Nutrition business model and that is to help people. The global goal of this project is to create a company designed to help patients' take control of their health while at the same time create a sustainable philanthropy service in local communities. The philanthropy portion of the company is built in the core business model, and our target niche for the company will be for the under-served population who are either homeless or in extreme poverty that are released from the hospital and lost to followup. These patients often end up back in the hospital because they have nowhere to get the care they need to stay healthy. The philanthropy portion of the company will be directly funded from the proceeds from patient’s subscriptions to the program, which will be sold by weekly and monthly basis, and will be tiered and priced based on the amount of meals and days that meals are provided. An example of how this will work: for every 10 subscriptions of a 5 day meal plan purchased, they will sponsor a meal plan and medications for a person in need. Participants in the program will receive updates on those people that they are contributing to help. 



In a nutshell, Grassy Roots is providing pharmacy services with an additional meal service that trains patients to cook for themselves with ingredients and recipes specific to their health needs. The nutrition service is a subscription based program that provides guidance, hands on experience, and tailored plans for patients that have multiple disease states that require diet restrictions such as diabetes and heart failure. The pharmacy services include medication therapy management, patient education, personalized medication logs, adherence tools, patient financial assistance, and many other services. 

One of the first goals Grassy Roots is setting to achieve is to prove the company can improve patients' health outcomes. Improving health outcomes can be measured in many forms including maintaining better disease control, less hospitalizations, and increasing a patient's quality of life. Part of the contributions made to this campaign will fund a study that will follow a small cohort of patients enrolled into our program over several months. If the results of the study prove that our program improves patient outcomes, it can open opportunities for negotiations  and contracts with insurance companies to help pay for the program in the forms of co-pays or co-insurance.




The Grassy Roots donation structure aims to reward our contributors in a way that is reflected in our core principle of helping others. For every donation over $50, you will not only be helping build a company that aims to help patients take control over their health, but you will also sponsor a person in need in the form of care packages. Care packages are formulated by going out into the streets and asking people what they need most. Some examples include undergarments, socks, hygiene products, food, bus passes, and materials to help get a job interview. We have started going out to help the homeless in Nashville and have posted some of the interviews on the Grassy Roots Facebook page. The Grassy Roots Facebook page will serve as a forum to share how your donations are directly affecting peoples lives. We hope to add hundreds of these videos as we get contributions to the campaign.


 

GRASSY ROOTS FACEBOOK PAGE:      

https://www.facebook.com/grassyroots







COMPANY SNAPSHOT


Project Background

About the creator: Bryan Davis


I am a pharmacy student at a small Christian school in Nashville, Tennessee. I am in my last year of pharmacy school and have been searching for a way to help patients beyond filling their prescriptions. My plan is to rebuild the patient-pharmacist relationship through offering services that will help support lifestyle changes and provide dialog that will hopefully lead to trust. My experience with patients is that if you give the time to figure who they are, what makes them happy, how they go through their day to day, you can help them create a tailored plan for their health that suits their needs. This is not only beneficial to the patients, but society as a whole as we avoid unnecessary hospitalizations costing billions in healthcare costs. My personal aspirations are not only to start a company that helps patients, but can also fund charitable acts to help people in need that may not have access to food and healthcare.


SUPPORTING TEAM MEMBERS



Funding Goals


Stage 1: Local Proof of Concept

Primary Goal:  Menu Development and Patient Cohort Study 

GOAL: $10,000             Nashville Primary (or other select city)


THIS WILL ALSO FUND $1000 to CHARITABLE DONATIONS




Donation Rewards


For All donations:

View stories and pictures of patients and their families helped throughout the timeline of the project through our Facebook page.

Donation rewards will be sent at end of the campaign.


Donations:  $25 or more  (#BUYAMEALSAVEALIFE)

  • Touchscreen compatible gloves are sent to you
  • Film yourself giving a meal or care package to a person in need
  • Post your film on our Facebook page and enter for a chance to win an Ipad Mini!



Donations: $50 or more (THE GIVER)

  • A care package of hygiene products and winter wear will be donated
  • Your donation will be filmed and posted on our Facebook page

story_txt:
Grassy Roots Pharmacy & Nutrition: Buy a Meal, Save a Life Campaign



The “Buy a meal, Save a life” campaign
stems from a core principle embedded in the Grassy Roots Pharmacy &
Nutrition business model and that is to help people. The global goal of this
project is to create a company designed to help patients' take control of their
health while at the same time create a sustainable philanthropy service in local communities. The philanthropy portion of
the company is built in the core business model, and our target niche for the company will be for the under-served population who are either homeless or in extreme poverty that are released from the hospital and lost to followup. These patients often end up back in the hospital because they have nowhere to get the care they need to stay healthy. The philanthropy portion of the
company will be directly funded from the proceeds from patient’s
subscriptions to the program, which will be sold by weekly
and monthly basis, and will be tiered and priced based on the amount of meals
and days that meals are provided. An example of how this will work: for every
10 subscriptions of a 5 day meal plan purchased, they will sponsor a meal plan and medications
for a person in need. Participants in the program will receive updates on those people that they are contributing to help. 






In a nutshell, Grassy Roots is providing pharmacy services with an additional meal service
that trains patients to cook for themselves with ingredients and recipes specific to their health
needs. The nutrition service is a subscription based program that provides guidance, hands on experience, and tailored plans for patients that have multiple
disease states that require diet restrictions such as diabetes and heart failure. The pharmacy services include medication therapy management, patient education, personalized medication logs, adherence tools, patient financial assistance, and many other services. 



One of the first goals Grassy Roots is
setting to achieve is to prove the company can improve patients' health outcomes. Improving health outcomes can be measured in many forms including maintaining better disease control, less hospitalizations, and increasing a patient's quality of life. Part of the contributions made to this campaign will fund a study that will follow a small cohort of patients enrolled into our program over several months. If the results of the study prove that our program improves patient outcomes, it can open opportunities for negotiations  and contracts with insurance companies to help pay
for the program in the forms of co-pays or co-insurance. 


The Grassy Roots donation structure aims to reward our contributors in a way that is reflected in our core principle of helping others. For every donation over $50, you will not only be helping build a company that aims to help patients take control over their health, but you will also sponsor a person in need in the form of care packages. Care packages are formulated by going out into the streets and asking people what they need most. Some examples include undergarments, socks, hygiene products, food, bus passes, and materials to help get a job interview. We have started going out to help the homeless in Nashville and have posted some of the interviews on the Grassy Roots Facebook page. The Grassy Roots Facebook page will serve as a forum to share how your donations are directly affecting peoples lives. We hope to add hundreds of these videos as we get contributions to the campaign. 


 GRASSY ROOTS FACEBOOK PAGE:      

https://www.facebook.com/grassyroots








COMPANY SNAPSHOT






Project
Background
About the creator: Bryan Davis
I am
a pharmacy student at a small Christian school in Nashville, Tennessee. I am in
my last year of pharmacy school and have been searching for a way to help
patients beyond filling their prescriptions. My plan is to rebuild the
patient-pharmacist relationship through offering services that will help
support lifestyle changes and provide dialog that will hopefully lead to trust.
My experience with patients is that if you give the time to figure who they
are, what makes them happy, how they go through their day to day, you can help
them create a tailored plan for their health that suits their needs. This is
not only beneficial to the patients, but society as a whole as we avoid
unnecessary hospitalizations costing billions in healthcare costs. My personal
aspirations are not only to start a company that helps patients, but can also
fund charitable acts to help people in need that may not have access to food
and healthcare. SUPPORTING TEAM MEMBERSFunding
